loans.name: Román Alcides

texts.es:
Román es un joven muy luchador de 28 años de edad, por motivos económicos no pudo estudiar, ya que su familia no tenia los recursos para darle la oportunidad, por eso tuvo que incorporarse a las actividades productivas a temprana edad.  Él esta casado, su esposa realiza los quehaceres del hogar y le ayuda también en las actividades agrícolas, tienen tres hijos, ellos se encuentran estudiando.

Román realiza jornales en la elaboración de teja, en tejeras del cantón y también en época seca (verano) tiene su propio negocio de teja, ademas, trabaja en la agricultura en la época lluviosa.

En el negocio de teja tiene mucha experiencia, trabaja en esto desde que recuerda, su padre fue quien le enseño el oficio , al cual agradece, porque es de esta actividad productiva con la que lleva el sustento a su  familia. Trabaja de lunes a sábado; de 7:30am a 4:30pm. En el negocio le ayuda un hermano.
El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de insumos( barro, tierra blanca, zacate, leña, entre otros materiales, que son necesarios para la elaboración de teja. En esta época seca, es la idónea para la elaboración, ademas ya cuenta con pedidos de clientes. Para aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presenta, ademas,  este año necesita reparar el horno que esta en malas condiciones, en este realiza  ¨el quemado¨ de las tejas. 
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio de tejas, comprar un vehículo con el cual poder transporta los pedidos, facilitando la comercialización y también le generaría mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Roman is a 28 year old young man who was not able to attend school due to financial reasons.  His family did not have the resources to provide him the opportunity so he had to go to work at an early age.  He is married and his wife does the housework and helps him with his farming.  They have three children and they are in school.

Roman makes tiles at local factories and during the dry season (summer) he has his own tile business.  He also farms during the rainy season.

He has lots of experience in the tile business and has been working on this as long as he can remember.  His father taught him the trade and he is grateful because this is how he supports his family.  He works Monday through Saturday from 7:30 am to 4:30 pm.  His brother helps him.

He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies (clay, white dirt, sod, firewood, and other things he needs).  This dry season is the perfect time for making tiles.  He also tells us that he has customer orders.  He also needs to repair his kiln which is in bad shape.  This is where he fires his tiles.

His dream is to expand his business, buy a vehicle so he can transport his orders, making his sales easier and also generating more income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Trabajadora  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, son un grupo nuevo que tiene sus esperanzas puestas de que, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo en grupo  y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa podrán ir mejorando sus vidas.
Soledad es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y comenta que al principio le costó un poco empezar con su negocio, pero que se fue abriendo camino y hoy ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella. Es muy emprendedora y quiere seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Sueña con poder mejorar su negocio y tener más variedad de bebidas que ofrecer.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás, y de esta forma seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Trabajadora, or Working Women, is in its first program cycle of the women's committee. They are a new group that has their hopes that through its effort and ongoing group work and the application of the vital conduct of a successful woman, they will be able to improve their lives.

Soledad is part of this group. She sells drinks for a living. She says that it took a while to start the business, but that it opened the door and today she already has good customers that always buy from her. She is very entrepreneurial and wants to continue helping her family with her work. She dreams of the power to improve her business and to have a greater variety of drinks to offer.
She is requesting this loan to buy drinks, wine, beer, etc. and in this way continue with her sales and working to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy soda, wine, beer, and other drinks.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Кундуз - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кундуз занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кундуз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 нетель, 2 бычка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кундуз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Kunduz is 41 and married with five children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two milking cows, one heifer and two steers, with a monthly income of 12,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Kunduz has turned to bank Bai Tushum for a loan to purchase steers to increase her head count. She plans to use profits from the loan to further augment the size of her herd, and to save toward her children's education.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Santíago

texts.es:
Santiago, solo estudio 6° grado, ya que sus padres lo utilizaban mucho para trabajar, no lo mandaban a la escuela, esta casado y solo vive con su esposa y dos nietos, su esposa tiene un molino de nixtamal y una pequeña tienda.

Santiago, tiene 20 años de experiencia en el manejo de ganado de repasto y cultivo de maíz, aprendió el oficio, ya que era empleado en una cooperativa y fue aprendiendo, hasta que empezó a criar sus propios animales,para ello tiene que llevarlos al potrero todos los días por la mañana y por la tarde va a traerlos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 3 novillos de engorde en repasto y venderlos después de unos meses, para obtener algunos ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia.

Élplanea ahorrar, para terminar de construir su casa y que su familia pueda tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Santiago only studied up to the sixth grade; his parents didn't send him to school because they often made use of him to work.  He's married and lives only with his wife and two grandchildren.  His wife has a corn mill and a small store.

Santiago has 20 years of experience growing corn and raising cattle for grazing.  He learned the trade as an employee of a cooperative, learning until he started raising his own animals.  He has to take his animals to the pasture every morning and back home in the afternoon.

He's requesting a loan from CrediCampo to buy three young cows to fatten in the pasture and sell in a few months.  That way he'll earn an income to support his family.

Santiago plans to save money and finish building his house so his family can have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy three young cows to raise

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Comité San Juan, de la zona de San Ignacio, se encuentra en el 18º ciclo, hace ya bastante tiempo vienen trabajando con la institución, todas cuentan con su actividad comercial en distintos rubros, este grupo con el tiempo ha sido solido, y cuentan con valores como la solidaridad y el compañerismo ya instalado entre ellas, desean seguir creciendo y contar siempre con el apoyo del programa de comité.
La Sra. Rosa es la presidenta del grupo, cuenta con una despensa bien surtida en su barrio, y con su familia trabaja en el, poniendo su esfuerzo y trabajo diario por un mejor porvenir para toda su familia. Se destaca por ser muy activa y ya que siempre quiere capacitarse para mejorar.
La Sra. Solicita  este préstamo para la compra de bebidas, verduras, frutas, condimentos, enlatados y demás para su negocio, tiene clientela formada se esmera en que sus clientes queden conformes y se gana la fidelidad de los mismos con cada Venta que realiza.
texts.en:
The committee named “San Juan” is from the District of San Ignacio. The members are in their 18th loan cycle and have worked with Fundación Paraguaya for a long time. All of them engage in different business activities. The group has gotten stronger over time and has displayed values such as solidarity and camaraderie. They want to continue growing and receiving the constant support of the Committee Program.

Sra. Rosa is the group president. She operates a well-stocked food pantry in her neighborhood. Rosa and her family manage the business together. Through her work and daily efforts, she hopes to provide a better future for her entire family. Rosa is known for being very active and always wants to receive training so that she can improve.

Sra. Rosa is requesting a loan in order to buy beverages, vegetables, fruits, condiments, canned goods, and other products for her business. She has established customers, so she wants to keep them satisfied and gain their loyalty with every sale she makes.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetables, fruits, condiments, canned goods, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.en:
Marjona was born in 1982. She is married and has three children. Her children are 5, 8 and 12 years old. Two of them go to school.  Eight years ago, Marjona began her own business with animal husbandry. She raises cows, sheep and goats. Marjona has a big cowshed in her house. She grows feed for cattle in her own land. She never buys feed for cattle.

Marjona is going to increase her working capital and in this way maximize her profit. She is asking for a loan of 1500 USD to buy sheep and goats. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats to increase working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 33-year-old hardworking lady, married to Reuben. She is mother of three children. Her husband brings in additional income from his taxi business. Their children are aged 14, 9 and 6. Josephine earns her income from a money transfer business which she has been running for the last two and a half years with a monthly income of Kes 20,000. She learnt about VisionFund Kenya through a marketing clinic in her area.

Josephine has been advanced her first loan of Kes 62,000, which she will use to pay high school fees for her son. She will use the proceeds from the business to repay her loan.

Her dream is to see her children progress to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to pay high school tuition for her son

loans.name: Koeun's Group

texts.en:
A 41-year-old mother of four kids and a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Koeun is a local farmer who grows rice as the main source of her income. She can earn extra income from her spare time job as a paid-worker.  Koeun has been involved in her current business for 11 years.  She is a third-time borrower and her co-borrower is a fourth-time borrower, in the same group of two requesting 1,000,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which Koeun has repaid has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle. Now, she is a group leader. 

Koeun will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, gasoline, and to pay labor fees. She hopes that she will receive a double yield compared to earlier years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and gasoline, and to pay labor fee

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: Albertina, tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijas y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Cortes. Ella trabajo por varios años en una maquila y al no tener empleo decidió poner su negocio propio donde vende refrescos de botella, este negocio lo tiene en su casa hace un año. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir de refrescos de botella para aumentar las ventas y los ingresos. Su sueño que su negocio crezca y poder ayudar mas a su familia.
texts.en:
Albertina is 48 years old, married, and has two daughters. She resides in a neighborhood in the town of Cortes.

Albertina worked at a factory for several years, but when she lost her job, she decided to open her own business where she sells bottled soft drinks. She has managed this business from her house for the past year.

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 10,000 HNL and will be used to restock her inventory of bottled soft drinks so that she can increase her sales and her earnings. Her dream is to grow her business so that she can provide more support for her family.

loans.use: to buy bottled soft drinks.

loans.name: Anor

texts.ru:
Анор добродушная и ответственная женщина в возрасте 55 лет, она  замужем и имеет 4 детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Анор живёт в сельской местности, возле гор. Семья Анор очень дружная, каждый пытается делать что-то, чтобы приносить в дом доход. Сама Анор занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота и переработкой молока. Молоко у нее всегда свое, а часть она продаёт соседям. Муж Анор – пенсионер, но он тоже не сидит без дела, а помогает ей вести хозяйство и присматривать за скотом. Он в основном занимается продажей скота (выводит скот на рынок). Сыновья тоже помогают родителям. 

Сейчас Анор обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку ещё несколько голов скота для дальнейшего откорма. Своих средств на покупку у неё не хватает, а бизнес нужно расширять, чтобы иметь больше дохода. На полученный кредит Анор хочет увеличить поголовье скота. Она заранее благодарна Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Anor is a kindhearted and responsible woman of 55. She lives with her husband and four children in a rural area near the mountains. Anor's family is very harmonious - everyone tries to do something to bring income into the home. Anor herself works fattening and selling livestock and processing milk. She always has her own milk and then sells a percentage to the neighbours. Anor's husband is on a pension, but he doesn't sit around doing nothing either - he helps her take care of the farm and look after the animals. His main job is to take the livestock to the market and sell them. Her sons also help their parents.

Anor has turned to Arvand as she wants a loan to purchase a few more head of livestock to fatten. She doesn't have the means to purchase them herself, but she needs to expand the business in order to increase revenue. She wants to purchase livestock with the loan money. She thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Cajata Pampa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUENA ESPARANZA CAJATA PAMPA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, tejido de chompas, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de ganado, venta de detergentes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de detergentes; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprender por recomendación de sus amigas quienes tienen el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de detergentes) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Buena Esparanza Cajata Pampa” is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Carmen is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as weaving blankets, weaving sweaters, selling vegetables, selling food, selling livestock, and selling detergents.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Carmen. She says that this is her second year with Pro Mujer. Carmen joined after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who came to her house to visit her. She currently has a business of selling detergents. Carmen has become more knowledgeable about this business since her friends who were in the same line of work recommended that she start it.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying detergents. She will acquire her products from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and then sell them from her retail space. Working in this manner will enable her to generate income for supporting her family. Carmen is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Carmen said that she enjoys the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy detergents.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 33 years old, married to David, and together they are blessed with three children aged between 13 and two-and-a-half years old.

She is in a business of selling ice cream in Naivasha, which she has been running for ten years and she has applied for her second loan from Vision Fund to enable her to pay school fees. With profit from her business, she plans to repay the loan and expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to see her children well educated.

loans.use: To  pay school fees.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is a man of fifty-three years, married to Regina, and a father of four children. He is a newspaper vendor in the high rise area on the outskirts of Kangemi. He has been in this business for twenty-five years and gets a monthly income of eleven thousand shillings.

This will be Jason's first loan with Vision Fund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to add to his newspaper stock. He wants to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers for sale

loans.name: Martin Yeral

texts.es: Don Martin es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz, Trigo y Frijoles. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro mejorar la infraestructura del potrero de sus animales. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Alambre de Púa y Grapas. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Martín is from the city of Boaco.  He's a farmer who grows corn, wheat, and beans.  He's grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he was able to improve the infrastructure of his animals' pasture.

Martín's requesting a new loan to buy barbed wire and staples.  He thinks the loan will be a big help to him for improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire and staples

loans.name: José Remigio Antonio

texts.es:
José de 60 años de edad,es un hombre que se ha esforzado mucho y sigue luchando día con día por su familia, pudo estudiar segundo grado de educación básica, gracias a su empeño a logrado salir adelante. Esta casado, su señora realiza oficios del hogar. De sus 6 hijos, solamente dos viven con él,estos están estudiando; los mayores ya formaron su propio hogar.

Aprendió el oficio de albañilería gracias a su padre, realiza esta labor desde hace 35 años, gracias a todos estos años de experiencia, surgen muchas oportunidades de trabajo, ya  que es bien conocido en la zona, también realiza trabajos en diferentes partes del país, teniendo que viajar varios kilómetros, pero que valen la pena, si es por llevar el sustento a su familia, ademas, tiene conocimientos en trabajos de instalación eléctrica, pero es muy poca la demanda.
El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de un automóvil usado, este con el objetivo de transportarse, trasladar materiales y llevar  herramientas cuando le surgen trabajos lejos de donde él vive. tiene unos ahorros, pero no son suficiente para adquirirlo, por tal motivo ha decidido realizar el préstamo.

Desea tener una empresa de construcción, donde pueda generar empleo a otras personas que lo necesitan y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando, pudiendo así tener un futuro con mas oportunidades para ellos.
texts.en:
Jose is 60 years old and is a hardworking man who continues to strive for his family each day.  He has a second grade education, thanks to his striving to get ahead.  He is married and his wife works in the home.  Only two of his six children still live with them; both of them are in school.  The oldest ones have homes of their own.

He learned masonry thanks to his father and he has been working the trade for 35 years.  Thanks to all those years of experience, he has had many work opportunities, since he is well known in the area and he also works in different parts of the country.  He has to travel many kilometers but it’s worth it to support his family.  He also knows about electrical installations, but there is low demand.

He will use the money from this loan to buy a used car so he can transport materials and tools whenever he has distant work.  He has some savings but not enough to buy it.  He has decided to ask for this loan.

He wants to have a construction company where he can create jobs for others who need work.  He also wants his children to stay in school so they can have a better future with more opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs in order to butcher them.

loans.name: Virginia Victoria

texts.es: Doña Virginia es una señora de 53 años de edad, habita en un municipio lejano a la capital Managua, se dedica a un pequeño negocio de pulpería que ha formado junto a su esposo quien es albañil, a si ambos sostienen sus gastos del hogar siendo sus hijos ya independientes solamente se apoyan ella con su esposo. Virginia requiere de este crédito para seguir invirtiendo en la venta comprando productos como granos básicos, lácteos, pollo, carne, productos de limpieza  personal y del hogar.
texts.en:
Virginia, 53, lives in a town far from Managua, the capital.  She makes a living with a small grocery store she runs with her husband, a bricklayer.  This way they cover their household expenses together.  Their children are already grown; only Virginia and her husband support each other.

Virginia needs this loan to continue investing in her store by buying basic grains, dairy products, chicken, meat, personal hygiene products, cleaning supplies, and other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, chicken, meat, personal hygiene products, cleaning supplies, and other products

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es:
Ana de 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de poder ir a la escuela, se caso y su esposo trabaja en construcción en otro país como ayudante, solo dos de sus hijos están con ella, una se graduado de bachiller en el año dos mil doce y la otra este año, el varón emigro a estados unidos con su padre. Ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frijoles solo para el consumo de su familia. Paga mano de obra para realizar sus cultivos, además cuida dos vacas de las que obtiene leche.

Con el préstamo solicitado se pagara la colegiatura utiles, uniforme y equipo de su hija quiere seguir estudiando quiere ser enfermera. Esa fue la razón de solicitar el préstamo, porque ya la última hora pensó en seguir estudiando, la hija de la cliente podrá ingresar a la universidad y cumplir sus sueños.
 Ana está feliz y dice que la apoyara en todo quiere que su hija sea una profesional y tenga la oportunidad que ella no tuvo por ser de una familia de pocos recursos y muy numerosa.
texts.en:
Ana, 58, never had the opportunity to go to school. She married and her husband works in construction in another country as a helper. Only two of her children are with her, one graduated from high school in 2012 and the other this year. The boy emigrated to the US with his father. She works in agriculture, planting corn and beans only for the consumption of the family. She pays for labor to carry out her crops. Additionally, she cares for two cows from which she obtains milk.

With the loan applied for, she will pay for tuition, supplies, uniform and equipment for her daughter who wants to continue studying to be a nurse. This was the reason that she applied for this loan, because at the last minute she decided to continue studying. The daughter of the client will be able to enter the university and realize her dreams. Ana is happy and says that she will help her in everything that her daughter wants so that she can be a professional and have the opportunity that she didn't have as she was from a very large family with few resources.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, supplies, uniform and equipment for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his production and offer a wider variety of snacks to his customers.

loans.name: Luís Orlando

texts.es:
Luis de 68 años de edad,  se dedica a la agricultura en pequeño y lleva acabo esta actividad desde hace 53 años, se creció con sus padres y fue de ellos que aprendió a trabajar la agricultura principalmente en la siembra de granos básicos, maíz, frijoles y maicillo de esta manera lleva el sustento diario a su familia, que esta compuesta por su esposa, con la cual cumplen 50 años de casados y juntos son padres de 2 hijos uno de ellos se encuentra en los Estados Unidos ya es independiente, y su hija se encuentra realizando sus estudios universitarios.
  

El dinero sera invertido, para pago de matricula y compra de material y útiles escolares de su hija, ya que se encuentra próxima la fecha de ingreso a clases, de esta manera podrá segurar el cumplimiento del derecho a la educación de su hija y podrá contribuir en la mejora de calidad de vida de su familia, porque dentro de poco tiempo tendrán un ingreso mas generado por su hija cuando se encuentre laborando.


Los planes que tiene para un futuro, son las de continuar trabajando en la agricultura ampliando su producción y sembrando otro tipo de granos. Ademas, manifiesta que esta adquiriendo información para trabajar y hacer un estanque de peses que le servirán para el consumo y el comercio.
texts.en:
Luis, 68, works in small agriculture and has been doing this activity for 53 years. He grew up with his parents and it was from them that he learned to work agriculture, principally in the planting of basic grants: corn, beans and sorghum. In this manner, he brings home the daily sustenance to his family, which is made up of his wife, with whom he has 50 years of marriage. Together they are the parents of two children, one of whom is in the US since he is independent, and their daughter, who is carrying out university studies.

The money will be invested in order to pay for tuition and the purchase of school materials and supplies for his daughter, since classes are starting soon. In this manner, he will be able to assure the fulfillment of the right to education of his daughter and will be able to contribute in improving the quality of life of his family. In just a short time they will have additional income generated by their daughter when she finds work.

The plans that he has for the future are to continue working in agriculture, growing his production and sowing other types of grains. Additionally, he says that he is acquiring information to work and make a fish tank, which will serve him for consumption and business.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and the purchase of school materials and supplies for his daughter, since classes are starting soon.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en: Farhod was born in 1982. He is married and has two children. Ten years ago, Farhod began his own business. He is a builder. Farhod services the local people to build a house or shop. He is a good experienced builder. Farhod is the only income earner of his family because his wife is a housewife. His parents also live with him. They are pensioners. Farhod is going to repair his house as his house is in bad condition. Farhod is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy building materials such as cement, wood and paints for repairing his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint to repair his house

loans.name: Carmen Amabel

texts.es:
Carmen de 50 años de edad estudio hasta sexto grado, ya que su padre fallecio y en ver la necesidad que tenian decidio abandonar la escuela y empezar a trabajar, para ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar y que terminara de criar a sus hermanitos. Carmen nunca se acompaño y no tienen hijos. Vive junto con una sobrina y los dos hijos de ella, aunque no depende de ella.


Carmen en una mujer luchadora con muchos deceos de superarse, desde que abandono la escuela inicio a trabajar en una tortilleria, a la edad de 15 años, trabajo por diez años, luego su madre logro poner una pequeña tienda en su casa, desgraciadamente fallecio al poco tiempo y fue asi como Carmen, continuo con el pequeño negocio que su madre con mucho sacrificio y dedicacion pudo tener. Han pasado 20 años desde que su madre fallecio y el negocio se a mantenido funcionando durante este tiempo.

El prestamo sera invertir en la tienda para doder continuar con el negocio que su madre inicio. Asi podra tener su fuente de ingresos activa, y a la vez el negocio que es un recuerdo que tiene de la persona mas especial, seguira presente por mucho tiempo al servicio de los clientes.

Carmen tiene la ilusión de ver crecer el negocio, con el credito podra tener mas productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes, ademas de esto siempre quizo tener una venta de ropa, y sabe que si todo le sale como lo a planificado, podra ver cumplida  sus deseos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 50, studied until sixth grade, since her father passed away. In seeing the need, she decided to abandon school and start working to help her mother with the expenses of the home. She wound up raising her younger siblings. Carmen never married and does not have children. She lives with a niece and her niece's two children, although they do not depend on her.

Carmen is a very enterprising woman with much desire to better herself. When she abandoned school, she started working in a tortilla shop at the age of 15. She worked for ten years, later her mother achieved putting a small store in her house. Unfortunately, she passed away in little time and this is how Carmen continued with the small business that her mother, which much sacrifice and dedication, could have. Twenty years have passed since her mother passed away and the business has maintained itself during this time.

The loan will be invested in the store to be able to continue with the business that her mother started. Thus, she will be able to have her source of active income, and at the same time, the business is a memory that she has of the most special person. She will stay present for much time at the service of her customers.

Carmen has the illusion of seeing the business grow. With the loan, she will be able to have more products to offer to her clients. Additionally, she always wanted to have a clothing store, and she knows that if all goes as planned, she will be able to see her dreams fulfilled.

loans.use: to stock the store with staple goods.

loans.name: Chanthea

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Koh Sotin district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Chanthea is 44 years old and married. She has struggled to feed her four children by farming rice and growing corn for 24 years. To supplement the family’s income, she has been working for others, for a fee. The current business earns her about USD 10 per day. 

This is Chanthea’s first loan with VisionFund Cambodia. She is requesting a loan to pay tuition fees for her son’s university. She hopes this loan will keep her son in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son’s university.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sagrado Corazón de Jesús está en su ciclo número 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su primera  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está trabajando duro y luchando en su pequeño negocio que es una despensa y el cual es el sustento de la casa.
La Sra. Maria Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, bebidas, lácteos, panificados, hortalizas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Sagrado Corazón de Jesús (Sacred Heart of Jesus) is in its 7th loan cycle of the committee of women where all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing a survey of the elimination of poverty and four of the ladies are below the poverty line with very low incomes.

One of the members is Maria who in her first survey showed a level of poverty in the second level. Through effort, continued work and applying the vital behaviors of a successful woman, she finds herself improving her situation of poverty. At the same time she is working hard for her small general store business, which is how she supports her household.

Maria asks for this loan to buy the meats, drinks, dairy products, breads, and vegetables that she needs to help her realize her business plan, which will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy meats, drinks, dairy products, breads and vegetables to stock her small general store.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta educación secundaria, es soltero, vive en casa de su madre él es quien ayuda económicamente a su madre y hermanos, él tiene cuatro años de trabajar como repartidor de bebida.
 Julio se dedicó a este de trabajo porque le gusto y era un trabajo seguro, pues en estos tiempos no es fácil conseguir un empleo.

El crédito lo necesita para mejorar una habitación de su casa, comprara ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y otros materiales.
 Julio pretende a futuro seguir estudiando y lograr ser un profesional de éxito.
texts.en:
Julio, 24, studied up until secondary education. He lives in the his mother's house. He is the one who helps his mother and siblings economically. He has been working for four years as a beverage seller. Julio started in this work because he liked it and it was a secure job; in these times it is not easy to get a job.

He needs the loan to be able to renovate a room of his house, to buy floor bricks, cement, sand and other materials. In the future, Julio wants to continue studying and achieve becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to renovate a room of his house, to buy floor bricks, cement, sand and other materials.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a livestock keeper in Emsea and has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.  He is 40 years old and the father of three children between 4 and 10 years old. His spouse Juliana also adds income to the family.

With his fifth loan of KES 70,000 from VisionFund Kenya, Joseph wishes to purchase more livestock to raise and later to resell. The anticipated amounts he earns will be used to repay the loan and pay school fees for his children.

His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Rubén Darío

texts.es:
Rubén es un hombre trabajador, organizado y perseverante, dedicado a su familia y apasionado por su labor. Desde hace 9 años es comerciante independiente, tiene una salsamentaría ubicada en un local comercial del centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja solo de lunes a sábado y cuenta con la ventaja de no tener competencia dentro del centro comercial, por lo que ya es reconocido por los diferentes vendedores ambulantes que se han convertido en sus principales clientes.
Con el apoyo del crédito fortalecerá sus inventarios comprando mecato, dulces, chocolatinas, galletería, esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas.
Rubén manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo y acreditando su negocio, para que le garantice mayor rentabilidad y así tener la capacidad económica para adquirir una casa propia en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Rubén is a hard-working, organized and persistent man, dedicated to his family and passionate about his work. For the past 9 years, he has been an independent merchant. He has a food store located in a commercial center in the downtown area. He works there alone from Monday through Saturday, and he has the advantage of having no competition within the commercial center. He is well-known among the various mobile vendors, who have become his main customers. 

With the help of the loan, he will build up his inventory, buying snacks, sweets, chocolates, and cookies. This will allow him to have a greater variety available to offer to his customers, and thus increase his sales. 

Rubén reports that his greatest goal is to continue strengthening and solidifying his business in order to ensure better profitability, and thus to have the economic means to acquire a house of his own, in which he can enjoy a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sweets, chocolates and cookies.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian de 43 años de edad estudio solo hasta tercer grado de educación básica, se casó muy joven su esposo es albañil, en la casa viven con ella solo el hijo menor, que es sordo mudo y una nieta, su hija mayor se caso y la otra se fue a trabajar a la ciudad, luego de sacar el bachillerato.
 Lilian solo realiza las actividades en su hogar, su esposo es quien vela por los gastos de la familia, ella cuida de su hijo. Lo lleva a terapias es un poco difícil en la situación de él, ella dice que estudio hasta quinto grado el año pasado, pero que este año está deprimido y su nivel intelectual es menor.

El préstamo que solicita es para la reparación de un baño y la cañería del agua potable en la casa, donde vive eso mejorara la higiene de su familia y evitar los recargos en el recibo de agua y menor consumo.

Lilian en un futuro quiere hacer algunas mejoras más en su casa y que su hijo pueda valerse por sí solo, que aprenda a desenvolverse en la vida de una manera mejor.
texts.en:
Lilian, 43, only studied until third grade of basic education. She married very young. Her husband is a construction worker. In the house only the youngest son, who is deaf-mute, and a niece, live with her. Her eldest daughter married and the other one went to work in the city, later to study in the university.

Lilian only carries out activities in her home. Her husband is the one who works for the expenses of the family; she cares for her son. She takes him to therapy, his situation is a little bit difficult. She says that he studied until fifth grade last year, but that this year he is depressed and his intellectual level is lower.

The loan that she is applying for is for repairing a bathroom and a pipe for potable water in the house where she lives. This will improve the hygiene of her family and avoid charges in the water bill and lower consumption.

In the future, Lilian wants to do some more improvements on her house and hopes  that her son can stand up for himself, that he learns to function in life in life in a better way.

loans.use: to repair a bathroom and the pipe for potable water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three bales of Lesos and Khangas

loans.name: Toern

texts.en:
Toern is 31 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia. To make a living, Toern has been growing cassava and farming rice. To supplement the family’s income, her husband also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 70,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day, of which she can save about 50,000 KHR each day after paying her daily expenses.

Toern has been with VisionFund for five cycles and has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped better support her business. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to sell the rice for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Alihuja

texts.en: Alihuja lives with his family in a rural area near the mountains. Alihuja has been busy with transportation for more than three years. He mainly transports ‘tanur’, the national Tajik oven, from his region to other regions. Alihuja is married. His wife is a housewife. He is bringing up a little child. Alihuja needs support because his truck has broken. Alihuja is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to repair his truck. He awaits your support. With the profit from his business, he is going to repair his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his truck

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria Auxiliadora 2 está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comités, además de eso están haciendo la encuesta de los 50 indicadores de vida para conocer cómo se encuentra cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar y ayudarse las unas a otras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Aidee quien realiza decoración de Eventos, teniendo su propio ingreso y ayudando a su familia con ello. Es una persona muy creativa por lo que le está yendo muy bien en su negocio, y con el cual quiere seguir creciendo ya que es el sostén de su casa.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, apliques, hilos, colgantes y demás para poder seguir usando en sus decoraciones , lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Maria Auxiliadora 2” is in its sixth cycle with the communal bank program. In addition to this, they are completing the 50-life-indicators survey in order to identify their individual circumstances; and using it as a guide, they can work and help each other. 

One of the members is Señora Aidee, who makes event decorations. She has her own income with which she helps her family. She is a very creative person, and this is why she is doing very well in her business, which she wants to continue growing, as it is the means of support for her household. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric, appliqués, thread, hangers, and similar items, in order to continue using them in her decorations.  This will help her to implement her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, appliqués, thread, hangers, and similar items, in order to continue using them in her decorations.

loans.name: Alamurod

texts.en:
Alamurod is an industrious man from a rural area. He is a widower. He has been busy as a taxi driver. He began his business 6 years ago and he likes his job. He always wanted to be a driver and to communicate with different people.

Alamurod raises his two children alone. He tries to provide his children with all of the necessary things. His living conditions are bad. He is going to repair his house but he does not have enough money. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy building materials such as cement and wood. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: Originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Khorn is 50 years old and a mother of seven children. Her entire household counts on agribusiness, rice cropping and pineapple planting as the main source of income. These businesses generate about 30,000 KHR and save her about 15,000 KHR after net-off with necessary expenses in her household. For this cycle, she joined a group of two to get a new loan, her fifth, from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her loan has enabled her to strengthen her living conditions. For this cycle, she is the representative of her group. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes that she can boost her crop yield in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, reside en la comunidad del Negrito, Yoro junto a uno de sus hijos y su esposo. Ella siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz y arroz y hace 5 años decidió comprar unas vacas para obtener leche y vender. Con el propósito de incrementar la producción de leche ha solicitado un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras para comprar dos terneras mas. Su plan es llegar a tener bastantes vacas para vender mas leche y con las ganancias poder dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: María is 56 years old and married, with 4 children. She lives in the community of Negrito, Yoro, together with her husband and one of her children. She has always dedicated herself to agricultural work, growing corn and rice. Five years ago, she decided to buy some cows to obtain and sell milk. With the aim of imcreasing her milk production, she has requested a loan for 8,000 Lempiras to buy two more calves. Her plan is to eventually have a large number of cows, so she can sell more milk, and with the earnings she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy two calves for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Lengheng

texts.en:
Lengheng, 28, is from a rural village located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is married, with two children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others, for a fee. The current business earns her about KHR 90,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Lengheng has been with VisionFund Cambodia for one cycle and she completely paid back the past loan. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy cows to help her in agribusiness. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cows to help her in agribusiness.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, fish, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Saophoan

texts.en:
Saophoan, 49, has earned a living as a farmer for several years. Her main crop is rice which she cultivates and sells in local markets close to her  residence. She also makes red sugar from palm juice collected by her husband.  She sells this for additional income.  Their profits are spent on food, home bills and school allowances for their two school-aged children. 

She lives in her own home with her spouse and children in a remote area of Mien commune, Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham.

She requests a loan to buy sawdust to cook red sugar. She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college and develop a successful business.

loans.use: to buy sawdust which will be used like chopped wood for cooking red sugar.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a thirty-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. She has been in the cocoa  business for one year and her customers are both men and women from the area. 

She is a hardworking woman.  Competition and the changing seasons affect her business. She wants a loan to buy beans and rice  to alternate plantings with her cocoa.  

She wants to boost her standard of living and profit-making ability.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Richard is the director of Alpha Primary School .He desires to develop his home town by providing educational services to all pupils around Kalisizo and neighboring towns like Kyotera.

The director hopes to use the loan to construct additional classrooms.   He hopes to have a well built school and provide improved educational services to the community.

He is challenged with the number of low-income parents who want to access educational services for their children.  They sometimes fail to pay the school dues on time.  This affects operations.

He hopes that if he increases the number of classrooms, his intake will increase and so will his income.

loans.use: to construct classrooms.

loans.name: Eynulla

texts.en:
Eynulla is a 47-years-old married man living with his family in Baku region. 

His motherland (Khojali) was occupied by Armenians 21 years ago and he has been an IDP-Internally Displaced Person since then. 

Eynulla is a master stone mason and skilled in constructing concrete foundations. He learned this profession from his uncle and has been in this business for many years. 

Eynulla needs a loan and has applied to Komak for 1,700 AZN to buy cement, brick, and other building materials. 

He thanks Kiva  and lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy new materials for his construction business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Concepción, tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, vende mercadería por encargos como ser desodorantes, lociones, cremas, medicinas naturales y jarabes para la tos, ungüentos, vitaminas reconstituyente cerebral y nervioso etc.  Las ventas las realiza en su casa y por encargos. El préstamo que solicita es por 8,000 Lempiras para comprar mas productos de medicinas naturales, jarabes, vitaminas etc. y otra mercadería para vender y obtener mas ganancias. En un futuro piensa cultivar palma africana ya que es un negocio rentable.
texts.en:
Concepción is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  She has always worked selling merchandise by order such as deodorants, lotions, creams, natural medicines, cough syrups, unguents, vitamins, brain tonic, and nerve tonic.  She makes her sales at home and by orders.  

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 lempiras to purchase more natural medicine products, syrups, vitamins, and other merchandise to sell and earn more profits.  In the future, she is thinking about cultivating African oil palm trees, since it is a profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more natural medicines, syrups, vitamins, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is a member of this group in Busia District.  She is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 57 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Christine has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Christine is married and has children.  She is 22 years old and is known as a friendly, hardworking, and experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group.  Christine believes that she can have a better harvest this year by working with One Acre Fund.  							

Christine is preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Christine joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods and purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Christine plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and repair the home. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. 
 
Christine and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase  hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 32-year-old married man from Kakamega.  His wife, Jemimah, is a business woman in the same town. They have  2 children who are 12 and 6 years old.

He has operated a taxi business for the last 2 years and earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES.  He requests 20,000 KES with Vision Fund Kenya to expand his business. He will use the profits to support his business and repay the loan.

His dream is to own a fleet of taxis.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his cab to ensure it is in good condition.

loans.name: Young's Group

texts.en:
Young is 39 years old and a mother who supports three dependent children. She struggles to make a living selling groceries and chickens. 

She has had this business for 10 years and earns about 42,000 KHR each day. This is her first loan for Yong’s group and they request 3,000,000 KHR  with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan to support her chicken raising business. She hopes that she can make more income from her business, improve her lifestyle, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to support her chicken raising business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Seanghai

texts.en:
Seanghai is a 32-year-old mother of two children living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. 

She and her husband earn a living farming rice and raising buffalo.  They have done this for almost 13 years and her husband supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 11 USD per day.

Seanghai recently joined VisionFund and is applying for a loan. She is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 63 años de edad, solamente logró estudiar hasta primer grado debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos, además él era el mayor de los cinco hermanos y se vio en la obligación de ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar ya que eran muy pobres, él está casado y su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar mientras él trabaja en el campo, tiene 5 hijos pero solo 3 viven con él, los demás ya están acompañados y tienen sus propios hogares.

Actualmente, Jorge se dedica a sembrar maíz y frijol, actividad que ha realizado desde que era un niño, sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo, ya que en aquel tiempo no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura. Además de trabajar en la agricultura, él presta el servicio de renta de14,000 metros cuadrados, tierras que ha comprado con su trabajo y esfuerzo pero debido a su avanzada edad no puede trabajar mucho. 
Jorge se levanta  a  las 4:00 AM para prepararse y seguidamente trasladarse al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de 2 kilómetros en bicicleta, hora de salida no tiene, ya que regresa a su casa cuando termina de hacer sus actividades programadas para cada día, hoy en día él está sembrando sandía ya que el terreno donde trabaja es muy fértil, además de la agricultura él trabajó como vigilante de seguridad durante un tiempo.
El dinero del préstamo que está solicitando, lo necesita para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, ya que en estos dias empiezan a movilizarse para trabajar en este año y quiere terminar de cultivar la parcela de sandia que tiene y con el préstamo terminará de hacer lo que tiene pensado.
Sus planes a futuro son, tener una mejor casa y hacer un muro alrededor para mayor seguridad , además desea tener los fondos necesarios para pagar empleados y seguir trabajando, él está seguro que el crédito es un compromiso, pero también sabe que solo así puede lograr sus sueños y tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Jorge is 63 years old.  He was only able to study through first grade since his family had limited financial resources, and since he was the oldest of five children, he felt he had an obligation to his parents to work since they were very poor.  He is married and his wife cares for their household while he works in the fields.  They have five children, but only three live with them.  The others are married and have their own homes.

Currently, Jorge plants corn and beans, work he has done since he was a child.  His parents taught him this work, since in that time, they had no other way to survive other than farming.  In addition to farming, he also rents out 14,000 square meters of land that he purchased with his effort and work, but due to his age, he is not able to work it much.    Jorge gets up at 4:00am to get ready and later goes out to the corn field, which is a 2 kilometer trip by bicycle.  He leaves whenever he has finished his planned work for the day.  Today he is planting watermelon, since the land where he works is very fertil.  In addition to farming, he worked as a security guard for a while.  

He is requesting this loan to plant 7,000 square meters of corn, since he is starting to work for this year and wants to finish cultivating the watermelon crop that he has, and the loan will help him finish his plans.  In the future, he hopes to have a better house, with a wall surrounding it for better security.  He would also like to have funds available to pay employees and continue working.  He knows that the loan is a commitment, but he also knows that this is the only way he can achieve his dreams and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Santa Marta Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre Santa Marta está en su ciclo número 13º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gricel, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir está en un nivel medio, pero de igual manera puede seguir mejorando. Ella se dedica a las ventas ya que tiene una mercería bien surtida con todo tipo de productos como calzados, prendas, ollas, esmaltes, cubiertos y demás. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que tiene todo tipo de productos y eso gusta a sus clientes. Es una persona luchadora y muy emprendedora, pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados, prendas, artículos de bazar y demás, para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called "Santa Marta" is in its 13th loan cycle in the women's committee program. They are also participants in the program to eliminate poverty, which examines the situation of each one of them and helps them work and improve their living conditions. 

One of the members is Gricel, who in the last survey exhibited a poverty level within level two, that is to say at a medium level, but in any case she can continue to improve her situation. She dedicates herself to selling, since she has a general store which is well-stocked with all types of products, such as shoes, clothing, pots, enamelware, utensils, and other items. She comments that she has a very good customer base, since she has all kinds of products, and her customers like that. She is a determined and very enterprising person, and she is requesting this loan in order to invest in buying shoes, clothing, and other items for her general store, so that she can continue with her work the way she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, and other items for her general store.

loans.name: Violeta Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Violeta se forma con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Caacupé, son 18 mujeres muy trabajadoras que vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de la fundación paraguaya. Todas son mujeres jefas de familia muy entusiastas.
Una de ella es Nancy, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre motiva a sus compañeras y las apoya en todo lo que puede. Por su parte ella se dedica a ser confitera, es decir que hace todo tipo de masas, facturas, tortas y demás, y de esa forma tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Ella pide este préstamo para comprar de azúcar, leche, huevos, harina para la elaboración de tortas decoradas, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group known as "Violeta" is composed of  18 woman formed by the joining of various friends and neighbors. They are hard-working and see a great opportunity with the Program at Fundación Paraguaya. All these women are enthusiastic heads of family. 

One of the members is Nancy who is the President of the group. She is a hard-working woman who constantly motivates her companions and helps them whenever she can. As for her business, she is a baker. That is to say she makes all kinds of doughs, pastries, cakes, etc. In this way she has the income she needs to support her family. She is requesting this loan to purchase sugar, eggs, milk and flour to make decorated cakes. Then she can continue to work and help her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs, milk and flour to make cakes.

loans.name: Activos De Santa Fe 1, 2, 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic after having successfully repaid her previous loan and has grown her business. Starting with her own savings, this businesswoman has been selling clothing for around twenty-six years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes for women, men and children. 

Carmen is the coordinator of her group, Activos de Santa Fe (Santa Fe's Active--Santa Fe is the name of their community) 1, 2, 3 & 5. This group comprises 20 micro-entrepreuners (women and men) located in the City of San Pedro de Macoris. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband, they have only one child.  Carmen said her most difficult challenge was to educate her child and now she wants to guide her family to a better future. In the meanwhile, she enjoys watching television. 

Carmen will use the profits to save and to finish building her house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
This is Nestor. His previous loan was a big help to his business because he was able to buy more fish to sell. The loan also helped him to meet his household expenditures. He and his wife help each other to provide for their everyday needs.

Nestor would like to apply for 50, 000 PHP to buy more kinds of fish and other products to sell.  He hopes that having more products will result in better profits. Additional profits will definitely help him to meet his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness. 

Nestor dreams of expanding his business. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Don Francisco es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz y Frijoles. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro comprar las semillas necesarias para realizar la siembra de Maíz y Frijoles. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Semillas de trigo. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así cubrir los gastos cotidianos.
texts.en: Francisco is from the city of Boaco.  He works as a farmer, planting corn and beans.  He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito since he succeeded in purchasing the necessary seeds to plant corn and beans.  He is requesting a new loan to purchase wheat seeds.  He thinks this loan will be a lot of help since he will be able to earn more profits and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds.

loans.name: Noern

texts.en:
Noern is a 40-year-old mother with two children.   She is from a village of the Ponhea Krek district where rice farming is a common way to make a living,

She grows cassava and sells grocery items as the main source of income.  

Noern has been with VisionFund for one cycle and repaid the loan. She asks for a loan to buy farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Saroeurb's Group

texts.en:
Saroeurb, a mother in her early 30s, is a villager from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. To deal with the family’s hardships, she does rice farming and works for others for a fee. She is able to earn up to 35,000 KHR per day from this business, which she has been involved in for about two years. 

This cycle, Saroeurb applied for a first-cycle loan while her fellow group member is applying for her eighth-cycle loan with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield so she can get a good income to uplift her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is from the community of Antequera, Bohol. She is married, with two children aged 12 and 14. Elsa is engaged in weaving baskets and making rice cake, which earns her 6,000 Philippines Pesos a month. This has been her work for 20 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy straw and buri (palm leaves) so she can make more baskets.  

Elsa dreams of seeing her family have a good life, and being able to help her husband, who is a farmer.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy straw and palm leaves

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida, age 42, has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for many years. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to become famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase spools of threads along with the packs of sequins, beads, and stones for embellishment. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads along with packs of sequins, beads, and stones.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 27 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación  personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudios y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.  

Gracias  a su esfuerzo  y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica  la venta de cosmeticos como perfumes, crema, body, labiales, rubor, leche limpiadora , Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de belleza  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejore ingresos. María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María is 27-years old, married and has two young children.  She is a native of León, which is located in the western part of the country.  María is known for being hard-working and responsible and for having a great desire to get ahead.  In her free time, she enjoys being with her children.  Unfortunately, because of being low-income, she wasn't able to go to school.  She found herself needing to work to help with the household expenses.  Now María works day after day to offer her children a better future.   

Thanks to her hard work and desire to get ahead, María has a business that sells cosmetics like perfumes, lotion, lipstick, blush, and bath wash. She dedicates about 10 hours a day to her business selling her products.  The goal for the loan is for María to invest in working capital and stock up her business by purchase cosmetics to re-sell so that in the not too distant future she can earn a better income.  María is grateful for the help of the Kiva investors who offer low-income people and poor countries, like Nicaragua, the chance to earn a dignified living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like perfumes, lotion, lipstick, blush, and bath wash for her store

loans.name: Musavvara

texts.en:
Musavvara was born in 1964. She is married and has five children who are adults. Musavvara is a sewer. She is hardworking and industrious woman. Her mother is also a sewer and she learnt from her how to sew traditional women's dresses. She has been busy with this business for more than 18 years. Musavvara also sews traditional skull-caps. She also teaches her daughter and daughter-in-law to sew these items. She sells men's skull-caps in a local market. 

Musavvara is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy raw materials as fabrics, threads and etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabrics, threads and etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase working materials (wood, paint, and tacks).

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary’s group has six farmers, each of whom is a group leader for several other farmers. They are located in Kakamega North District.  The group leaders in this group represent a total of 52 individual farmers (not pictured). Each of the farmers is asking for an average loan of 5,349 Kenya shillings. Each of them will use his or her loan to purchase a One Acre Fund package, sufficient to cultivate one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of sorghum or millet. As the representative of this Kiva group comprised of farmer-leaders, Rosemary is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised.

Rosemary is a reliable member of the community. She is married and has two children. She is 56 years old and she has been working as a farmer for the past 21 years to support her family. In addition, Rosemary is very active in her community, including involvement in the women's group and savings group. The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Rosemary’s first season with One Acre Fund. She first joined One Acre Fund in 2011.  She has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She described her harvest last year as "Good." She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue enjoying the success she has been having with the One Acre Fund farm packages. 

As an active member in her community, Rosemary also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to help more farmers.  Rosemary plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school and to save for the future. She has improved her life by working with One Acre Fund because she has more farm training and she is able to feed the family. Rosemary and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. 

One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers with the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings along to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. 

The field officer is included in the photo with the farmer-leaders and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesús

texts.es:
Salvador tiene 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales tres están estudiando  y los otros 2 ya formaron sus propios hogares, por lo tanto solo 3 hijos y su pareja dependen de él.
 
El trabajo en la agricultura es la actividad a la cual se dedica Salvador, lo realiza desde que tenía 13 años de edad, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, pues siempre se preocupó para que sus hijos aprendieran un oficio para que en un futuro se pudieran defender en un trabajo. Salvador debe hacer un recorrido de 10 minutos a pie para llegar al campo, su esposa se involucra y le ayuda en lo que puede, y realiza las actividades en  un horario de 6:00 AM a 11:00 AM. 

El crédito que está solicitando, lo necesita para sacar los cultivos  y tenerlos en la casa ya que ellos trabajan con la semilla mejorada que una institución les da para trabajar y lo regresan con granos y ellos se los pagan a buen precio, pero para sacar eso él tiene que  pagar quien le lleve el maíz  para la casa en la carreta y también pagar una máquina para que le desgrane el maíz y quien le ayude a sacar el frijol, luego escoger buena semilla para llevarlo a esa institución, este préstamo le ayudará mucho ya que solo con su esposa no dan abasto.

Él espera que Dios le preste vida para seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sustento al hogar  ya que la ganancia es lo que les queda de lo que venden.
texts.en:
Salvador is 46 years old. He did not have the opportunity to study. He is in a common-law marriage, and his life partner dedicates herself to domestic work. He has five children, of whom three are in school, and the other two have already formed their own households. Thus, only 3 children and his partner are dependent on him. 

Agricultural work is the activity to which Salvador dedicates himself. He has done this work since he was 13 years old. He learned this work from his father, who always wanted to make sure that his children would learn a profession so that they could support themselves through work in the future. Salvador has to walk for 10 minutes to reach his fields. His spouse is also involved, and she helps him as much as she can. He works on a schedule of 6:00 AM to 11:00 AM. 

He needs the loan he is requesting to harvest his crops and take them to his house, since they work with improved seeds which an institution gives them to plant. When they come back with the grains, they pay them a good price, but to get this, he needs to pay someone to transport the corn to his house in a wagon, and he also needs to pay for a machine to take the kernels off the corn. In addition, he needs a person to help him harvest the beans and later to choose good seeds to take to this institution. This loan will help him a lot, since he and his spouse alone cannot do all this work. 

He says that he hopes that "God will grant him life" to keep cultivating the land and have the means to support his household, since his earnings are what is left after he sells his crops.

loans.use: to harvest his crops and transport them to his house.

loans.name: Ayyam

texts.en: Ayyam has a butcher shop. He is married with two children and lives with his family in Baku region. At 21 years old, his native land of Agdam city was occupied by Armenians. Ayyam is 27 years old. His wife is a housewife, his son is 3 years old, and his little child is a 1 year old daughter. Today, Ayyam has applied to Komak for loan in amount of 1,500 AZN. With this loan, he wants to repair the roof of his butcher shop. Ayyam is thankful to the Kiva organization for their help. In the future, he wants to increase the area of his shop.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his butcher shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has a clothes selling business in the town of Kangundo and has been in this business for 10 years. She is 43-years-old, married and, together with her spouse, they have been blessed with one child. Her spouse also provides additional income. She is also a farmer.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of clothes for sell. She will use the anticipated income to educate her children and improve her livestock farming business.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully.   In the future, Josephine hopes to educate her children and also improve her farming.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sell.

loans.name: Dolores Rául

texts.es:
