Dolores tiene 66 años de edad, no tuvo las facilidades económicas para terminar la escuela, solo estudió hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a vender productos de belleza con lo cual le ayuda a él en los gastos del hogar, tiene 2 hijas que viven con ellos, una de ellas trabaja y la otra está estudiando.
Actualmente Dolores se dedica a sembrar maíz y maizillo, labor que ha realizado desde que estaba muy pequeño, ya que su padre le enseñó este trabajo pues era la única forma con la que podían sacar adelante a la familia. 

Además de trabajar en la agricultura, también trabaja como empleado de un vecino, se levanta a las 4:00 AM y se tiene que ir al campo donde tiene la milpa, hace un recorrido de aproximadamente 3 kilómetros en bicicleta, y cuando termina sus labores se va a su casa a ayudarle a su esposa en los quehaceres diarios.
Dolores solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maiz, pues en el sector de donde vive es vital la siembra de este cultivo, además podrá cancelar algunas deudas que tiene pendientes. 
Sus sueños para un futuro son, tener una mejor casa de la que ahora tiene, poder darle a sus hijas el estudio que él no tuvo, pues hoy en día quien esté mejor preparado académicamente puede conseguir un buen trabajo, él está seguro que puede lograr sus metas con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
Dolores is 66 years old.  He did not have the financial resources to finish school, so he only studied until sixth grade.  He is married and his wife works selling beauty products, which helps him with the household expenses.  He has two daughters who live with them.  One of them works, and the other is in school.  

Dolores plants corn and sorghum, work that he has done since he was very young.  His father taught him this work since it was the only way they had to move the family forward.  In addition to farming, he also works for a neighbor.  He gets up at 4:00am and has to go to the fields where he has his crops.  He makes the 3 kilometer trip on bicycle, and when he finishes his work, he comes home to help his wife with the daily chores.

Dolores is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to plant 7,000 square meters of corn, since planting this crop is vital in the area where he lives.  He will also pay off some debts he has outstanding.  In the future, he wants to have a better house than he has now and to be able to give his daughters the education he did not have, since today people who are better prepared academically are able to get better jobs.  He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: María Tiodosa

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está soltera y tiene cuatro hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela que se encuentra a una distancia de una hora de donde ellos viven. 

Ella se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, actividad que ha realizado desde hace muchos años y que lo aprendió de su familia que también se dedica a lo mismo.
 
María está solicitando este préstamo, para comprar ganado ya que le gusta tener animales y cuidar de ellos, pues es una manera de obtener ingresos económicos para su familia. 

María planea trabajar muy duro para poder brindar el estudio a sus hijos para que lleguen a ser buenos profesionales y poder dejarles un buen capital, pues es una de las mejores cosas que puede heredarles, también sueña con heredarles terrenos y ganado para que saquen adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
María, age 43, went to school through the sixth grade.  She is single and has four children.  They go to a school that is one hour from where they live.

She devotes herself to livestock and agriculture.  She has been engaged in this business activity for many years.  She learned from her family; they do the same thing.

María is requesting this loan to buy livestock.  She likes having animals and taking care of them.  It is a way to get income for her family.

María plans to work very hard in order to be able to provide her children with an education.  She will do this so that they become good professionals and to be able to leave them good capital.  It is one of the best things that she is able to leave them with.  She also dreams of leaving them land and livestock so that they can get their families ahead.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: José Rodolfo

texts.es:
José es un hombre trabajador de 46 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado, actualmente está casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de yuca, pasteles, y enchiladas, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 están estudiado bachillerato, uno está trabajando y el otro emigró a los Estados Unidos.

José es pastor de una iglesia evangélica, ya que es alguien muy entregado a Dios y al servicio de los demás, también se dedica a la agricultura y es obrero, de modo que José se dedica a diversas actividades para salir adelante.

Él necesita este crédito, para sembrar maíz, comprar abono y fertilizantes, ya que se acerca el invierno y él quiere estar preparado.
 
Su gran sueño es seguir trabajando, y con esfuerzo brindarle el estudio a sus hijos para que se preparen y que sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
José is a hardworking 46 year old man.  He was only able to study through ninth grade.  He is married and his wife works selling yucca, cakes, and enchiladas.  He has four children.  Two are in high school, one is working, and the other emigrated to the United States.

José is a pastor at an evangelical church, since he is someone who is very dedicated to God and service to others.  He is also a farmer and a laborer, since he works at various things to move forward.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase manure and fertilizers to plant corn, since winter is coming and he wants to be prepared.  His goal is to continue working and allow his children to continue studying so that they prepare themselves and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to plant corn.

loans.name: Ferhet

texts.en:
Ferhet is a 37-year-old married woman. Her husband is a laborer. She has four children and a total of six family members in her home. Her husband was the only earner of the family. It was very tough for Ferhet to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. 

Therefore, she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose, she started her business of selling embroidered cloth. She purchases cloth in different colors, and after doing embroidery with beads and sequins, she sells it to the people of her community. Now she is playing a very important role in her family. 

In order to inflate her sales, Ferhet needs to purchase cloth and spools of thread, along with packs of sequins and beads in different colors. For this, she applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and spools of thread, along with packs of sequins and beads in different colors.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a 30-year-old married woman. For about 8 years she has worked sewing. She makes beautiful long scarfs for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy spools of threads along with packs of beads, ribbons, sequins in different colors. In this way she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads and packs of beads, ribbons, sequins in different colors.

loans.name: Bashirian

texts.en: Bashirian is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She is in the business of selling vegetables with the support of her husband who purchases stock of vegetables from the market for her to sell to the people of her community. Through this, she earns a good amount of income to support household expenditures. In order to grow her sales, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase sacks of potatoes, gingers and onions. She expects this to boost her earnings and profits.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, gingers and onions for her fruit stand.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for many years. 

She very well knows the techniques of stitching. She purchases cloth material in different colors, and after doing embroidery with beads and sequins, she sells it to the people of her community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy spools of thread, along with packs of sequins, beads and zippers in different colors, to meet the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread, along with packs of sequins, beads and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is a 34-year-old married woman. She runs a bakery business and makes and sells bakery items with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They offer various bakery items and have become famous in their town for proving a good tasting bakery.  They also take orders from nearby shops and people of their community and earn enough to lead a decent life.  Currently, Shabana requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stock of flour and baking powder along with packs of oil and sugar at lower rates from the market.  It would enable them to inflate their sales which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour and baking powder along with packs of oil and sugar.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of nine children. One of her sons is doing business dyeing clothes. They have been doing this work together for many years. Over time they have become famous for providing good quality dyeing cloth in her community. She is very motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. In order to purchase a boiler and good quality colors to expand business, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. In this way, they would be able to cater to more customers without delay which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Anwar dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her children. This is her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase boiler and good quality colors.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 63 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, pues la situación económica no le permitió continuar sus estudios, está casado y su esposa se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tiene 3 hijos que viven en Estados unidos.

Satos se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, esta actividad la ha realizado por muchos años ya que su familia siempre ha trabajado en esta labor y también en la ganadería.

Él solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para comprar una ternera, ya que le gusta tener ganado y es una de las fuentes de ingresos para él y su familia.

Santos sueña con poder dejarles ganado y terreno a sus hijos para que puedan trabajar y vivir en un lugar propio.
texts.en:
Santos is 63 years old.  He attended school through sixth grade, since his financial situation did not allow him to continue his studies.  He is married and his wife does domestic work.  They have three children who live in the United States.

Santos works as a farmer.  He has done this work for many years since his family has always done this work and also works with livestock.  

He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to purchase a calf, since he likes to have livestock and it is one of his sources of income.  

Santos dreams of being able to give livestock and land to his children so that they can work and live in their own place.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en: Aneela is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a business of tents services for special occasions, like weddings and parties, with her husband who is also shown in the photo.  She earns enough through this business to contribute to the family income.  In order to inflate her services she needs to purchase a stock of different colored cloth for tents, decorating items and crockery. For this, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. She is in her ninth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of the revenue on providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of different colored cloth for tents, decorating items and crockery

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of five group leaders of farmers in the Kakamega North district, with Grace selected as the Kiva representative.  Grace has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative, and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 56 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Grace is a reliable member of the community.  She is married with nine children.  Grace is 53-years-old and has been working as a farmer for the last two years to support her family.  In addition to this, Grace is very active in her community and involved in the women's group and savings group.  She described her harvest last year as excellent.  She hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer, she will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!  Grace joined One Acre Fund in 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  

Grace joined One Acre Fund so that she can get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed her family. Because she likes being a leader and an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Grace has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva's representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Grace's life because she has more profits from the harvest and group support, was able to save money and feed the family. In the future, Grace hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school, save for the future, and invest in a business. 

Grace and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay Kiva's loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizers when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 45-year-old vigorous married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is truly unable to meet the daily demands of her customers for clothes. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

The loan will create a means of increasing revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her tenth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 31 year-old married woman. She is in the business of making and selling “Falooda” which is a dessert consisting of thin vermicelli noodles made from corn starch mixed in ice-cream or milk. Razia is expert in making Falooda at home while her husband (also shown in the photo) sells to the people of their community.  She is the mother of four children who all attend school. One of her children is shown in photo with her. She needs to cover their educational and other expenses. In order to growtheir sales, Razia needs to purchase stock of vermicelli, milk and sugar. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000 to increase their sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase stock of vermicelli, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia has successfully built her small general store with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation in her community for many years. She has attained a good number of customers and makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs 50,000 which she will use to buy grains, oil and beverages from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing quality education to her two children.

loans.use: to buy stock of grains, oil and beverages

loans.name: Keko

texts.en:
Keko is 48 years old and married. He supports a family of five children aged between five and twenty four. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is servicing his sixth loan of KES 1,00,000 from VisionFund and this will facilitate his preparation of the farm and the purchase of inputs

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams are to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en: Manzoor is 50-years-old and a married woman and mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Manzoor’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the old rickshaw is not in good condition to provide smooth transportation services.  So, he decided to purchase a new rickshaw. For this purpose Manzoor has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a new rickshaw. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business. It’s her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Fanuel's Group

texts.en:
Fanuel is a member of Imani Group in Busia District. He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 85 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Fanuel has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers in this group are each receiving seeds to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 KES for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. 

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Fanuel’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to earn enough to feed his family. As an active member in his community, Fanuel also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he was proposed by other members in his group. Fanuel plans on using his future profits from his harvest to send his children to school. He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because he will be able to feed his family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Fanuel and the Imani Group will use the Kiva loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en: Rashidan is a married woman and the mother of five children. She has run a business of selling milk for the past 10 years. She sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life.  It’s her 4th year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. She is now requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase the production of milk and generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 23 años de edad, tiene una pequeña hija de 4 años de edad, es madre soltera ya que su pareja la abandonó, logró estudiar hasta bachillerato y vive con sus padres y tres hermanos, solo su hija depende de ella. 

Ana trabaja como vendedora en una súper tienda muy reconocida en la ciudad, cuando ella terminó sus estudios de bachillerato no encontraba trabajo, por lo tanto se dedicó a buscar y fue en esa tienda donde le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar como vendedora, ya tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y le queda a una distancia de una  hora en bus, ella trabaja de 7:00 AM a 5:00 PM todos los días excepto martes que es su día de descanso.

Ella necesita de este préstamo, para mejorar su vivienda, comprará lámina para la cocina  que ha construido con mucho esfuerzo, la cual solo dejó comenzada la reparación y espera terminarla con la ayuda del crédito. 

Entre los propósitos de Ana están, hacer la cocina  más agradable, de la que también pueda hacer uso su madre, y con esfuerzo de su trabajo espera darle lo necesario a su hija.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman, age 23.  She has a little 4-year-old daughter, and she is a single mother, as her partner has abandoned her. She was able to earn her high school diploma, and she lives with her parents and her three brothers. Her daughter is the only one depending on her.
  
Ana works as a saleswoman in a well-known super store in the city.  When she finished high school, she couldn’t find work; so, she devoted herself to looking, and this store gave her the opportunity to work as a saleswoman.  She has already been working in this occupation for three years. Her job is about an hour’s distance by bus, and she works from 7:00 a. m. until 5:00 p.m. every day except Tuesday, her day off. 

She needs this loan in order to improve her home. She will purchase sheeting for the kitchen, which she has built with a lot of effort.  She just started repairing it, and she hopes to finish with the help of the loan.

Ana’s goals include making the kitchen more comfortable so that her mother could also use it; and through hard work, give her daughter what is necessary

loans.use: to purchase sheeting for the kitchen.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Aged 46, Shahnaz is a married woman and the dedicated mother of six children. Her husband deals in running a mule cart, which is commonly used in the villages of Pakistan for carrying loads.  Her husband makes enough to meet the family's needs. In order to purchase a larger wooden cart for the mule, Shahnaz contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. In this way her husband will be able to take more things on his cart at once, like fruits and vegetables. This ultimately will save his time and hopefully increase his net income. She expects a boost in her husband's earnings and wishes to utilize part of his revenue for the betterment of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger wooden cart.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Ana tiene 43 años de edad, vive en un cantón, sus padres eran muy pobres y por esta razón lamentablemente no pudieron mandarla a la escuela, pero ha aprendido a firmar. Actualmente está acompañada y tiene 5 hijos, los mayores tienen 26, 24 y 23 años de edad los cuales ya formaron su propio hogar, su otro hijo tiene 19 años el cual trabaja para cubrir sus gastos, solo su hija de 14 años depende de ella y está estudiando quinto grado en la escuela.


La venta de pescado, ha sido la actividad a la cual se ha dedicado Ana desde hace 10  años,  ya que sus hijos mayores de edad se dedican a realizar la pesca, luego se reparten lo obtenido durante la jornada de trabajo. Además ella tiene una tienda en su casa que le permite obtener ingresos adicionales. El horario de trabajo varía porque en ocasiones trabaja por la noche y en otras durante el día.
Esta labor la prendió de su pareja que tuvo anteriormente, pues él murió y fue un golpe muy duro para Ana, es hasta ahora que ella decidió rehacer su vida nuevamente con otra persona.

Para llevar a cabo su actividad en la pesca, Ana debe tener un buen equipo de trabajo, es por ello que está solicitando este préstamo a CrediCampo, ya que necesita reparar uno de los motores de la lancha que se ha dañado y esto le está ocasionando pérdidas en el negocio de las pesca,  pues solo está trabajando con uno, y necesita tener un equipo en perfectas condiciones. 


Ana tiene muchas expectativas a futuro, desea ampliar su tienda y mejorar el equipo de pesca para obtener mejores ganancias y poder construir una casa para ella y su familia, y seguir dándole el estudio a su hija para que se supere en la vida.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 43 years old, lives in a rural community. Her parents were very poor, and for this reason they unfortunately were not able to send her to school, but she has learned to sign her name. She now has a partner,  and she has 5 children. The older ones are 26, 24, and 23 years old, and they have formed their own household. Her other son is 19, and he works to cover his expenses. Only her daughter who is 14 depends on her, and she is studying n fifth grade in school. 

Selling fish has been Ana's activity for 10 years, since her older children do the fishing, then they divide up what they obtain during the workday. In addition, she has a store in her house, which allows her to obtain additional income. Her work schedule varies because sometimes she works at night and other times during the day.

She learned this work from her husband, who did it in the past, but he died, and it was a very hard blow for Ana. It is only now that she has decided to rebuild her live again with another person.

To carry out her fishing work, Ana needs to have good working equipment. It is for this that she is applying to CrediCampo for this loan, since she needs to repair one of the motors of the fishing boat, which has been damaged and is causing losses n the fishing business, since she is working with only one, and she need to have equipment in perfect condition.

Ana has many expectations for the future. She wants to expand her store, improve her fishing equipment to obtain better earnings, be able to construct a house for herself and her family, and continue providing an education for her daughter so that she can better herself in life.

loans.use: to repair one of the motors of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies to tend to and prepare her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 46 años de edad, tiene 20 años de vivir en la ciudad actual, está casada y su esposo trabaja en el área de construcción,  tiene 2 hijos que ya terminaron de estudiar en la escuela y además con ella vive un nieto. 

Ana administra una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa de habitación, tiene aproximadamente 6 años de tenerla, para comprar los artículos que vende tiene que viajar hasta otra ciudad y le queda a 30 km de donde ella vive.

El crédito que está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para invertir en su tienda, ella planea aumentar la diversidad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, y con ello las ganancias aumentarán y así podrá cubrir las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes y las de su familia.

Ella tiene como meta para un corto, promover un pequeño negocio de pupusería para ayudar a que su familia no le falte lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old. She has been living in the city for 20 years. She is married, and her husband works in construction. She has two children who have already finished their schooling, and in addition, a grandson lives with her.

Ana runs a little store located in her home. She has had it for approximately 6 years. To buy the articles that she sells, she has to travel to another city that is about 30 km from where she lives.

She needs the loan that she is applying for with CrediCampo to invest in her store. She plans to increase the diversity of products that she offers her customers, and with that, her earnings will increase, and thus she will be able to meet the needs of each one of her customers and those of her family.

She has a short-term goal of setting up a little business to make and sell pupusas [a typical Salvadoran dish] to help her family not lack for what they need to live.

loans.use: to invest in her store

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 23-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a flour grinding business with her husband for the last many years. He is also shown in the photo. She is hardworking and loyal with her working. She is in her fourth loan cycle and now she requested a loan from Kashf Foundation of PKR 45,000 to purchase a stock of wheat. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace used the previous loan to buy salon equipment and general merchandise such as salt and sugar. On seeing that the retail shop was not productive, she transformed it into a bar.

She maintains her personal goal of educating her children, even if the high costs of drinks affect her business. Grace intends to use the loan to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Nyame Ayeh Group

texts.en:
Nyame Ayeh group, which these three ladies are part of, is located in Dansoman. Each of the women is very hardworking and helps her family through her work. They sell porridge, shoes, slippers and bags.

One of the members is Janet. She sells porridge and doughnuts. She makes them herself and is very good at it. She states that she always has a lot of orders so her business is going well. She is asking for this loan to invest in her business by buying millet, beans, sugar, oil and firewood to prepare porridge and sell to customers.

They are all grateful for the opportunity they are receiving to improve their lives through work and training.

They will need 2,500 GHS to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy millet, beans, sugar, oil and firewood to prepare porridge and sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is 41 years old and married. She has five children. She has a business preparing washing chemicals to remove stains and whiten cloths. She has had this business for many years. She prepares this chemical and provides it in her community. She has good demand for her washing chemical, but to fulfill this demand, she needs a loan of Rs. 40,000. She is planning to buy raw material such as chemicals, dyes and soda so that she can make more chemical and cater to orders from the market and increase her income. Her wish is to provide education for her children and provide good food, so that they can have a good life when they grow up.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as chemicals, dyes and soda.

loans.name: San Salvador Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Salvador está en su ciclo número 9º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo.  
Maira vende calzados y cuenta que tiene buena venta y que el secreto es tener siempre una buena variedad que ofrecer a los clientes y de esa forma atraerlos. Ella se define a si misma como una persona responsable que lucha por su familia y seres queridos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que tiene, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados variados, que de esa forma podrá seguir vendiendo y mejorando su variedad de zapatos.
texts.en: The San Salvador group is on its ninth cycle with the women's committee program. They actively participate in activities proposed by the group and they help each other reach the common goals that they have within the group. Maira sells footwear and she says that her sales are good and that the secret is to always have a variety to offer customers and bring them in that way. She defines herself as a responsible person who fights for her family and loved ones. She is grateful for this opportunity that she has, and she is asking for this loan to be able to buy assorted footwear. This way she can keep selling and improving her selection of shoes.

loans.use: to buy assorted footwear to sell.

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
Niveen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Niveen is a 30-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She is a mother of one son and three daughters. Her husband works as an employee at a local firm. He gets a low income, which is not enough to cover all the family’s needs. 

Niveen is a university student; she studies accounting. She would like to finish her studies and take a BA degree, and then find a job to help her husband with the family expenses. 

Niveen took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Niveen will be able to do her homework and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en: Salem is a 50 year-old married man from a small village called Qabatya near Jenin city. He is the father of six sons and four daughters. Salem has worked as a farmer for the past ten years. He has a small piece of land where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables. His sons help him in his business. Salem would like to expand his business and raise sheep. Salem had an accident and hurt his legs. He requested a loan from FATEN to help him pay the hospital expenses for surgery on his legs. By taking this loan, Salem will be able to recover and go back to work. Salem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses for surgery on his legs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of two sons and one daughter. Mohammad is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs. 

For the past five years, Mohammad has been working in his educational center, where he gives lessons for school students. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new furniture for his educational center. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his project and expand it. 

Mohammad appears in his educational center in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for his educational center.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf used his previous loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell. For over 10 years, he has been in a retail business that has enabled him to increase his income and provide his family with all their basic needs. He maintains his goal of educating his children and completing his residential house.

Yusuf needs the loan to buy bread and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy bread and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Gilmer

texts.es:
Gilmer es un joven trabajador que tiene 22 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar cuarto grado, ahora está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y todavía no tiene hijos. 

Desde muy pequeño, Gilmer se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, pues fue lo que le enseñaron sus padres, y desde hace dos años también trabaja cuidando ganado, él siempre ha deseado trabajar con mucho ganado, pues le gusta mucho esa actividad.

Gilmer necesita este préstamo, para sembrar una hectárea de sandía y otra de maíz, y también para cancelar algunas deudas pendientes. 

Él sueña para un futuro, tener hijos junto con su esposa, una familia no muy grande ya que hoy en día es muy difícil darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Gilmer, 22, is a hardworking young man.  He was only able to study to fourth grade.  Now he's married and his wife's a homemaker; they don't have children yet.

Gilmer has made a living in agriculture since he was very young because it's what his parents taught him.  For two years he has also worked raising cattle.  He has always wanted to work with a lot of cattle because he likes the work a lot.

Gilmer needs this loan to plant one hectare each of watermelon and corn, and to pay some outstanding debts.

He dreams of having children with his wife.  He doesn't want a very big family, however, because it's difficult to give children a good education these days.

loans.use: to plant watermelon and corn

loans.name: Deeb

texts.en:
Deeb is a 42-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and five kids: two sons and three daughters. All of his children are school students. Deeb is an employee in the public sector with a low wage. He would like to improve his family's living conditions by working at another job.
 
Deeb took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw. By taking this loan, Deeb will be able to use the rickshaw to transfer goods to the local traders. This will enable him to increase his income. Deeb appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 34-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and seven kids. Rami has five sons and two daughters, and all of them are students in school. 

Rami is an employee in the public sector and earns a low wage. He would like to improve his family's living conditions by working in another job.
 
He obtained a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for work. 

By taking this loan, Rami will be able to transfer goods to the local traders. This will enables him to increase his income. 

Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for work.

loans.name: Josephat's Group

texts.en:
Mabadiliko Group is a group of seven group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Josephat selected as the Kiva representative of Mabadiliko Group. Josephat has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 63 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum each. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Josephat is 51 years old and has been a farmer for 31 years. Josephat works as a farmer to provide for his nine children. The community and other farmers know Josephat as friendly, hardworking and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in community groups such as the men's group. Josephat described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.  

The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Josephat’s first season with One Acre Fund. He first joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. As an active member in his community, Josephat also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and wants to help more farmers. Josephat plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, save for the future and buy a cow. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from his harvest, has more farm training, and is able to feed the family. Josephat also joined One Acre Fund because he wants more food surplus. Josephat’s life has also improved because he pays school fees. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Josephat and the Mabadiliko Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To access hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Vitalis' Group

texts.en:
Vitalis is a member of the Imara Group in Busia District. He is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 80 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Vitalis has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seeds and fertilizer to plant 1/2 acre of maize and 1/2 acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Vitalis’ first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. As an active member in his community, Vitalis also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader. He wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Vitalis plans to use future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair his home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business. He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund because he has more farm training and has more farm group support. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Vitalis and the Imara Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy, 53, is from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married and has two adult children. Her husband works as a farmer and helps provide for their needs.  

For the past three years, Daisy has been operating a business selling vegetables and cooked meals. Her customers are people in the neighborhood and she also sells to offices. Daisy is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients, including vegetables, cooking oil, and chicken backbones. She dreams of someday expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, cooking oil, and chicken backbones

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is from Vosketas village of Aragatsotn region. Her husband is a migrant worker, and time after time, he supports his family financially. 

To tackle their financial hardships, Svetlana runs a farm. She keeps livestock including cows, sheep, chickens, a pig, and piglets. Near the house where Svetlana lives with her family, she owns farmable land where she cultivates potatoes and wheat.

The loan that Svetlana received with the help of Kiva lenders was a huge support for this responsible woman. She paid her loan very attentively and responsibly, ensuring further payments on the new loan.

She is asking for a new loan to be able to purchase five piglets, a cow, and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will be huge support for Svetlana and her family, and she waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for five piglets, a cow, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: José Arnulfo

texts.es:
José tiene 32  años edad, estudió bachillerato por las noches en la ciudad donde vivía con sus padres, ya que durante el día tenia que trabajar con su papá en la albañilería, está compañado y su pareja trabaja en una alcaldía desde hace tres años, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y un año de edad, y solo su hija mayor estudia en la escuela ya que el menor está muy pequeño.

José trabaja de albañil desde los 17 años de edad cuando su padre le enseñó este trabajo, desde entonces hasta la fecha trabaja al servicio de las comunidades en los diferentes áreas de albañilería, hoy en dia trabaja en la construcción del mercado de la comunidad donde reside.

Él está solicitando este préstamo a CrediCampo, para instalar el agua potable en su casa de habitación, ya que durante mcho tiempo tiene que ir lejos a traer agua para el consumo y para lavar, él invertirá $500 en instalar 200 metros de tubo para el agua, y pagará la mano de obra, tambien invertirá el resto del crédito en su vivienda ya que necesita fraguar el piso con arena y cemento, pues el piso es de tierra y provoca enfermedades respiratorias en sus niños.

José sueño con construir su casa de ladrillo, ya que actualmente es mixta (ladrillo y bahareque), además lucha día a día para ayudar a su niña en los estudios para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and studied for his degree at night in the city where he lived with his parents, since during the day he had to work with his father in construction. He has a partner who has worked in the mayor’s office for three years. They have two children who are 7 and 1 year old; only their older daughter goes to school as the little one is too young.

José has worked in construction since he was 17 years old, which is when his father taught him. Since then he has worked in different areas of construction in the community. Now he is working on construction in the market of the community where he lives.   

José is asking for a loan from CrediCampo to install drinking water in his home. For a long time now they have had to go a long way to bring back water to drink and wash with. He will invest $500 in installing 200 metres of pipes for the water and he will pay the workers. He will invest the rest of the loan in his home to create a floor out of sand and cement, since the current dirt floor is causing his children respiratory illnesses.  

José dreams of building a brick house, since his current house is a mix of brick, wattle and daub, as well as working day after day to help his daughter with her studies so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to install drinking water in his house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is aged 53, divorced, and has six children. She has eight other dependents who are her relatives. She lives on the outskirts of Kyotera town with her family and ten of these children are still attending school.

She deals in the gomesis (female traditional wear) trade where she works five days a week in different market days and twelve hours a day. She also has other sources of income, namely agriculture and animal rearing, which she started in 1994.

She sells her goods to people around the trading centre and surrounding areas and was motivated by the profitability of the business. She will use the loan to buy traditional clothing because it's now selling cheaply so she thinks she will get profits after sales.

She faces challenges of a limited market for her products and unpredictable weather changes which affect her operations.

She is described as an honest and hardworking businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth material to sell

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 8 meses de edad, ella vive sola en un pequeño cuarto que posee en la comunidad. Claudia es la ultima de cinco hermanos, lamentablemente su madre murió y quedó huérfana a loas 10 años, por lo cual se crió con una de sus tias ya que también su padre se fue a otro país y la abandonó. Ella logró estudiar hasta noveno grado en la escuela de su pueblo, tenia que caminar durante 20 minutos para llegar a la escuela. 

A esta joven le ha tocado muy difícil, desde la edad de 12 años, Claudia tuvo que empezar a trabajar, se dedicaba a lavar ropa a sus familiares y vecinos para ganarse el pan de cada dia, ella iba a la escuela en la mañana y trabajaba en la tarde. Hoy en día siempre trabaja lavando ropa y además se dedica a la crianza de especies menores, como cerdos  y aves.

Claudia necesita este crédito, para comprar tres cerdos valorados en $80.00 cada uno, los cuales ya los tiene encargados en la comunidad, el resto del crédito lo necesita para comprar una cama donde dormir con su hijo, pues la que tiene no está en las mejores condiciones, con la ayuda del crédito ella tendrá donde descansar y dormir a su hijos, los cerdos espera venderlos dentro de un tiempo para obtener ingresos económicos y mantener a su hijo.

Ella espera ver crecer a su hijo, que sea un niño saludable y apoyarlo en la educación para que tenga mejores condiciones, también con efuerzo espera comprar un terreno para en un futuro construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Claudia is 24 years old and single mother to an eight month old son. She lives alone in a small room she owns in the community.  Claudia is the last of five siblings. Sadly her mother died and left her an orphan at 10 years of age, which is why she was raised by her aunties after her father left the country and abandoned her. Claudia was able to study until Year 9 in the school in her village. She had to walk 20 minutes to get to school.

This young woman has been through a lot of difficulties. Since the age of 12 Claudia had to start working, washing clothes for her relatives and neighbours to earn her keep ever day. She went to school in the morning and worked in the afternoon. She still works washing clothes and raising small animals such as pigs and poultry.  

Claudia needs this loan to buy three pigs at $80 each, having already ordered from the community.  She needs the rest of the loan money to buy a bed where she can sleep with her son, since the one she has is not in very good condition. 

With the help of this loan she will have a place to rest with her children. She hopes to sell the pigs after a while to get some income and support her son. 

Claudia hopes to watch her son grow into a healthy child and support him in his education so that he can live in better conditions. She also hopes that with her effort she will be able to buy a plot of land where she can build her own home.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the produce business for the last five years and has used the proceeds to improve his family's income.

George's personal goal is to construct a better house. His business goal is to have a bigger produce store to satisfy all of his customers. 

His only challenge is limited capital. George needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesús está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité, es un grupo numeroso de 22 señoras, que se decidieron a ayudar a sus familias, y a ayudarlas por medio del trabajo en conjunto sumado a las capacitaciones que reciben.
Entre el trabajo que la Sra. Raimunda, una de las miembros,  hace son los trabajos de costura, arreglos de prendas de vestir, elaboración y venta. Ella es una mujer muy hábil en lo que hace, es por eso que le está yendo muy bien y ya tiene una clientela bastante amplia, es muy luchadora y entusiasta.
La Sra. Solicita de este prestamo para la compra de Tejidos, Telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros insumos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Divino Niño Jesús Group is in its seventh loan cycle in the communal bank program.  It's a large group of 22 women who decided to help their families through their collective work and the training they receive.

One of the jobs that the member Raimunda does is sewing, mending of garments, and sales.  She's very skillful in her work, which is why it's going very well for her and she has a lot of customers.  She's a persevering and enthusiastic woman.

She's requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies to help firm up her business plan, which will help improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies

loans.name: Prosperemos- Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROSPEREMOS-CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Cristina, la socia tiene 51 ,tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como gaseosas, arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia trabaja todos los días para de esta forma secar adelante a su familia, la socia desea poder agrandar su negocio y así continuar trabajando por su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, leche entre otros para su negocio.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de útiles escolares, venta de de lapidas, venta de ropa, venta de zapatos.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Prosperemos-Cusco (Let's Prosper - Cusco) community bank, which is located in the Cusco district of Cusco province in the department of Cusco.  
                                                                                                                               
Cristina is a 51 year old group member who has two children and is married. She alternates her daily tasks with her grocery store business which she has run for a long time, thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. She sells different products such as soft drinks, rice, sugar and others and she works there every day to bring up her family. She would like her business to grow so that she can continue working to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, milk and other items for her business. 

The other group members work in grocery stores, sell school items, grave stones, clothes and shoes.

The group member who appears in the attached photo asked for permission to come late to the meeting for work reasons.

Cristina thanks all those who form part of this dream through this medium and she promises to repay her loan installments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk and other items for their business

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
Cipriano tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casado y tiene seis hijos de los cuales una está en Estados Unidos, otro hijo es pastor y sus demás hijos estudian y viven con él y le ayudan en los trabajos que realiza. 

Desde muy pequeño, Cipriano cultiva maíz y frijol, también se dedica al cultivo de café, la cual administra una finca desde hace 6 años, también saca madera para construcción  de vivienda, esto lo aprendió de sus padres, en ocasiones viaja en vehículo hacia el lugar de trabajo, pero a veces debe caminar para no llevar el carro por lo caro que está el combustible, hace un recorrido de 45 minutos a pie, cuando lleva el vehículo él aprovecha de  hacer viajes de leña a sus vecinos de la cual obtiene ingresos económicos extras.

Cipriano necesita este crédito para comprar una motocicleta, debido a que su hijo viaja todos los fines de semana, pues lo necesita para transportarse al lugar de trabajo, y así no tendrá que caminar por cafetales solitarios pues ellos temen a la delincuencia.

Él desea darle mantenimiento a sus fincas, comprar más de estas para dejar a sus hijos un lugar donde puedan trabajar, además desea apoyarlos para que puedan seguir estudiando y que sean buenos profesionales
texts.en:
Cipriano, 52, studied up to third grade.  He's married and has six children.  One daughter's in the United States, another child is a pastor, and his other children go to school and live with him and help him in his work.

Cipriano has grown corn and beans since he was very young.  He also has grown coffee for six years on a farm he manages and harvests wood to build houses, something he learned from his parents.  Sometimes he travels by car to work, but other times he has to walk because gas is so expensive.  It takes him 45 minutes to walk.  When he takes the car he makes the most of having it to take firewood to his neighbors and earn some extra income.

Cipriano needs this loan to buy a motorcycle because he needs to get to work when his son travels with the car every weekend.  That way Cipriano won't have to walk through the lonely coffee farms and be afraid of crime.

He wants to take care of his land, buy more land to leave his children a place to work, and help his children keep on studying to be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine and tank for his home.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is 38 years old, and is married with five children who are all still dependent on her. 

Dilorom is a responsible woman. She has borrowed from IMON before, and has a good credit history. 

Dilorom began her bakery business 10 years ago. She cooks between 400 and 500 flatbreads every day. Dilorom’s husband helps her with managing the business. 

Dilorom is going to use this loan to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Tajikistanian Somonis to buy coal and flour to cook more flatbreads. She is looking forward to your support.

loans.use: To buy coal and flour to cook more flatbreads

loans.name: Twaib

texts.en:
Twaibu is 52 years old, and he is married with six children. Three of his children are attending secondary school, and Twaibu is also responsible for paying the school fees of another one of his relatives. He lives in a rural setting with his family, and deals in cattle trading as well as farming. He started this business in 2005. His clients are cattle traders from the village, and from the nearby cities.

Twaibu works six days a week and eight hours a day. He started his business to increase his family income, and also to pay for school fees for the children. He has asked for this loan to buy more cows for fattening. 

In the future, Twaibu hopes to expand his business, and to be the leading supplier of cows in his village and across the region. He hopes that with this financial boost, he will soon become financially independent, and not be dependent on borrowing.

loans.use: To buy cows for fattening

loans.name: José Fausto

texts.es:
José tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato en su comunidad, está acompañado desde hace 8 años y su esposa trabaja vendiendo ropa y cosméticos en las comunidades aledañas, es padre de dos niñas de 10 y 2 años de edad, y solo su hija mayor estudia en la escuela. 

José se dedica al trabajo de ayudante de albañil y de jornalero en la comunidad donde reside, se dedica a diversas actividades para obtener ingresos económicos y así ayudar con los gastos del hogar y el sostén de su familia. José se va atrabajar a las 5:00 de la mañana, y tiene que caminar 20 minutos para llegar lugar de trabajo en donde están construyendo una vivienda y regresa a casa a las 2:00 de la tarde.

Él solicita este préstamo a credicampo, para invertir en la compra de ropa para todas las edades y ayudar a su esposa con el comercio de ropa, el resto del crédito lo necesita para gastos personales de la familia, con ello pretende aumentar las ventas y obtener mayores ingresos para el hogar.

José tiene como objetivo seguir trabajando para apoyar a su hija en los estudios, también quiere construir una vivienda en un terreno que le ha heredado su madre.
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old, studied up to high school in his community, and has been in a couple for 8 years. His wife works selling clothes and cosmetics in neighboring communities, and he's a father of two girls of 10 and 2 years of age. Only the older of the two daughters is going to school.

Jose works as a mason's assistant and as a day laborer in the community where he lives. He works in different activities to obtain income and in that way help with household expenses and support his family. Jose goes to work at 5 in the morning and has to walk for 20 minutes to get to the job site where a home is being built. He gets back home at 2 in the afternoon.

He's requesting this loan from Credicampo to invest in the purchase of clothes for all ages and help his wife's clothing business, and he needs the rest of the loan for the family's personal expenses. With this loan his objective is to increase sales and obtain higher income for the household.

Jose's objective is to continue working to pay for his daughter's education, and he also wants to build a home on a plot of land that he inherited from his mother.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for all ages and he needs the rest of the loan for his family's personal expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for her home.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in this photo.

Amal is a 32-year-old married woman from Deir el Balah City. She lives with her husband, son and daughter in a small simple house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a very low income. Amal and her husband would like to improve the family home and buy the stuff they need.
 
Amal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a water purification machine for her home. By taking this loan, Amal will be able to provide pure water for her family.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for her home.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Don José es originario de la ciudad de Teustepe. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz y Frijoles. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro terminar la cosecha de Frijol y obtener ganancias. Solicita el nuevo crédito para comprar una Vaca y sus crías. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener esa Vaca que le dará suficiente leche para brindarle a su familia.
texts.en: Don José is a native of the city of Teustepe. He is a farmer by trade. He raises corn and beans. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito, since he succeeded in completing the bean harvest and obtaining earnings. He is applying for the new loan to buy a cow and its calves. He estimates that the loan will be of great help, since he will be able to obtain this cow, which will give him sufficient milk to offer to his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and its calves.

loans.name: Angie Katherine

texts.es:
La señorita  Angie Katherine desde inicios de la formación de secundaria se propuso una meta, para ella y para la comunidad, hasta el momento el proyecto va muy bien puesto,  cuando la estudiante estaba cursando noveno bachillerato en el colegio le dieron opciones para estudiar un énfasis en algún programa, dado que siempre la meta es lograr  la atención a la comunidad ella se enfocó en ciencias de la salud, por medio de este programa logro tener conocimientos en la rama de la salud, logrando culminar los estudios de secundaria,  con un título en énfasis de la salud y con gran esfuerzo  se matriculo en la institución para buscar más conocimientos  en la formación profesional, realmente ella se ha aferrado con mucha esperanza al hecho de ser una profesional, ya que todo lo que tiene que ver con el área de la salud le llama mucho la atención, porque aparte dentro de toda la formación académica se le han presentado varios obstáculos, ella ha persistido para poder alcanzar las metas .
Ella sabe que la importancia de tener constancia es la evolución de pensamientos que la llevaran a lago más grande y mejor.
Verdadera mente ella desea lograr algo grande aferrándose a este sueño con todo el corazón y no dejara de luchar hasta hacerlo realidad, por tal motivo solicita el convenio que kiva le ofrece, para poder continuar con lo sueños que tiene y quiere cumplir.
texts.en:
Señorita Angie Katherine proposed a goal for herself and for the community from the beginning of her secondary education. Up to the moment, the project has been going very well. When the student was in ninth grade of secondary school, they gave her options to study with an emphasis in some program. Given that the goal is always to bring attention to the community, she focused on health sciences. Through this program, she was able to gain knowledge of the roots of health, managing to complete her secondary studies with a degree with emphasis in health, and with great effort she enrolled in the institution to seek more knowledge in further professional training. Really, she has held on with much hope to the fact of being a professional, since everything that has to do with the health area very much calls her attention, because in all the academic training, various obstacles have presented themselves to her, and she has persisted to be able to reach her goals.

She knows that the importance of having perseverance is the progression of thoughts that will take her to a bigger and better goal.

She truly wants to achieve something great, holding on to this dream with all her heart, and she will not stop striving until she has made it a reality For this reason, she is applying for the agreement that Kiva offers her, to be able to continue with the dreams that she has and wants to accomplish.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school fees.

loans.name: José Ausberto

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado en la comunidad donde nació y creció, está casado y su esposa trabaja comercializando ropa y a la venta de pescado, tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y trabaja en la agricultura.

José se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 17 años, esta actividad la aprendió gracias a un amigo que le enseñó cuando trabajaba con él, también se dedica al engorde de cerdos para luego venderlos en la comunidad, él se esfuerza trabajando todos los días de la semana, también los días domingos trabaja de masajista en un equipo de futbol de la comunidad, esto lo realiza desde hace 2 años.

Él solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo, para comprar cuatro cerdos, y el resto del crédito lo necesita para los gastos del hogar, él pretende engordar los cerdos y luego comercializarlos en el tianguis de la ciudad, con ello aumentará sus ingresos económicos y podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

José sueña seguir luchando cada día para darle a su familia un futuro mejor, apoyar a su hijo para que retome sus estudios, y mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old and studied up to the second grade in the community where he was born and grew up. He's married and his wife's job is selling clothes and fish, and his adult son works in agriculture.

Jose has been working in masonry for 17 years, after learning this job thanks to a friend that taught him how when they were co-workers. He also works in fattening pigs and subsequently selling them in the community. He works hard every day of the week, including sundays when he works as a masseuse for a soccer team that he has been working for in the community for two years.

He's requesting this loan from Credicampo to purchase four pigs, and needs the rest of the loan for household expenses. His plan is to fatten the pigs and then sell them at the city market, which would increase his income and enable him to give his family a higher quality of life.

Jose dreams of continuing to work every day to give his family a better future, support his son to resume his education, and improve his home.

loans.use: To purchase four pigs.

loans.name: Blanca Esterminia

texts.es:
Blanca de 53 años de edad está acompañada, su compañero de vida trabaja como promotor de salud en la ciudad. Con quien tiene dos hijos, el primero de ellos estudia sexto año de doctorado en medicina en la ciudad, el segundo estudia primer año de profesorado en educación física. Con ella solo vive su esposo y los fines de semana que están sus hijos, los únicos que dependen de ella.

Blanca trabaja como directora del centro escolar del cantón, tiene 30 años de ejercer esta profesión. Desde pequeña su sueño fue ser profesora le gusto el estudio, fue así como decidió formarse y salir adelante, actualmente es la única actividad económica que tiene, antes solo ayudaba a sus padres en los oficios del hogar, la escuela donde trabaja está a dos kilómetros  de su casa, y para transportarse lo hace en bus y en ocasiones la va dejar su esposo en motocicleta.

Blanca invertirá el crédito en  comprar 2 libros, que necesita su hijo que estudia medicina  y con el resto del dinero cancelara las matrículas y las primeras cuotas en la universidad. Podrá comprarle de una vez los  materiales a sus hijos esto ayudara  a que se ahorre dinero y pueda invertirlo en otra necesidad que pueda surgir.

Blanca sueña con ver graduados a sus hijos, con un título de la universitario y que en seguida trabajen para que tengan su familia. Por otra parte pretende mejorar su vivienda con una habitación más para vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 53 years old and in a relationship. Her companion works as a health promoter in the city. They have two children. The first child is studying in the city and is in his sixth year toward earning a Doctor of Medicine degree. The second child is in his first year of study toward a degree in Physical Education. She and her husband live alone, but her children stay with them on the weekends since they are still dependent on them.

Blanca works as the director of a school in her canton. She has been in this profession for 30 years. From the time she was a girl, Blanca dreamed of becoming a teacher because she enjoyed studying. Therefore, she decided on this profession and moved forward. At the moment, this is her only means of earning a living. Prior to working, her only responsibility was helping her parents with the household chores. The school where she works is two kilometers away from her house. In order to get to work, she travels by bus, but sometimes she will ride with her husband on his motorcycle.

Blanca will invest this loan in the purchase of two books that her son needs for his medical studies. The rest of the money will be used to pay his enrollment fees and the first few tuition payments at the university. She will also buy other materials that both of her children need so that they can save money and invest it in other needs that may arise.

Blanca dreams of seeing her children graduate with their university degrees and continue on toward starting their families. She also intends to make an improvement to her home by adding another room so that she can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase books, pay the enrollment fees and tuition, and purchase other materials for her children's university education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medications and pay for examinations

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosita de Lima” de la Asociación Arariwa.
El socio continua con su negocio de venta de veneno para plagas y roedores, él socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de veneno para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosita de Lima”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He continues to operate a business in which he sells poisons for pests and rodents. He has been in this business for several years and it has brought him both financial and personal satisfaction. The borrower is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that his family can get ahead.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy poisons for his business. The borrower is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy poisons for pests and rodents.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is 62 years old and from Duero, Bohol. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. Delfina is a hardworking woman in spite of her age. She is a vegetable dealer and has sold vegetables for a living for 21 years now. 

She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy eggplant, tomatoes and bok choy. She knows how to manage the demand of vegetables to earn more. She hopes that with her business, she can continue to expand, reinvest and save for old age. Delfina's income provides food for her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes and bok choy

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Lorena de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y agua de cocos en las afueras de su casa desde hace varios años posee mucha clientela por que es un producto muy vendible y también por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Lorena esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas por mayor, azúcar, hilos, cocos, bolsas, pajillas, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lorena is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her family.  She has worked  for several years selling drinks and coconut water outside her house. She has many customers because her product is very marketable, and because of her good prices and her friendliness when she sells.  With her earnings she is able to pay some of her household expenses.  Lorena is requesting a loan to buy wholesale fruit, sugar, string, coconuts, bags, straws, etc. in order to continue working and thereby provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit, sugar, string, coconuts, bags, straws, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 64 years old and from the town of Duero, Bohol. She is married with five adult children. She lives with her husband in her home, and he engages in farming. Rosita is also in farming. She has farmed vegetables and spring onions for 10 years now. 

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer. This will help so she can maintain a healthy vegetable garden and expect a better harvest soon.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm for an increased business profitability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is aged 47 with five children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her business is banana selling alongside farming to supplement her income. She started the business to support her family, despite being challenged by high transportation costs. She has a dream of educating her children to the university and having enough stock to supply to her customers. Jane needs the loan to buy fresh foods like bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is a 27-year-old mother of two children living in the Moung Russey district of the Battambang Province in Cambodia. She works as a local farmer who does rice cropping and pineapple planting on her own farm, and also works for others for a fee during her spare time.
