CONFIANCE (“Trust”) is a group in the Benkadi association in Komo, a village in the rural commune of Tiele. The group is made up of five women who know each other through being relations and neighbours. They have an average age of 36 and are all married with three children on average. 

The group members are involved in various businesses, such as selling produce, like Mariam who is pictured sitting in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in Komo in the Baguineda sub-prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali). 

They have all been running these small businesses for several years and are highly sought-after for the produce they sell: peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, etc.

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme three years ago. This is their fourth solidarity loan. 

Group leader Mariam, who is well-known in Komo, is very good at selling produce. She is planning to use her loan to buy various kinds of produce (peppers, tomatoes, onions and cabbages). She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her produce to individuals in Komo, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Mariam hopes to make 40 000 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her produce business.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Mouni-Dzifa

texts.fr: Mouni- Dzifa âgée de 23ans vit avec son conjoint revendeur de pièces auto et leur enfant d'01an à Lomé. Afin de contribuer aux dépenses familiales, elle a démarré la vente des produits de beauté et des produits divers au marché. Son premier crédit lui servira d'acheter des produits de beauté et autres... Elle espère louer une boutique pour l'activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mouni-Dzifa is 23 years old and lives in Lomé with her husband and their one-year-old child. Her husband sells automobile parts. 

In order to contribute to the family expenses Mouni-Dzifa has begun selling beauty products and other items at the market. Her first loan will help her buy beauty products and other items. She hopes to rent a shop for the business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and other items.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
KOTOTALA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la restauration à l’image de SALI qui est la seule personne  assise de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  Sous Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités, vente de restaurant : viande, haricot, etc.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. 
SALI, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des viandes, poissons, des condiments et des céréales.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits alimentaires à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 48.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
Kototala is a group in the Benkadi association in Tiele. The group is made up of four married women who know each other through being relations and neighbours. They have an average age of 30 and are all married, with three children on average. 

The group members are all involved in different businesses, such as catering, like Sali who is pictured sitting in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in Tiele in the Baguineda sub-prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali). 

The women have been running small businesses for several years and are highly sought-after for the food they sell: meat, beans, etc.

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme three years ago. This is their fourth solidarity loan. 

Sali intends to use her loan to buy meat, fish, condiments and cereals. She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her food to individuals in Tiele, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Sali hopes to make 48 000 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her catering business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her catering business.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de FANTA qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la Sous Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate, oignon, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
FANTA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante des condiments de différentes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 42.500FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group in the Benkadi association in Tiele. The group is made up of six women who know each other through being relations and neighbours. Their average age is 51 and they are all married, with three children on average. 

The women are all involved in different businesses, such as selling produce, like Fanta who is pictured sitting on the left. They live in large traditional families in Tiele in the Baguineda sub-prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali).
 
The group members have been running small businesses for several years and are highly sought-after for the produce they sell: peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc. 

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme. This is their fourth solidarity loan. 

Fanta intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of different kinds of produce. She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her produce to individuals in Tiele, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Fanta hopes to make 42 500 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Yiriwasso Group

texts.fr:
YIRIWASSO est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de KOMO, dans la commune rurale de TIELE. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de AWA qui est la seule personne assise de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KOMO dans la  Sous Préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
AWA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiment alimentaire de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, et sel de cuisine).  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à KOMO, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Yiriwasso is a group in the Benkadi association in Komo, a village in the rural commune of Tiele. The group is made up of five women who know each other through being relations and neighbours. They have an average age of 40 and are all married, with three children on average. 

The women are all involved in different businesses, such as selling produce, like Awa who is pictured sitting in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in Komo in the Baguineda sub-prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali). 

All the women have been running small businesses for several years and are highly sought-after for the produce they sell: peppers, tomatoes, etc. 

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme three years ago. This is their fourth solidarity loan. 

Awa is planning to use her loan to buy various items of condiments and produce (peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbages and cooking salt). She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her produce to individuals in Komo, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Awa hopes to make 40 000 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
YEREDON est un groupe de l’association SIGUIDATON du quartier BAMANANKING de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne un enfant, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente des produits de beauté  à l’image de OUMOU  qui est la troisième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente des produits beauté : parfums, bracelets, boule d’oreille, savon, pommade,  etc.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. 
OUMOU, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  2 cartons de parfums et 2 douzaines de crèmes et pommades).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 21.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente des produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Yeredon is a group in the Siguidaton association in the Bamananking neighbourhood of Ouelessebougou. The group is made up of four women who know each other through being relations and neighbours. They have an average age of 27 and are all married, with one child on average. 

The group members are all involved in different businesses, such as selling beauty products, like Oumou who is pictured standing third from the left. The women live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou in the Kati prefecture (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali).
 
They have all been running small businesses for several years and are highly sought-after for the beauty products they sell: perfumes, bracelets, earrings, soap, ointment, etc.

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme. This is their second solidarity loan. 

Oumou will use her loan to buy two boxes of perfumes and two dozen pots of cream and ointment. She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally and sells her products to individuals in Ouelessebougou, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Oumou hopes to make 21 000 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business buying and selling beauty products.

loans.use: Achat des produits de beauté

loans.name: Cinyabuguma Group

texts.fr: La cliente Jeannette est une commerçante et présidente du groupe d’affaires «Cinyabuguma», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 34 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse de lait caillé. Elle installe ses marchandises à son domicile dans un quartier  animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un chauffeur de poids lourds (conducteur camion). Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 600 kg de lait. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, devenir grossiste, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Jeanette is a businesswoman and the leader of the Cinyabuguma business group. A dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, she is 34 years old and has four children, who are all in school. 

Jeanette sells “lait caillé", a thin yoghurt produced using milk. She sells her products from her home in a busy neighbourhood. She received her first capital to start her business from her husband, who is a lorry-driver, and later on she took out a loan with IMF Hekima. 

Jeanette has been running her business for twelve years now. This new loan will help her buy 600kg of milk. In this way, she would like to increase her capital and become a wholesaler, so she can clothe and feed her children and send them to school. 

Finally, Jeanette would like to thank Hekima for promoting the independence of women entrepreneurs who cannot access the banking system, especially at this critical moment when war has broken out in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 600kg of milk.

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es: Don Pablo es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa variada. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro aumentar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita el nuevo crédito para comprar ropa escolar tales como: Faldas, Camisas, Camisolas, Calcetines entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá surtir los productos en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Pablo's from the city of Boaco.  He's a merchant by trade and makes a living selling a variety of clothing.  He's grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he was able to increase his sales and satisfy customer demand.

Pablo's requesting a new loan to buy school clothing such as skirts, shirts, sports shirts, socks, and other products.  He thinks the loan will be a big help to him because he'll be able to stock his business and earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy school clothing such as skirts, shirts, sports shirts, and socks

loans.name: Helma's Group

texts.en:
Helma is a Group leader in Busia District. She is pictured here in a group of 10 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 82 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Helma has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. 

Helma is a reliable member of the community. She is married and has 5 children. Helma is 48 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support her family. In addition to this, Helma is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group and burial committee. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages. 

Helma is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Helma joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices and learn new farming methods. She likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the word about One Acre Fund farmers. Helma has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. In the future, Helma hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school and invest in a business. 

Helma's Group needs a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers' harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing to the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad is 43 years old and a married woman and mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Arshad’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Arshad has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare auto parts. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Arshad is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare auto parts.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma has been working in a business manufacturing flowers for many years. She knows the method of making beautiful flowers from fabric, paper, and other materials. She also arranges wedding garlands for brides and grooms and flowers out every material she finds suitable. The immense experience in the art of flower making has lent her great versatility in making flowers to meet her clients' needs. 

It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation, and she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional materials such as bundles of glace papers and tissue papers, along with glue, wire and floral tape. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales, which ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, such as bundles of glace papers and tissue papers, along with glue, wire, and floral tape.

loans.name: Kyule

texts.en:
Kyule is a 48-year-old man who is married to Cicilia and is a father to four children. He sells newspapers in Akila in the outskirts of Kangemi. He has been in this business for ten years and earns a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings.

This will be Kyule's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to add to his newspaper stock. He wants to be a successful business man in future.

loans.use: to purchase more newspapers

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is thirty-five years old, married to Annah and supports a family of seven. His children are aged between eight and five months old. He has been a dairy farmer for the last seven years with a monthly income of KES 45,000. Samuel learnt about VisionFund from a staff member of the organisation.

He has borrowed a first loan of KES 75,000, which will facilitate him in purchasing an additional dairy cow. This is likely to earn him more from milk sales. He will use the additional gain to repay the loan and fees for schooling his children.

His dream is to grow his business and supply milk to institutions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Khalida requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. This is her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: blanca vive en casa propia con su esposo y su familia, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los mercados de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con ayuda de su esposo logran sacar a delante a su familia, blanca esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así continuar con sus cultivos para obtener mejor ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their family.  She devotes her time to farming, growing corn and beans.  She sells her products in markets that purchase and sell basic grains.  With the earnings from her sales, and with her husband's help, they are able to get their family ahead. 

Blanca is seeking this loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as: fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc.  With this, she will continue with her crops in order to improve her earnings and provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase seeds fertilizers, compost, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is from Garcia-Hernandez in Bohol. She is a 49-year-old married woman with six children. Her eldest is 25 and her youngest is 7. For ten years now, she has been farming vegetables like the sponge gourd. She is asking for a loan to support her business. She will use it to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides that are necessary for her to keep her vegetables healthy.

In the future, she hopes to have other business opportunities to better provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius used the previous loan to buy iron sheets to roof his house. He also deals in motorcycle transportation as a source of a side income.

For the need to employ himself, he ventured into this business. He has also gone ahead and bought land for construction. His dream is to construct rentals and buy a car. His challenge is seasonal changes. Julius needs the loan to buy a lawn mowing machine for compound cutting.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mowing machine for compound cutting

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio es una persona responsable y amigable que se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, puertas, camas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Claudio requiere otro crédito para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cola, maderas y clavos.

Claudio continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Claudio is a responsible and friendly person who works making wood furniture like tables, chairs, doors, beds, and other items.  At this moment, Claudio is in need of another loan to purchase more work material such as: glue, wood and nails.

Claudio remains a member of the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank, which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he has been given through them, and he is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: purchase more materials for his work such as: glue, wood and nails.

loans.name: Adelaidita

texts.en:
Adelaidita is 60 years old and from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with four grown children. For six months now, Adelaidita has been selling barbecue, mostly in the afternoon and evening. She works hard because she would like to help even her grandchildren's needs. She is asking for a loan to buy cooking oil, catsup, soy sauce, spices, and meat. 

Adelaidita hopes that her life will improve together with her children and grandchildren with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, catsup, soy sauce, spices, and meat.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Meet Lucy, a farmer living in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has 3 children, all of school going age, and has been farming for 15 years. Lucy produces and sells milk, tea, fruits, and vegetables. Besides farming, Lucy has a retail business. She loves farming, because it is very profitable, but her major challenges are crop pests, diseases, and insufficient funds.

Lucy chose Juhudi Kilimo to finance her green house project, because its loans have low interest rates.This loan will benefit Lucy by bringing in income that will allow her to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to construct a green house.

loans.name: Om-Jahad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Jahad and consists of four women who are all hard-working. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 150,000 YER. 

Entsar is 26 years old and married. She is a housewife who exerts herself in order to raise her child and to have a good life. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She said she has a small amount of money which she collected herself. Due to the high cost of goods, it is not enough to cover her household needs.

She has requested a loan to buy home appliances to use in her house. She hopes to build a big house and enroll her child in a private school.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to use in her house

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a hardworking married woman with 5 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. At the age of 37, she deals in fresh foods selling fruits and vegetables. She started this business in 2008 to generate income to become self sustainable. Her vision is to educate her children so they can become independent. Her main business challenge is the speed at which fresh foods perish. Rose has requested for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Truth. They are in their eighth loan cycle with ID Ghana, and they are committed to working hard and helping their respective families to live well. They are into selling fruit drinks, wigs, and hair products. 

Lydia sells fruits drinks (standing on the left with a sample in her hand) in order to be able to help her family with her work. She has been doing this job for 11 years and still counting. She is 37 years old, married and has one child. She is doing work because she wanted to be self-sufficient before she married. Lydia is requesting this loan in order to purchase more fruit drinks to sell to customers, because she has lots of orders and customers she wants to satisfy. She and Linda, who is a wigs and hair products seller, need GHS 2,200 in total to improve their businesses. They are grateful for the opportunity they are getting.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit drinks to sell to customers, because she has lots of orders and customers she wants to satisfy.

loans.name: Zaven

texts.en:
Zaven is from Lusaghbyur Village. He lives together with his parents and two brothers. Zaven helps his family with agriculture. They run a farm, which includes raising cows, chickens and calves as well as cultivating some potatoes for family use only. 

Zaven and his elder brother are army officers, but when they are at home they help their parents with farming. By applying for this loan, Zaven and his family are asking for financial support to be able to enlarge their farm. The loan will help them to purchase barley, potato seeds and grass as forage for their livestock. The family will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

As this is Zaven's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they had no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for barley, potato seeds and grass as forage for their livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, salt, vita, rice, pepper and other items for her business.

loans.name: God Is Good 2 Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called God is Good 2. They are in their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, and they are committed to working hard and helping their respective families to get ahead. They are into selling slippers, pastries and doughnuts.

Francisca sells slippers in order to be able to help her family with her work. She has been doing this job for 6 years and still counting. She is 29 years old, single and has no children. She is doing work because she want to be self sufficient before she is married. 

Francisca is requesting this loan in order to purchase slippers to sell because she has lots of orders and customers she wants to satisfy. Since this job is seasonal, she would switch to another seasonal job when the time is due. She and Ellen, who is a pastries and doughnut seller, need 2,100 GHS in total to improve their businesses. They are grateful for the opportunity they are getting.

loans.use: to purchase slippers to sell

loans.name: Tarab

texts.en: Tarab is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. Tarab was born in 1965. She is married and a mother of eight. Her daughter who appears in the picture is a university student, majoring in class teaching. She is in her third year and is planning to work in her field of study after graduation in order to support her family financially. Now Tarab is requesting a loan to pay for her daughters' upcoming semester fees as she is facing a financial crisis during this period.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters' upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah was born in 1978. She is married and lives with her husband and her three children in a sector of Jordan called Madaba. She has been trying her best to support her husband to improve their living conditions by running her project of selling clothes at her house for the past four year. Now she needs to expand it by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sand, bricks, iron, electrical wiring, flashlights, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Eddy Pablo

texts.es: Eddy nació en la ciudad de Colquepata pero vive en la ciudad de Huancarani al sur de la ciudad del Perú, él tiene 23 años pero aun no tiene hijos. Su actividad económica es la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, roperos y otros más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Eddy was born in the city of Colquepata but lives in Huarcarani, to the south of the city of Cusco.  He's 23 years old but still doesn't have any children.

Eddy's job is making wood furniture such as tables, chairs, wardrobes, and other pieces.  He has been in this business for several years and it's going very well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Currently Eddy needs a loan to buy supplies for work such as wood.

He's grateful for and appreciates the loan, and promises to make his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia pertenece al banco comunal "Mamacha Rosario" de la Asociación Arariwa. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, ella cultivo  como por ejemplo trigo, cebada, moraya seca, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Celia requiere el préstamo para comprar abono.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank, which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  Her main financial activity is farming.  She grows wheat, barley, dried potatoes, corn, and other products.  She has worked in this sector for many years, and thanks to the effort that she puts into her work, it has gone very well for her.

At this moment, Celia is in need of a loan to purchase manure.

loans.use: purchase manure.

loans.name: Kareema

texts.en:
Kareema was born in 1972 and is married and a mother of seven. She is a conservative woman and asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her. Kareema’s husband works in a governmental entity and the family lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. After Kareema noticed the financial crisis her husband is facing, she decided to start a business selling homemade desserts. She has been running her project for five months. Kareema has found her business to be profitable and decided to expand it. 

Kareema is requesting a loan to buy a dessert paste maker that will allow her to be more productive and do her work faster.

loans.use: to buy a dessert paste maker

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik is from Vanadzor town and lives with her 11-year-old daughter. Satik sells bags from a rented store in the center of the town. Satik works hard to satisfy her customers' needs and provide them high quality service. It is very difficult for her to sustain her and her daughter's living without any support, but due to hard and tireless work, she provides normal conditions for her small family.

Now, by applying for this loan, Satik would like to ask financial support to be able to purchase new stock of bags for selling to customers and satisfy current market demand. Satik has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions she wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her retail business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Satik has been approved for this loan.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of bags for selling to customers

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya is from Geghasar Village where she lives with her husband (in the photo), two grown sons (ages 22 and 21 years old) and a newborn son (in the photo). The family runs a farm of four cows, calves and 20 chickens. The family also owns a plot of land where they cultivate wheat, potato, and grass as well as growing plum, apple and pear trees. Melanya's husband sells the gathered harvest in the market and earns income for his family.
 
Near the house where the family lives, they own a barn, which is currently in very bad condition, and the family faces difficulties for keeping the livestock there. So, Melanya has applied for this loan to be able to ask financial support from Kiva lenders to renovate the barn. As for the future, Melanya and her husband have a building near their house, which they want to rebuild as a barn and enlarge the farming business.

Now, this hardworking family asks your support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of their barn

loans.name: Rafida

texts.en:
Rafida was born in 1991 and is a married lady. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Rafida’s husband works at a hotel and she has a small home workshop at her house for tailoring. Rafida has been working for seven years using an old sewing machine. Now that she has more orders for sewing and tailoring clothes, she has found that she needs to upgrade her machine and buy more machines to speed up her work. 

Rafida has therefore applied for a youth loan to buy more sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer luchadora que a sus 33 años, tiene una niña de 6 años y un niño de 8 años, vive en un barrio vulnerable de San Lorenzo, en la actualidad trabaja de promotora para el Gobierno; su esposo, no tiene un trabajo fijo,  pero realiza labores de minería.  
Lorena tiene un local de venta de ropa de niños jóvenes y adultos, en el que le dá trabajo a una señora para que se lo atienda.  
El presente crédito es para adquirir más ropa de niños, y pantalones para damas, que son los productos que más se venden en el pueblo.
A Lorena le agrada mucho compartir con sus amigas en labores comunitarias, es muy comprometida en su tarea y muy responsable con su familia.
Lorena agradece mucho a FODEMI y a KIVA por el apoyo que dan a la poblacion vulnerable.
texts.en:
Thirty-three year old Lorena is a plucky woman. She has an six-year-old daughter and a son, eight, and lives in the El Pedregal barrio, a suburb of San Lorenzo that has many problems. Lorena currently has a home provided by a government organisation. Her husband has no fixed job but does mining work.

Lorena has a shop where she sells clothes for children, young people and adults. She provides work to another woman who tends to the customers.

This loan will be used to buy children's clothes and women's trousers, as these are the products that sells best in this town.

Lorena really enjoys spending time with her friends doing community work. Lorena is committed to her work and very responsible with her family.

Lorena thanks "FODEMI" and Kiva for the support that they are giving to poor people.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes and women's trousers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more beer, oil, pepper, soft drinks, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and coal for her business

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal was born in 1966. She is married and a mother of three. Her husband is a contractor. Amal has been sewing and selling general products such as clothes, accessories, and cosmetic products for three years. She started her project after she noticed the financial crisis her husband is facing. So she decided to help him in covering their children's needs. She is planning to expand her project more in the future by buying more fabric to sew more curtains and to buy a sewing machine to raise her productivity. Now she is requesting a loan to add new products which will attract more customers, such as detergents, perfumes, baby clothes, and stationary tools.

loans.use: to add new products to her business like detergents, perfumes, and stationery tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To merchandise her mini market with new food products

loans.name: Al-Helal Group

texts.en:
The Al-Helal Group consists of five women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They have asked for a loan in the total amount of 200,000 YER from AMB (Al-Amal Microfinance Bank). 

Najood, 39 years old, is a married woman with four children. She is illiterate and lives with her children in a small house. She works very hard to provide her family with everything they need, but what she earns is really not enough. For three years, she has been a door-to-door clothes and cosmetics seller. To date she has earned good profits, and she now wants to expand her business, which would enable her to earn more money. As a result, she applied for a loan to buy clothes and cosmetic materials for her business. She hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Peace, and they have created a strong circle of support with each other. In each weekly meeting, they emphasize the confidence, accountability and adherence to training that they have been receiving from ID-Ghana. Their goal is to continue together for many more loan cycles and maintain an excellent credit record. In addition, they are gaining a lot of useful knowledge each week with the ID-Ghana Loan Officer, who presents various educational training on relevant and useful themes like financial management, nutrition and health. It is the combination of the loans and education that makes the Micro Credit Program of ID-Ghana so useful to Peace group members.

Augustin is a vehicle spare parts dealer and has been doing this job for six years. He is 40 years old, married and has one child. He is a tenant in Dansoman. He needs this loan to buy more vehicle parts to sell to car-dealing customers.
 
He and Regina, who is a paint seller, will together need a total amount 5,700 GHS (Ghana cedis) to better their businesses. Each one is responsible for one another's repayment of the loan (group pressure). They want to share that they are very grateful to Kiva investors for believing in them and funding their loans.

loans.use: To buy more vehicle parts to sell to car-dealing customers.

loans.name: Om-Salah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Salah and consists of four members. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals.
 
Nashwa is 40 years old and is the leader of the group. She sells sweets. She has been doing this for three years. She says that she began this business when she felt her husband wasn't able to cover all the expenses of his family. She is hardworking and through effort and dedication has managed to overcome adversity and get ahead. She is asking for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB (Al-Amal Microfinance Bank) to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business. She is working towards increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 32 years old and from Loon, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 3 and 7. For five years now, she has been engaged in food vending and operating a sari-sari (convenience) store. She sell home-cooked meals like noodles and sauteed vegetables, as well as biscuits, seasonings and toiletries. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fuel (liquified petroleum gas), biscuits and spices. 

She hopes to make a success out of her business someday. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fuel (liquified petroleum gas), biscuits and spices

loans.name: Mwebia

texts.en:
Mwebia is a farmer who resides in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya with his wife and 2 children, who are both of school-going age.

He has an acre of land where he has been doing farming for 8 years and he majors in crops like tea, fruits and vegetables. He also rears poultry and sells his produce. He also has a retail business. In farming, he enjoys getting good returns from his farm and having good markets. His major challenges are insufficient water, crops pests and diseases.

Mwebia chose Juhudi Kilimo because it offers secure loans to farmers at low interest rates, so it will help him acquire water pipes to help him sprinkle his tea plantations. He says that this loan will help him educate his children well and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 50 years old and married with six children from the ages of six to 23. She is from the town of Panglao. For the past ten years, Adela has sold fish in her neighborhood to make a living. She usually sells what her family catches and also buys fresh fish from fishermen to resell. 

Adela is requesting a 9,000 PHP to buy fish, food for her family, and to pay for boat maintenance. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy fish, food for her family, and to pay for boat maintenance

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia solamente estudio seis meses de  primer grado,  por cuestiones económicas ya no pudo seguir estudiando. Ella es casada su esposo trabaja en el destacamento militar se desempeña como sastre, todas sus hijas viven con ella y están estudiando.

Ella administra una tienda, hace pan, tamales posee una finca donde ella también le dedica tiempo, cultiva hortalizas por tener muchas fuentes de trabajo, ella no sabe definir bien cuanto tiempo le dedica a cada una de las actividades que realiza de igual manera toda la familia le colabora en el trabajo. 
Sonia acostumbra a vender ollas de loza y comales en la comunidad, por lo que piensa invertir una parte del crédito en compra de loza y la otra parte la utilizara para pago de mozos que tiene trabajando la finca de su propiedad.  Ella piensa aumentar su inventario en la tienda de igual manera piensa seguir manteniendo la finca para que la cosecha continúe,  todo el esfuerzo que ella realiza es para ayudarle a sus hijos para que estudien y sean profesionales y no les falte nada para que ellos luego trabajen y sigan alcanzando sus objetivos, piensa que como administre el dinero así será las ganancias que recibiera de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Sonia only attended first grade for one month because of financial reasons and she was not able to continue.  She is married and her husband works as a tailor at the military base.  All of her daughters live with her and attend a school.

She cares for her store, bakes bread and tamales, and also has a farm where she raises vegetables so she can have many sources of income.  She can’t say how much time she really spends on each activity, but she does them all equally, and the whole family contributes. 

Sonia used to sell clay pots and griddles in the community, and she plans to invest some of the money from this loan to buy clay and the rest to pay field hands.  She plans to increase her inventory in the store and also maintain her harvest continuously.  Everything she does is to help her children so that they can go to school and become professionals, and so they need for nothing and they can later go to work and reach their goals.  She believes that she will earn from her businesses if she manages her money this way.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more salt, rice, oil, pepper, Vita seasoning, onions and tomatoes for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes cannot thank Kiva lenders and UGAFODE Microfinance enough for the way they have supported her in educating her children. In her words, Agnes, a soft-spoken lady, commented, "What could I ever have done without UGAFODE? I have educated all my children using the loans. Thank you UGAFODE for the tremendous work, and Kiva lenders for partnering with us. We are forever grateful." 

She will use this loan to pay tuition for her daughters and is committed to repaying her loans well.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her daughters

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 31 años, nació en Bogotá y se crió en un pueblo del Tolima, madre de 4 hermosos niños, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
Hace 18 años sandra vive en Bogotá, cuidad que la acogió al salir del pueblo donde fue criada, sandra desde entonces a luchado por hacer los sueños realidad, pero los a visto troncados debido a la situación económica en la que vive, siempre a querido profesionalizarse pero no ha sido posible.

Hoy en día sandra vive con las mismas falencias económicas pero con una oportunidad que le ha brindado una institución de muy alta calidad educativa como lo es campo alto, dicha institución a logrado que sandra retome de nuevo las metas y vuelva a soñar en  salir adelante y capacitarse en la profesión que ama entrañablemente, el área de la salud al igual que una mejor calidad de vida para la familia.

Con deseos de ayudar a los demás, pues es de la que piensa que adquiriendo una educación y más en el área de la salud puede ayudar a los más necesitados, además le da  la gran satisfacción personal de saber que ella a podido ayudar a las demás personas, pero en este momento sandra se encuentra preocupada, pues ve que de nuevo por el mismo problema el factor económico  posiblemente no pueda seguir estudiando y se encuentra pidiendo el convenio de kiva, pues no quiere una vez más dejar el proyecto de vida a un lado.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 31 year old woman.  She was born in Bogota and grew up in the town of Tolima.  She is the mother of four children, is very enterprising, and has many desires for getting ahead.

Sandra has been living in Bogota for 18 years and adopted this city when she left her native town.  Since then, Sandra has strived to make her dreams a reality, but she has seen them derail because of the economic conditions under which she lives.  She has always wanted to become a professional, but it has not been possible. 

Today Sandra lives under the same economic conditions but the opportunity she has gotten from a quality institute of higher education has allowed her to restart her goals and she continues to dream about getting ahead and train in a profession that she loves, health care.  She will also be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She wants this education so she can help the neediest people with their health.  She also gets great satisfaction knowing that she helped others, but she’s worried about the same economic factors that may prevent her from continuing with her education.  She is asking for this loan through Kiva because she doesn’t want to set her life’s plan aside.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

John is married and has four children. His wife is a fishmonger while he is a fisherman and also a brick maker. They have a farm where they grow maize, millet and beans. They have been farming for ten years now. John is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project to undertake and because it will earn him extra income.

This is John’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to expand his business and pay school fees for his children. John’s hope for the future is to change his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Donatila

texts.es:
Doña Donatila es una mujer emprendedora, casada y madre de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son los que ayudan a su padre en las diferentes actividades de campo y 1 esta pequeño. A muy temprana edad ella aprendió a cultivar granos básicos así como la siembra de maíz y frijol. Doña Donatila tiene un grado de estudio primario incompleto pues solo curso hasta el tercer año de primaria ya que su pasión se centró en el trabajo de campo. Cuando ella formo su hogar junto a su esposo decidieron plantar café para diversificar sus ingresos y no depender solo del cultivo de granos básicos lo cual hasta el día de hoy lo practican teniendo una parcela de tierra sembrada y otra por empezar a plantar.
Doña Donatila es una mujer visionaria con mucha fe en su trabajo y en su plantación así que para que sus cultivos tengan un mejor resultado ella solicita financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a cubrir los gastos que son necesarios y fundamentales para darle asistencia necesaria a la cosecha que se a vecina en el presente año por el cual debe tener a la disposición fertilizante, abono, foliares entre otros ya que así podrá controlar y prevenir las diferentes plagas que afectan a la planta de café obteniendo al final de la cosecha un mejor grano. Su meta es poder obtener mejores ganancia para seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Donatila is an enterprising woman and mother of three children, two of whom help their father with the various field activities; one child is very young.  [Donatila] learned to raise basic grains, such as corn and beans, at a very young age.  She has an incomplete elementary school education because she only attended to third grade, so the fields became her passion.  When she and her husband married, they decided to plant coffee to diversify their income and not have to depend only on basic grains.  They still do this today on a parcel of land and they are starting to plant on another.

Donatila is a visionary woman with lots of faith in her work and in her planting, so she is asking for this loan so that her crops will produce better results.  She will use the money to buy farming supplies that will help the crops.  She will buy fertilizer, compost, seedlings, etc. so she can prevent the various plagues that affect the coffee so she can obtain a better bean.  Her goal is to improve her earnings, so she can continue expanding her coffee crops and be a better parent.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

David is married and has ten children. He is a mason and he also engages in fishing. His wife is a housewife. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing cassava, maize, millet and a tree plantation. David is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him extra income and also provide him with honey.

This is David’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. David’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project and increase honey production.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.es:
Oliver es un joven trabajador y responsable que  sale adelante y ayuda a su familia. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio técnico de electricidad y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio, él pertenece  al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como cables, resistencias, chips y otras cosas más. 

Agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad sus cuotas.
texts.en: Oliver is a responsible, hardworking young man who gets ahead and helps his family.  His main business is providing services as an electrician, and he has a small workshop in his home.  He belongs to the “Mamacha Rosario” Communal Bank, with the “Arariwa” Association.  At this time, he is requesting the loan to purchase work materials such as cables, resistors, chips, and other items.  He is grateful to the investors for the loan, and he promises to make his payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase work materials such as cables, resistors, chips, and other items.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David tiene 26 años, casado con dos hijos que tiene la edad de 3 y 1 años, él trabaja como chofer, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, el señor David va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona donde él  vive no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que el señor David tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: David is 26 and is married with two children aged 3 and 1. He works as a driver. This is his first loan, and he will use it to finish installing water in his home, as they currently only have a well and it's hard work to bring the water to the house. He will connect water to the bath, shower and kitchen, giving his family a higher level of comfort. For numerous reasons the area they live in doesn't have many basic services, but David will not let this stop him from having drinking water in his home. He is very happy that this opportunity will allow him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to finish installing water in his home.

loans.name: John Chico's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are a group of primary school teachers located in Masogbo village, near Makeni city. This group of able and dedicated school teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 6,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayment on their behalf. 

John is the featured leader of this team. Aged 59, John was born in Masongbo village. He is married to a school teacher and the couple has three children who are attending secondary and tertiary academic institutions. John has been a professional school teacher for 39 years now. He has requested a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Clement is married and has seven children. He is a retired teacher, while his wife is a farmer. She has been farming for 15 years now, and she is currently growing sunflower, maize and sorghum on their farm. Clement is excited about beekeeping, as it will provide him with honey for medicinal use.

This is Clement’s first loan with Honey Care, and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to start a small business and pay school fees for his children. Clement’s hope for the future is to have a profitable beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Patric

texts.en:
Patric is married with eight children. Three of his children are in school and the rest dropped out due to the lack of tuition. Patric works raising and fattening cattle and goat to earn an income. His major business challenge is the limited size of the land where he can graze cows and water shortages in the dry season which affect his animals. These challenges affect his cash flow.

Patric is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan to buy more cows and goats for fattening to later sell at a profit. He hopes to construct a dam so that he can store water to help him provide for his animals during the dry season. Patric thanks UGAFODE for the good service rendered to the local community.

loans.use: to buy cattle and goats

loans.name: Belal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Belal and consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Fatima, the leader of the group, is a 53-year-old married housewife. She works hard to provide for her family

She has requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She intends to buy a cupboard for her bedroom. She hopes to furnish her house so as to make it more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a cupboard for her bedroom.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Peter is married and has twenty children. He is a para-vet (animal health worker) and he also provides beekeeping services. His wife is a fish monger. They have a farm where they have been farming for twenty-five years now, and they are currently growing watermelon, paw paws, beans, green grams, pumpkins, sunflowers, maize, millet and they are also keeping dairy goats. Peter is excited about beekeeping, as it an enterprise that is simple and less involving, and it will provide him with honey for medicinal use as well.

This is Peter’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and buy books and school uniforms for them. Peter’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project and increase honey production.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Al-Farah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Farah and consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Samira is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives in Aden, Yemen. She is a housewife who puts forth effort to raise and educate her children well. 

She is applying for a loan from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase a fridge. She is aiming to have a business store to gain more profits so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge to use for house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement, corrugated iron sheets, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Don Juan Manuel es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz y Trigo. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que el crédito le ayudo a comprar el alimento para el ganado y mantenerlo en buen estado para la realización de la siembra. Solicita el nuevo crédito para comprar: Alimentos para el ganado. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá mantener a su ganado en perfectas condiciones y utilizarlo cuando sea necesario.
texts.en: Juan Manuel comes from Boaco. He is a farmer who grows corn and wheat. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito as this loan will help him to buy food for his livestock and keep them in good shape for ploughing the land when he is sowing seeds. He is asking for a new loan to buy cattle feed. He thinks that the loan will be a great help as he will be able to keep his animals in top condition and use them when he needs them.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Wadi Al-Qadhy Group

texts.en:
This group of four hard-working women is called Wadi Al-Qadhy. The members live in Taiz, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 200,000 YER from AMB. Kateba is a 39-year-old married woman living with her family in a poor area in Taiz. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, who are presently living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. 

Kateba has therefore requested a loan from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials like wood and cement in order to finish building her house. She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like wood and cement in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Uriel Fernando

texts.es:
Uriel es un hombre creativo, emprendedor y pujante. Vivía en Medellín, donde trabajó por varios años en una empresa dedicada a la producción de molduras en yeso, luego, por circunstancias de la vida, tuvo que trasladarse para otro municipio, allí se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir un almacén de pinturas y molduras en yeso y, aprovechando su experiencia y conocimiento ha logrado buenos resultados durante los 2 meses que lleva bajo su manejo, además cuenta con la ventaja de ser el único negocio de este tipo en el municipio, adicionalmente presta el servicio de asesoría en decoración de interiores a domicilio y así, complementa los ingresos para dar sustento a su único hijo de 5 años de edad y para solventar los gastos personales.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio y posicionarlo en el mercado, desea invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de molduras siliconadas y yeso, así tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer, satisfaciendo las necesidades y gustos de su clientela, lo que dará como resultado, un incremento en las ventas e ingresos.
Uriel manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es independizar el taller de producción y el punto de venta, pues así podrá generar más oportunidades de empleo y mejorará las condiciones de vida y bienestar a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Uriel is a creative, entrepreneurial and driven man who used to live in Medellín and worked there for several years at a business that produced plaster molds. Relatively recently, he moved to another town and was able to acquire a painting and plaster molding workshop, where he has applied his skills and experience over the past two months to lead the workshop in a profitable direction. In addition, Uriel's workshop has the distinct advantage of being the only one of its kind in his town. He also offers interior decoration services to clients on the side to generate additional income and provide for his 5-year-old son.

With the support from this loan, Uriel plans to purchase materials for his business, including plaster and siliconized molds. He hopes this investment will strengthen his business and allow him to offer a wider variety of products to his clients. Uriel's dream is to grow and strengthen his business and generate employment opportunities for members of his community so that he can providing a bright future for his young son.

loans.use: to purchase siliconized molds and plaster for his business.

loans.name: Silver

texts.en: Sliver is married with ten children, six of whom are in school while the others are helping him on the farm. Silver deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income. He buys baby cows, feeds them for some period of time and later sells them for a big profit. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to help him buy more cows for fattening. He also has hopes of taking his children back to school after increasing his income. His major challenge is inadequate income for running his business which has affected his progress. Despite these challenges, Silver is a very honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy baby cows.

loans.name: Aklil Group

texts.en: The Aklil group consists of four hardworking women from Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a group loan and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment. Muna is a very active woman from a poor family. Her husband is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to meet the family's needs. Muna's husband works hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothing. She loves her children and tries her best to raise her children well and to offer them a good life. She would like to buy a laptop, but she doesn`t have money. She decided to apply for a loan from AMB to buy a laptop to use for her children's education. She wants to provide for her children's needs in order to provide them with the best education.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to use for her children's education.

loans.name: Mishael

texts.en:
Mishael lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflowers, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Mishael is married and has four children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for four years now and they are currently growing mangoes, pawpaw, citrus fruits, avocado, maize, beans, millet and trees like croton (a deciduous tree, indigenous of Uganda). Mishael is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him extra income and provide him with honey for food.

This is Mishael’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children and to buy more beehives. Mishael’s hope for the future is to have his children educated.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María Elizabeth vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú y su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, ella distribuye artículos como perfumería y cosméticos a sus clientes de forma directa. En esta oportunidad está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería como perfumes. Ella se compromete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente y pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC SONCCO”.
texts.en: María Elizabeth lives in the city of Cusco in the south of Peru. Her main activity is selling beauty products through a catalog. She distributes items such as perfume and cosmetics to her customers directly. At this time she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as perfume. She promises to be punctual with her loan repayments. She belongs to the "Sumac Soncco" communal bank.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfume

loans.name: Kipnyakan

texts.en:
Kipnyakan is 64 years old, married and supports a family of three members. He supports two of his children who are aged 18 and 14 years old. He is a mixed farmer in the Kabarnet area and has been in this business for a period of 5 years, earning an income of KES 10,000.

He is now servicing his third loan of KES 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya, and he wishes to use this money to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers, and pay for farm labour. The profits he gets will be used to repay the loan. 

His dream is to excel in life.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil and soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rehoboth (2) Group

texts.en:
Berdriand is one of the members of the group REHOBOTH (2).  He is a leader of a group consisting of nine other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. He is in his first cycle with HOPE Congo and has operated his business for the last five years. 

Berdriand sells cellphones and accessory to his customers in his community, but he is constantly challenged by the loss of goods from theft and bad quality of supplies. One key to Berdriand’s success is to insist on the quality of electronics in his shop and to avoid selling bad quality items to his clients. Berdriand plans to open a cyber café and a larger shop where he can sell phones and accessories. 

One day he also has ambitions to build a house, buy a car, and provide his children with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase electronic equipment and telephones to increase his stock.

loans.name: Ligia Estefany

texts.es:
Ligia es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad que, luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, comenzó a trabajar como auxiliar en una sala de belleza, allí se interesó por la labor y decidió estudiar en una academia de la ciudad, con el objetivo de capacitarse para montar su propio negocio en este campo de acción. Hace un año logró su objetivo, pues comenzó a  prestar el servicio a domicilio de corte, cepillado, tinturas, manicure y pedicure, para generar ingresos y aportar a la economía de su hogar.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (tinturas, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes para uñas y otros), además completará el dinero para comprar una moto con la que podrá agilizar en la prestación de sus servicios, pues ahorraría tiempo y dinero en los desplazamientos, lo que se traduce en mejores ingresos.
Ligia, con su perseverancia, optimismo y las ganas de salir adelante, sueña con montar su salón de belleza en un local propio, en el que pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y aumentar la rentabilidad, así mejorará las condiciones de vida y bienestar propias y de su familia.
texts.en:
Ligia, 22 years old, is an entrepreneurial young woman. After finishing secondary school, she began to work as an assistant at a beauty salon. There she became interested in the work and decided to study at an academy in the city with the goal of becoming qualified to open her own business in this field. A year ago she achieved her goal, since she started to provide home service for haircuts, brushing, dyeing, and manicure and pedicure in order to generate income and contribute to her household's finances.

Currently she is asking for the loan to buy wholesale supplies (dyes, hair treatments, nail polish, and others), and also to have enough money to buy a motorcycle which will make it faster for her to provide her services, since she will save time and money on her journeys, which translates into better income.

With her perseverance, optimism, and desire to move ahead, Ligia dreams of having her own premises for her beauty salon, in which she can create employment opportunities and increase profitability. In this way, she will improve her family's living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (dyes, hair treatments, nail polish, and others), and also to have enough money to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Miguel Alexander

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 24 años es soltero, vive con sus padres en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura junto a sus padres, ya tiene 8 años de hacer sus propios cultivos de café en la zona montañosa, esta producción la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para asistir la finca de café para sacar buena producción. Su plan es terminar sus estudios primarios, ampliar el cultivo y poder ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Miguel, 24, is single. He lives with his parents in a village located in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. He has always worked with his parents in agriculture. He has had his own coffee plants in the hills for eight years and sells his produce at the local market.

He is requesting a loan of 6,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy fertilizers to give maintenance to his plantation and obtain a good harvest. His goal is to finish primary school, expand his business and be able to help his parents.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, salt, soap and red oil, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Hammad Group

texts.en:
