This group is called Hammad and consists of four women who are all hard-working. They live in Taiz, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 260,000 YER. 

Miada is 26 years old and married. She is a housewife who exerts herself in order to raise her child and to have a good life. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She said she has a small amount of money which she saved up herself. Due to the high cost of goods, it is not enough to cover her household needs. She has requested a loan to buy home appliances to use in her house. She hopes to build a big house and enroll her child in a private school.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to use in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap and onions for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing, and perfume for her business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives in Ogongo which is a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped.  Inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet.  They also grow drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. 

Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

William is married and has five children. He is a mason and his wife is a farmer. She has farmed for ten years and grows maize, beans, and green grams. William is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help pollinate his crops and provide him with honey.

This is William’s first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to expand his beekeeping project. William’s hope for the future is to develop a hatchery from his poultry project and to increase his honey production.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es: Jose de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así seguir con sus siembras para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 45 and lives in his own home with his family. For 10 years he has grown corn and beans. When his crops are ready for harvesting he stores them in the silos shown in this photograph. He then takes them to the various markets in the area to sell. With the money he earns he pays the household expenses. Jose is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, fertilisers, pesticides, weedkillers etc. so he can earn more money from his work and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, fertilisers, pesticides, weedkillers etc.

loans.name: Rehoboth (1) Group

texts.en:
Lea is one of the members of the group REHOBOTH. She is the leader of a group consisting of nine other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. She is married and has four children ranging in age from four to 20 years old. She is in her first loan cycle with HOPE Congo and has been doing her business since 1994, which is 20 years now. 

Lea sells second-hand clothes to customers in her community, but she is challenged by high prices and the poor quality of goods that she sometimes finds. One key to Lea’s success is having a large stock on hand and diversification of her activities. In the future, Lea plans to become a wholesaler and open her own warehouse to sell drinks. One day Lea hopes that she will then make enough money to buy a parcel of land, to build a house and provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to resell

loans.name: La Richesse (1) Group

texts.en:
Sylvie is a member and leader of the group LA RICHESSE (1).  The group consists of four other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Sylvie has one child and is in the sixth loan cycle with HOPE Congo.  She has been with HOPE Congo since 2011. 

She sells fruits and vegetables to customers in her community. Sylvie’s secret to her business is that she always receives clients with a warm welcome and allows certain customers to pay on flexible terms. 

In the future, Sylvie plans to expand the type of products that she offers to clients and to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase onions in bulk quantities to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Al-Tawn Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Tawn. It is made up of four women. They have applied for a loan of 110,000 YER. Zainb is a 42-year-old mother of four children living in Hodaidh, Yemen. She is the group's leader and is responsible for them. She is helping her family's business, which is selling clothes and perfumes. She has been doing this for three years. 

Zainb is applying for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use her loan to buy clothes and perfumes for her business. She hopes to open a clothing store so she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Al-Fata Group

texts.en:
Al-Fata is a group of four women  living in Taiz, Yemen. They were granted a loan of 200,000 by AMB. They aim to improve their businesses by using this loan. 

Nabat is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She started a small business selling fruits and vegetables one year ago, but she has found it difficult to accumulate a large amount of money to buy various kinds of fruits and vegetables because most of the profits she makes go to clothing and food for her family and to expenses like school fees. Therefore, she decided to apply for a loan of 50,000 YER to expand her business and include new kinds of fruits and vegetables to boost profits. She hopes to attract more customers and improve the family's income and help them pass the poverty line.

loans.use: to expand her business and include new kinds of fruits and vegetables to boost profits.

loans.name: Amanie Group

texts.en:
Amanie is a four-member group. All the members of the group are poor women from Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a 170,000 YER loan from AMB. 

Amany is a 25-year-old married woman who has children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and lives in a poor area in Sana`a. Her house is very old and is in miserable condition. The house is vulnerable to collapse at any time. She knows that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started to renovate her house but now she needs money in order to complete the renovation. 

She asks for a loan to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to renovate her house.

loans.name: Bonian Group

texts.en:
These are the four members of the Bonian group. All of them live in a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sana`a. The whole group took out a loan of 230,000 YER. Samah is the group's leader and is 26 years old.  She has  a child and lives in Sana`a, Yemen.

She is a tailor who sews fabrics, veils, scarves and various clothes.  Samah`s most important challenges are to work hard to earn extra income and to better her business structure. She requests a loan from AMB to buy sewing materials such as needles and string.  Competition has affected her sales a great deal and she needs more merchandise to offer her clients. 

She hopes to increase both her clientele and her income.

loans.use: to buy needles and strings for her sewing business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María es una humilde señora, que se gana la vida  vendiendo ropa, cosméticos, hielo y helados en su casita y por encargos, es madre soltera de tres hijos siendo el mayor de 17 años, todos asisten al colegio. Ana María solicita este primer crédito para abastecer de productos su negocio, así mantener sus ingresos o mejorarlos y seguir cumpliendo con los gastos de colegio de sus hijos y del hogar.
texts.en: Ana María is a humble woman. She earns a living selling clothing, cosmetics, ice, and ice cream at her little house and through orders. She is a single mother of three children, the oldest of whom is 17 years of age. They all attend school. Ana María is asking for this first loan in order to stock up on her business' products and in this way maintain her income or improve it and continue paying her children's school fees and the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, perfume, makeup kits, and body cream

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y su actividad económica es el alquiler de equipos de sonido para cualquier tipo de compromiso como por ejemplo matrimonios, fiestas de 15 de años, bautizos entre otros más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los equipos de sonido. 

Marco está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Marco lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in the south of Peru, and he makes a living renting out sound equipment for birthday parties, weddings, baptisms, gatherings, etc. He has several years of experience in this business, and he is grateful that business is going well. 

With the support from this loan, Marco plans to repair and do maintenance work on some of his sound equipment. Marco is grateful for this loan and opportunity, and he promises to complete all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to repair his sound equipment.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 35-year-old married mother of two in Embu. She operates a salon business. She has been running her salon for the past thirteen years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to provide for her family.  

Irene is applying for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She is delighted to have been introduced to VisionFund Kenya, and she will use the loan to purchase hair oils, a hair drier, hair chemicals and weaves. With the expected profit from the business, she will reinvest in her business and improve the standard of living for her family. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a comfortable life and to construct her own permanent residential house, since she is now living in a rented house.

loans.use: to purchase hair oils, a hair drier, hair chemicals and weaves

loans.name: Umberlindo

texts.es:
Umberlindo tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, tiene un clima variado, ubicada en la colina frente al Parque Nacional de Cutervo, Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El tiene una bodeguita donde ofrece venta de abarrotes y verduras, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace un año, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, son una familia unida, El ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos de primera necesidad y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Umberlindo is 27 years old. He and his wife live in the Santo Tomás district, a community engaged in farming, commerce, and cattle ranching. It has a varied climate, located on the hill just in front of Cutervo National Park.  Cutervo province is in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has a small corner store where he sells groceries and vegetables, and he's run this business for about a year. His wife supports him in his work; they are a united family. He's requested a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy a variety of basic goods for his store so that he can sell them to his customers and earn a greater income for his family.

loans.use: buy a variety of basic goods for his store.

loans.name: Alliance Ii Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nambula est trésorière dans le  groupe de credit  Alliance II. Agée de 47 ans, elle est mariée à un homme sans emploie et mère de 8 enfants  qui vont tous à l’école. Vendeuse au grand marché public depuis 1993, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter 30 sacs de 10kgs de clous.  Son objectif est d’acheter une parcelle et y construire une jolie maison pour sa famille. Elle remercie Hekima de promouvoir les femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en: Hekima client Nambula is the treasurer of the borrowing group called Alliance II. Aged 47, she is married to a man who is jobless and is the mother of eight children who all attend school. Merchant in a big public market since 1993, she is asking for this new loan to buy 30 sacks of 10 kilos of nails. Her goal is to buy a plot of land and build a nice house for her family. She thanks Hekima for working to improve the lives of impoverished women who are active in the economy.

loans.use: to buy 30 sacks of 10 kilos of nails

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 50 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living farming rice in the Philippines. Maria Theresa requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Maria Theresa has grown rice for 15 years and earns additional income raising pigs.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46 years old and married with eleven children.

She earns a living growing bananas in the Philippines. Lolita requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and pay laborers' salaries.

Lolita has grown bananas for 30 years and earns additional income from operating a general store.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married woman with five children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a retail charcoal business in the Philippines and earns additional income selling fish.  Lorna requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Lorna has sustained her business through 18 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy propane gas bottles wholesale.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando tiene 25 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 1 años, él trabaja como chofer de taxi, el trabaja en la localidad de Sacaba, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, el señor Orlando va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que está por terminar su casita  y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua  ya sea para la construcción como para el uso de agua potable y así de esta manera  hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona donde él  vive no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que el señor Orlando tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz y agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Orlando is 25 years old and has a son who is one year old. He works as a taxi driver in the town of Sacaba. This is his first loan with Kiva and he will use it to finish setting up running water at his house. He is about to finish construction and it takes a lot of work to transport water, either for construction purposes or simply to have drinkable water. With running water, he will be able to have a toilet, a shower, and a kitchen basin, and this will make his life and that of his family much more comfortable. He has to do this himself because, for several reasons, the area where he lives does not have basic infrastructure. This will not stop Orlando from having drinkable water at his house. He is very happy and grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to set up running water at his house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a forty-three-year-old gentleman, married to a teacher, and the father of two children aged six and eight years old. He has been running an electrical shop in Narok Town, Kenya, for the last fifteen years with a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He has been advanced a fifth loan of KES 50,000 which he will use to restock a newly opened stall with electrical goods. He will use the proceeds to build a house for his family. 

He hopes to open more outlets in the future.

loans.use: to purchase electical goods for resale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 43 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, eggs, noodles, and chip.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 10 years and earns an income from growing rice and raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, noodles, and chips to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Lucia has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from farming coconuts.

She has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig raising business in the Philippines. 

She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Lucy has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 58 years old and married with three children. 

She raises pigs in the Philippines and requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamin for her pigs.

Luzvilla has raised pigs for 6 years and has previously borrowed 9 times from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Luzvilla would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has been making and selling leather coats to local people for one and a half years. Her husband drives a taxi. 

Ganchimeg is requesting a loan for 2500000 MNT, which she will use to buy leather in large amount as it is the main raw material for her business. With the loan, she can run her business without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase leather in large amount

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa como pantalones y otras cosas mas.
texts.en: Gloria lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco and sells clothes for a living. She has been in business for several years and is faring very well thanks to her motivation and efforts. She asks for a loan to buy clothes to sell, such as trousers and various other items.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie helps her husband work in their farm to make a living. Her husband also has a fishing business. Richie is responsible for growing bananas. She earns well from this and has successfully repaid a previous loan used to buy fertilizer for the farm. 

Their village's main source of income comes from farming. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer  and cover replanting costs. The couple plans to improve their farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer  and cover replanting costs.

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany tiene 32 años de edad vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el Caserío Playa Azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad con clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores patos, gallinas y cerdos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, también vende fruta de estación dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 2 años. Fany junto a su esposo comercializan dichos animales en el mercado del distrito.

Fany ha solcitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Fany, 32 years old, lives with her husband and children in the village of Caserío Playa Azul, in a rural zone in the district of Pucará, which has hot weather and where the people are mostly farmers, traders, and animal husbanders. Pucará is located in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. Fany raises and sells small farm animals such as ducks, hens and pigs. Her business is located at the back of her house, and she also sells seasonal fruit. She has been in business for two years. Together with her husband, she sells the animals at the district market. Fany asks for a loan of 1,500 soles in order to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals so that they fetch a higher price.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten animals.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of seven children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a retail rice business in the Philippines and earns additional income buying and seling dried coconut meat. Lydia asks for 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lydia has sustained her business through 16 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.en:
Maria Belen is 60 years old and widowed.

Maria Belen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sugar, rice, shampoo, and groceries to sell.

Maria Belen has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business.  She has run the general store for 10 years and earns an income from buying and selling frozen products, furniture, and raising pigs.

Maria Belen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, shampoo, and groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La alumna Alejandra del PROGRAMA SALUD ORAL está bastante interesada para el  beneficio de kiva que le pueden otorgar para la mejor estabilidad, en los aspectos laborales la señorita se ha desempeñado como mesera en algunos restaurantes de turnos, personalmente la señorita es una estudiante muy juiciosa, responsable con los deberes y respondiendo de la mejor manera las actividades y los estudios dando lo mejor de ella, mostrándose a los demás con respeto, compresión, tolerancia y honestidad, por el momento está cursando el técnico en salud oral de primer semestre para así darse un mejor futuro para ella y construir con optimismo la carrera que desea y a si brindar una ayuda para toda la  familia. 
El convenio sería muy útil para la mejora y ayuda, para el bienestar, pues en el momento la situación económica no es suficiente, pues el padre es el que trabaja únicamente y responde por ella y otra hija que igualmente está estudiando, necesita el convenio para ayudar y dar un mejor apoyo a la familia, para que obtengan mejores resultados de bienestar.
texts.en:
Alejandra, a student in the Oral Health Program, is quite interested in the aid from Kiva that she can be awarded for the greater stability it provides. Regarding work, she has worked shifts as a waitress at some restaurants. Personally, she is a very sensible student, responsible with her duties and responding in the best way to activities and to her studies. She gives the best of herself, showing others respect, understanding, toleration, and honesty. At the moment she is in the first semester of the Oral Health program in order to give herself a better future and to optimistically build the career she wants and in this way help her entire family.

The loan will be very useful for improvement and for help, and for her well-being, since at the moment her financial situation is not sufficient as her father is the only one who works and takes responsibility for her and another daughter who is also studying. She needs the loan for help and to provide greater support to the family so that they will have greater well-being.

loans.use: to pay fees for a semester

loans.name: Usikilivu A Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Mangaribi est une vaillante commerçante depuis 20 ans et membre d’une plate forme d’Affaires   «Usikilivu A» âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse de divers articles de boutique et une gamme de boissons. Elle installe ses business dans un magasin du marché de la périphérie. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter sacs de sucre, boites de piles, huiles, cartons de savons, lait en boite, Primus, Heineken, etc. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Au début, elle avait reçu de fonds de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et assurer les soins médicaux de ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédits sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Hekima client Mangaribi has been a hard-working merchant for twenty years and is a member of a loan group called  «Usikilivu A». Aged 40, she is married and the mother of eight children who all attend school. She sells various items in her general store and offers a range of drinks. Her business is located in a shop in a market on the outskirts (of town). 

Mangaribi is asking for a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to buy sacks of sugar, boxes of batteries, oil, cartons of soap, tinned milk, Primus and Heineken (beers), etc. Her husband is also a small-scale merchant. In the beginning, she got some money from her husband (to start up her business). She hopes to grow her working capital, keep her kids in school, and insure that they have healthcare. Mangaribi thanks Hekima for its efforts to help women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the commercial banking system by lending to them without collateral.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, boxes of batteries, oil, cartons of soap, tinned milk, and Primus and Heineken (two kinds of beer), etc.

loans.name: Alba Lidia

texts.es: Doña Alba es originaria de Ocotal, soltera y madre de cuatro hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio Obrera. Su meta próxima es mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Solicita el crédito para mejorar las condiciones de la red de aguas negras de su hogar. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que le brindara mejores condiciones a su familia. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en: Alba is originally from Ocotal. She is a single mother of four grown children, and she works as a laborer. Her short-term goal is to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting this loan to improve the sewage system in her house. She believes that the loan will be a big help in improving her home for her family. Her long term plan is to continue improving her home's infrastructure.

loans.use: improve the sewage system in her house.

loans.name: Koemsrauy

texts.en:
Koemsrauy, a 22-year-old married mother of four, lives in the rural village of Chrey Vien, Prey Chho, Kampong Cham province. Residing with her father, mother, husband and children, Koemsrauy earns a living by farming rice alongside her husband in their village. Her income is spent on their food, home bills, school allowances of their children, and other costs of commodities. For many years she has earned well from her farm, and it helps her family a lot.

Koemsrauy plans to improve her business by expanding her farming area. She is therefore requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to buy another plot of land. Through increased production and income, Koemsrauy will be able to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for growing rice.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES DE FE” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: comercio, servicio, taller de costura y producción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, ya que desde niña trabajo en esta área,  con el capital que se prestó de Pro Mujer decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para sostener a su familia, ay que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Fe” [Women of Faith] credit group is beginning its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional hub.  It consists of nine members and is lead by a Board of Directors, of which Virginia is President.  The businesses that the group members carry out are varied.  Among them are: trade, services, and a tailoring shop.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small-time business owners, one of whom is Virginia.  She says that two years ago she signed up with Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the organization.  Currently, she has a seamstress shop.  She shares that she learned the business from her family, because starting as a young girl she did this type of work.  With the money that Pro Mujer lent her, she decided to open her own business.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital (buy fabric in bulk), which she will get in the stores of the city of El Alto.  She will later sell her goods in her own sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, because she is married and has a child.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk

loans.name: Norma  Maria

texts.es: Norma María vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y su actividad económica es la venta de productos primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros productos más. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: Norma María lives in Cusco, a city in southern Peru, and earns her living by selling basic staple goods, such as rice, sugar, milk, and more. She has an opportunity before her for which she requires a loan, which she will use to purchase sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other items. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: buy basic staples, like sacks of rice and sugar, for her market.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marco tiene 22 años tiene 2 hijos que son 7 y 4 años, el realiza artesanías en plásticos como forros para distintas documentaciones, tiene su taller que se encuentran en la zona de Alto Tacagua, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor  Marco va a usar este préstamo para la compra de selladora, cortadora eléctrica y materia prima para realizar su trabajo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por la gran demanda que tiene de sus productos y necesita esta maquinaria y materiales para cubrir esta demanda y así poder ampliar su taller,  el señor  Marco enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que siempre hay en el mercado, y va a utilizar los beneficios en ampliar el negocio comprando máquinas y expandir su mercado a nivel nacional e internacional.
texts.en:
Marco is 22 years old and has two children, ages 7 and 4. He makes a living designing and making plastic products and crafts. His workshop is located in the Alto Tacagua zone of La Paz, and this is his second loan with this institution.

With the support from this loan, Marco plans to purchase a sealing machine, an electric cutter and raw materials for making his plastic products. He is requesting this loan in hopes of keeping up with increased demand for his products and services. Marco hopes this investment will help him to grow and strengthen his business, and that higher quality machines will lead to higher quantity and quality of products. The main challenge he faces in his business endeavors is competition in the market, but Marco hopes to overcome this challenge and expand his business to a national and international level.

loans.use: to purchase a sealing machine, an electric cutter and raw materials to support his plastics business.

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn, a mother of five children, helps her husband to operate their farm to make a living. For five years, the couple earns enough to provide for the family. 

She plans to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. Their ultimate ambition is to give their children a better education. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer and cover replanting costs. 

In the future she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and cover replanting costs.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 20 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail charcoal business in the Philippines and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maria Fe has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF. She has run this business for 3 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Maria Fe aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail banana business in the Philippines. 

She requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy bananas and coconut vinegar to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income farming rice.

Roselyn has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconut vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut farming and raising livestock. Rowena is now borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood and paints, and pay her laborers' salaries in her furniture shop business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream of building and expanding her business in order to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additonal materials like wood and paints, and pay her laborers' salaries

loans.name: La Richesse (2) Group

texts.en:
Marie is one of the members of the group LA RICHESSE (2). She is a mother of four and the leader of a group consisting of five other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 

Marie sells wigs and operates a hair salon in her community. She has been with HOPE Congo for six loan cycles and has been in this business for 30 years. She increases her business by creating customer loyalty and welcoming them into her shop. 

One day, Marie hopes to grow and expand her business to become a large seller of hair products in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies and hair pieces for her clients.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie, a 50-year- old married mother of four, works very hard to provide for her family. For two years now, she has operated a general store in the Philippines selling a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, milk, salt, bread, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. 

Elsie has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of sugar, coffee, milk, salt, bread, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of sugar, coffee, milk, salt, bread, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: o buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor to help with her coffee plantings

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 35 años de edad, únicamente estudió un año en la universidad, pues su situación económica se puso difícil y le impidió continuar sus estudios. Vive con una hermana y está soltero, pero tiene una hija a la cual le ayuda mensualmente. 

El trabajo que desempeña es como capacitador en las comunidades, trabaja de lunes a viernes, también tiene una mototaxi que es de un hermano suyo, con la que presta servicios de transporte a las personas de su pueblo, él se desplaza a su trabajo a las comunidades en una motocicleta, ya que no hay transporte que lo lleve hacia el lugar, su horario es de 8:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

Carlos necesita el dinero, para pagar un crédito pendiente que tomó para cancelar la deuda de una amiga quien quedó  mal con un crédito y a él le exigieron el pagarlo, y de no hacerlo le quitarían los muebles o su casa.

Él desea luchar para no perder su trabajo y seguir apoyando a su hija y cancelar esa deuda pendiente ya que es una de las cosas que más le preocupa hoy en día.
texts.en: Carlos is 35 years old and completed just one year of university, because his financial situation worsened and he could not go on any longer. He lives with his sister and is single, but has one daughter to whom he gives a monthly allowance. He works as a trainer in villages from Monday to Friday. He also borrows a mototaxi from one of his brothers in order to provide transportation services. He rides a scooter to work, since there is no transportation available. He works from 8 am to 4 pm. He needs the loan in order to pay back an outstanding loan he took out to help out a friend who defaulted on her own loan, leaving him in the lurch, because the credit institution held him responsible for the outstanding debts. He needs to pay back lest he lose his possessions or his house. He wants to fight in order to avoid losing his job and wishes to be able to keep helping his daughter and to pay back the outstanding loan, which is his main concern at the moment.

loans.use: to pay back an outstanding loan.

loans.name: Boy Mindo

texts.en:
Boy Mindo works as a security guard in a private company while at the same time earning from his own farm to make a living. He is the father of three children and needs to double his income in order to provide for his big family. 

He has been a member of GDMPC since 2009 and has recently taken out a loan to buy fertilizer to improve his farm. Farming is the main source of income in their community. 

In the future, he wants to have an improved farm and start a piggery business to get more returns.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 60 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salome runs a business buying and selling coconut roofing in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of coconut roofing to sell. Salome has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of coconut roofing to sell

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar de 33 años de edad,  no tiene muchos años de educacion, está acompañado y su esposa le ayuda para los gastos del hogar, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en la universidad y requiere más gastos. 

Él tiene muchos años de dedicarse al trabajo de albañil, se levanta desde muy temprano para prepararse y salir hacia su trabajo a las 6:00 AM y regresa a la 1:00 PM

El préstamo le ayudará a Oscar, a reparar el techo de una habitación, pues se aproxima el invierno y su familia corre peligro ya que la casa no está en las condiciones adecuadas, además, tendrán mejor calidad de vida y el crédito les ayudará a solucionar este problema.

Oscar sueña con seguir mejorando su casa y seguir dandoles el estudio a sus hijos, de esta forma podrán mantenerse solos en el futuro, además desea seguir trabajando con CrediCampo.
texts.en:
Oscar is 33 years old and did not receive very much formal education. Oscar has a partner who helps with the household costs. They have two children who are studying at university, which costs money.

Oscar has been working as a builder for many years. He gets up very early in order to get ready and go out to work at 6am. He comes home at 1pm.

This loan will help Oscar to repair the roof of a room. Winter is coming and his family is running risks as the house is not in good enough condition. With the roof fixed, the family will have a better quality of life and this loan will help them to fix this problem.

Oscar dreams of improving his house and of continuing to give his children an education, which will allow them to support themselves in the future. Oscar would also like to continue working with "CrediCampo".

loans.use: to repair the roof in one of his rooms.

loans.name: Bersabe

texts.es:
Bersabe tiene 33 años de edad, es una señora muy dinámica y trabajadora, estudió  hasta octavo año del colegio, está casada,  hace varios años emigraron hacia los Estados Unidos en busca de una mejor vida,  estando allá, ella consiguió trabajo en un restaurante donde laboró durante 5 años; luego regresaron a su país natal con algunos ahorros y establecieron su vida familiar en la ciudad. Posteriormente, decidieron irse a vivir a otro lugar, pues vieron que tendrían más oportunidades de crecer en la agricultura y ganadería. Con ella vive un sobrino a quien cría como a un hijo y sus dos hijos dependen económicamente de ellos.

Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, posee una tienda en su casa con la cual pone a disposición productos para los vecinos que se acercan. También se dedica a la venta de ropa en la época de verano y cuida animales como lo son cerdos y vacas.

Bersabé  ha comprado seis terneros por una suma considerable de dinero, el dinero fue prestado, es por eso que ella necesita el préstamo para pagar la deuda que tiene con sus familiares.

Ella sueña con ir mejorando su ganadería, también desea cancelar todas las deudas que tuviese pendientes y ver que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser buenos profesionales y que tengan un lugar digno y agradable donde vivir.
texts.en: Bersabé is 33 years old and a very dynamic and hard-working woman. She studied until the eighth form. She is married and emigrated to the United States a few years ago with her husband in search of a better life. She found work over there in a restaurant where she stayed 5 years. They then came back to their home country with some savings and settled down in the city. After a while, they decided to move somewhere else because they sensed an opportunity for growth in agriculture and animal husbandry. One of her nephews lives with her whom she raised as her own son, and she also has two children: all three are dependent on her and her husband. Bersabé is full of enterprising spirit: she has a shop in her house where she sells products to her neighbours. She also sells clothes in the summer and raises pigs and cows. She bought six calves for a very high sum, lent to her by some relatives, and needs a loan to cancel this outstanding debt. Her dream is to keep improving her cow-raising business, to have no more debts, and to see her children do their best and get a good job. She wants them to live in a decent and comfortable place.

loans.use: to cancel an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Reina America

texts.es:
Con la ayuda económica que financio la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA Doña Reina pudo comprar los diferentes insumos para poder darle a sus plantas de café el mantenimiento y cuidado posible: 3 QQ de urea, 3 QQ de formula cafetalera 12-24-12, 2 sacos de fertilizantes, 3 litros de fungicidas, 3 litros de plaguicidas, 3 litros de foliares. Doña Reina vendió el café a una persona de la comunidad la cual se dedica a comprar y a su vez esta persona revende el producto a bodegas que se dedican exclusivamente a la compra-venta de café ubicadas en otras zonas del departamento y con los ingresos obtenidos pudo salir con su compromiso de pago.
Actualmente ella solicita un segundo financiamiento el cual invertirá la compra de fertilizantes, urea y pago de mano de obra para abonar y limpiar sus cultivos de café ya que es muy importante para evitar el crecimiento de maleza y deterioro del mismo. Considera doña Reina que el financiamiento le ayudara a dar un mejor mantenimiento a su plantación y así hacer mas atractivo y llamativo su producto para su venta y con ello mejores ingresos mediante su venta.
texts.en:
With the economic help from the COMIXMUL cooperative and Kiva lenders, Reina was able to buy various supplies to provide her coffee plants with the necessary maintenance and care: 3 QQ (quintales or hundred pounds) of urea, 3 QQ of coffee fertilisation formula 12-24-12, 2 bags of fertilisers, 3 litres of fungicide, 3 litres of insecticide and 3 litres of leaf plant fertiliser. Reina sold the coffee on to someone in the community who works in purchasing, and he in his turn resold the produce to stores sited in other parts of the department and used exclusively for the buying and selling of coffee. She was able to meet her loan repayments with the money she earned.

Currently, she is asking for a second loan that she will invest in buying fertilisers and urea as well as for paying workers to prepare and clear the ground for her coffee plants. This is really important in order to avoid weed growth and plant deterioration. Reina feels that the loan will help her to maintain her plantation better, and thus make her product more attractive and appealing for sale, which will in turn lead to a better income when sold.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay workers to help her cultivate coffee.

loans.name: Las Rosas Lindas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS LINDAS” iniciará el vigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marielena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: comercio, servicio y producción de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marielena es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su padre, quien también comercializaba el mismo producto,  con el capital que se prestó de Pro Mujer decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de muebles por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para sostener sus estudios, ya que está cursando la universidad.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosas Lindas" (Pretty Roses) will begin its 24th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional office.  It is comprised of nine members run by a board of directors, where Marielena is the president. The members of the bank run a wide variety of businesses, involving sales, services, and even furniture making.

This loan will benefit one of the small businesswomen in Marielena's communal bank. She said that it's been two years since she joined Pro Mujer, and that she joined at the invitation of a friend who was already a member. She currently runs a business selling furniture, a line of work she learned from her father, who sold the same thing. With capital she got from Pro Mujer, she decided to start her own independent business.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital through the purchase of furniture bought at wholesale, which she will acquire in the markets in the city of El Alto, and later sell in her own store. This work generates enough income for her to keep going to school, as she is currently enrolled in the university.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Marielena replied that she likes the health clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy furniture at wholesale for resale

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Mr. Gantulga, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has the position of overall manager at a building company. His wife, together with her friend, are running a clothing sales business by renting a stall at a trade center. Their main goods are for women and they bring their goods from China. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy women's clothes in large quantity so that his wife will sell her clothes without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is so proud of his wife who can run this business and has an ambition of expanding it.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase food supplies, soap, and canned foods

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 58 years old and married with seven children. 

Diosdada is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Diosdada has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Diosdada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José de 20 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres, proviene de una familia humilde y emprendedora, aunque sus padres en ocasiones veían difícil su situación económica, nunca desistieron de enviarlo a la escuela, él se graduó de bachiller hace algunos años en el colegio de su ciudad. 
Él no duda de sus capacidades, porque está convencido de que puede realizar mas de lo que ha hecho hasta ahora.

José desde muy pequeño ayudaba a su padre a trabajar en la agricultura, sin dejar sus estudios, también se dedica a cuidar bueyes, a realizar viajes en carreta o a rastrear la tierra para el cultivo de maíz en elote, este trabajo lo hace desde muy temprano para luego dedicarse a otras actividades.

José necesita de este crédito, para comprar un yunta de bueyes, pues con los que trabaja ahora son de su padre y quiere tener sus propios animales para trabajar.

Sus sueños para futuro son  tener una cosecha más abundante y de calidad , y comprar una pequeña parcela para construir una casa, y cuando tenga su propia familia pueda darle lo necesario para poder vivir
texts.en:
Jose is 20 years old and very hard-working. He lives in his parents' home. He comes from a poor and enterprising family, though, at times, his parents do not have have enough money. His parents never stopped sending Jose to school and he completed his secondary education at the local school a few years ago.

Jose does not doubt his abilities and is convinced that he can do more with his life than he has done so far.

From a young age, Jose helped his father with farming work without neglecting his studies. Jose now also raises oxen. He makes journeys with his cart and rakes his corn crops. Jose works from very early in order to do other work later in the day.

Jose needs this loan in order to buy a yoke of oxen. The oxen with which he works just now belong to his father and Jose wants his own animals for his work.

In the future Jose would like to have a more abundant and higher quality harvest. He would like to buy a plot of land to build a house and, when he has his own family, he can give them what they need in order to survive.

loans.use: to buy a yoke of oxen.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 45 years old and married with eighteen children, seven of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Graciela Tatiana

texts.es:
Graciela, estudió hasta noveno grado, en la escuela del caton donde reside, esta acompañada, su compañero de vida trabaja en venta de pan, tienen dos niños que viven en casa, ya que las edades de ellos son menores, es una familia de cuatro integrantes. Ella se dedica a hacer tamales de elote y cuidar los niños; desde que tenía la edad de diez años ya le ayudaba a su mamá, fue ahi que aprendió a elaborar tamales, son cuatro años de experiencia en vender tamales, su compañero de vida tambien trabaja es empleado.

El dinero del préstamo lo utilizará para completar el dinero de la compra de una motocileta, que usará su compañero de vida, pues la necesita para trasladarse, desde su casa hasta el lugar de trabajo, que se encuentra en la ciudad de San Miguel; pues el sale a las 5:00 de la madrugada y regresa a las 8:00 de la noche es necesario que se transporte en otro medio que no sea a pie, por el momento se transporta caminando.

A futuro, ella  desea ver crecer el negocio de tamales de elote y que su compañero de vida pueda tener otro empleo diferente; todo esto lo lograran con esfuerzo propio y con la ayuda de los prestamos que Credicampo les proporciona.
texts.en: Graciela studied up to the ninth form at the local school. She has a partner and they have two children who are underage and live with them. She makes sweetcorn tamales and takes care of the children. When she turned ten, she started helping her mother and learned how to make tamales that way. She has been selling tamales for four years. Her partner is employed at a baker's. She will use the loan to buy a motorcycle for her partner's use. He needs it to go to work, since he works in the city of San Miguel. For the moment, he goes there on foot, but this means he leaves home at 5 am and comes back at 8 pm, so he needs some other means of transportation. In the future, Graciela wishes to see her business grow and for a different job for her partner. She is confident that they will achieve this if they put in enough effort and also thanks to the loans from Credicampo.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use for transportation.

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en:
Genelita is 45 years old and married. She has eight children, three of whom are currently in school.

Genelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Houétchédé Flore's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est un composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Houétchédé Flore (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 40 ans a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Houétchédé Flore est mariée à un certain Ayouba. Le couple n’a pas enfant. Houétchédé Flore vit seule. Les diverses charges de ménage sont supportées par Houétchédé Flore et son mari. C’est pour cette raison, Houétchédé Flore vend des fournitures scolaires et des produits vivriers (sacs de maïs et d’arachide) à son domicile depuis dix huit ans. Houétchédé Flore s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Houétchédé Flore et les membres de son groupe sollicitent pour la première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is composed of three persons who live in the same district. The group's representative, Houétchédé Flore (with her hand raised in the photo), is 40 years old and has a secondary level education. She is married to a man named Ayouba. The couple have no children. Houétchédé Flore lives by herself. The diverse household expenses are covered by her and her husband. For this reason, she has been selling school supplies and staple foods (corn and peanuts) out of her home for eight years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demand, Houétchédé Flore and the other members of her group are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to purchase staple foods, such as corn and peanuts, to sell

loans.name: Milagrito Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagrito de 26 años de edad, logró terminar bachillerato con el esfuerzo de sus padres, actualmente vive con sus padres a quienes ella ayuda en lo económico. 

Milagrito se dedica al negocio de productos de primera necesidad desde hace seis meses, tienda que está ubicada en casa de sus padres. Además alquila otro local para vender productos naturales de “herbalife”, su hermana le ayuda en este negocio y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

Ella solicita este préstamo, para comprar productos y surtir su tienda. Productos como; maíz, gaseosas, jugos, frijoles, gas propano y productos naturales de “herbalife” de esa forma mejorará su negocio y tendrá mejores ingresos para su familia.

Su sueño es trabajar siempre con esta institución y seguir ayudándoles a sus padres. Las ganancias las utilizará también para cancelar no fallar con las cuotas y ahorrar un poco.
texts.en: Milagrito is 26 years old. She managed to finish secondary school thanks to her parents, who supported her. She lives with them and helps them with household expenses. She has been selling first-necessity items for six months. Her shop is located at her parents' house. She also rents another locale where she sells Herbalife natural products with the help of her sister. She works from 6 am to 4 pm. She asks for a loan in order to buy merchandise to sell, such as sweetcorn, fizzy drinks, fruit juice, broad beans, propane gas bottles, and Herbalife natural products. In this way, she will improve her shop and earn more income to help her family. Her dream is to keep working with the lending institution and helping her parents. She will use the profits from the shop to pay back the loan and also put some money aside.

loans.use: in order to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and eggs

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena has been managing her own cafeteria for years while her husband works as a driver. She earns more income for the family from this activity. 

These are their only sources of income, but they work hard and are determined to improve their standard of living.

Azucena successfully repaid her previous loan used for her cafeteria. Recently she has taken out a new loan to purchase more raw ingredients to cater to more customers.

She wants to improve her business in order to gain more profit to spend on improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients to cater to more customers

loans.name: Tynchtykan

texts.ru: Тынчтыкан 45 лет совместно с супругом растят четверых дочерей. Две старшие-студентки, две младшие-школьницы, супруг работает бригадиром в частной строительной фирме. У Тынчтыкан средне-специальное образование. После окончания школы поступила в медицинское училище, успешно окончив его, проработала в местной больнице до 1993 года статистом. В 1993 году супруги начали бизнес в торговле товаров повседневного потребления (мыломоющие, продукты), используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 20,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Тынчтыкан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). От доходов бизнеса супруги смогли купить скот. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 нетель, 5 овец, также имеет земельный надел размером 0,80 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу, подсолнух и овощи. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Тынчтыкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - для оптовой покупки товаров повседневного потребления, для дальнейшей розничной продажи населению. Доходы от кредита Тынчтыкан планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на обучение в университете для своих дочерей.
texts.en:
Tynchtykan is 45 years old.  She and her husband are raising four daughters.  Their two older daughters are university students while the other two are still in school.  Tynchtykan's husband works as a foreman in a private construction company.  Tynchtykan herself has a specialized-secondary education.  After graduation, she enrolled in a healthcare institute.  She successfully completed her degree and then worked as a temporary employee at a local hospital until 1993.  In 1993, she and her husband started their own business selling staple goods such as food and washing products, using 20,000 som (KGS) as a starting capital.  They were able to develop their business and attract regular customers.  

Tynchtykan now makes an average monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  With the money the couple made from their business, they were able to buy some livestock.  Tynchtykan now owns one dairy cow, 1 heifer and 5 sheep, as well as 0,80 hectare of land on which she grows potatoes, corn, sunflower and vegetables.

Eager to further expand and develop her retail business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan.  She will use her loan to buy bulk quantities of staple goods, for further resale, on a retail-basis, to the local residents.  Tynchtykan is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her sales.  She is also planning to save enough money to send her daughters to university.

loans.use: to buy staple goods for her retail business

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.fr: Madame Faida est une femme dynamique, présidente du groupe de credit Safina. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, mère de 9 enfants scolarisés  et mariée à un homme d’affaire. Commerçante depuis 1994, elle étale sa marchandise dans le  marché central.Elle sollicite le nouveau credit pour acheter 1 sac de riz, 1 sac de sucre et 1 bidon d’huile de palme.  Elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires et construire une maison familiale. Ainsi, elle remercie et bénie Hekima.
texts.en: Ms. Faida is an energetic woman and the president of the loan group Safina. She is 48 years old and the mother of nine children provided with schooling. She is married to a businessman. A merchant since 1994, she displays her merchandise at the central market. She is requesting a new loan to purchase a sack of rice, a bag of sugar, and a container of palm oil. She would like to prosper in business and build a family house. So she gives her thanks and blessings to Hekima.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Haide has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is 51 years old and has six children. She is from Battambang province where her crops are grown. She plants pineapple and white beans as the primary source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She earns about 40,000 KHR per day.  

Kunthea is requesting her fourth loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy potash for her pineapple plantation and insecticide for her crops. She believes that she can gain triple yield from her crops. Her past loan enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase potash for her pineapple plantation and insecticide for her crops.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tránsito Marlene

texts.es:
Tránsito tiene 43 años de edad, solamente logró cursar hasta sexto grado, es una mujer responsable y  dedicada a todo lo que hace. Sin embargo, como no terminó sus estudios, le resulta difícil encontrar  oportunidades de trabajo.  Está soltera y se dedica al trabajo agrícola y a la crianza de ganado, además debe cuidar a su madre ya que es una mujer de avanzada edad y todos sus hermanos se separaron de ella y por tanto tomó la responsabilidad pues no tiene apoyo de nadie.

Ella trabaja en la crianza de animales de granja y en la agricultura, actividades que desempeña desde muy pequeña, ya que su padre y hermanos se dedicaban a esta misma actividad. 

A Tránsito le toca bastante difícil, ya que su madre de avanzada edad requiere bastante atención, debe pagar mozos para que le ayuden en el trabajo agrícola, además tiene que madrugar para dejar todo preparado y que a su madre no le falte nada, seguidamente se dirige al trabajo, esto lo hace por las mañanas ya que por las tardes se dedica por completo a atender a su madre.

Ella necesita muchísimo este crédito para comprar aves, concentrado, abonos  y fertilizantes para la siembra, así ella venderá pollos más saludables y grandes y la cosecha será más productiva.

 Sus sueños en un futuro son, tener  una granja más grande, reparar su vivienda y de las ganancias de su trabajo y esfuerzo, ella pretende solventar todas las necesidades de su mamá y de ella misma.
texts.en:
Tránsito, who is 43, only received a primary education. She is responsible and dedicated in all that she does. However, as she was unable to complete her schooling, she finds it difficult to find jobs. She is single and works in agriculture and livestock breeding. In addition, she has to look after her elderly mother and, since all her brothers and sisters left her, she took on the responsibility, but receives no help from anyone.

She works in cattle rearing and agriculture, work which she has done since she was very small, as her father and brothers worked in the same business.

Tránsito finds life quite hard and, as her elderly mother needs a lot of attention, she has to pay farmhands to help her with her crops. In addition, she also has to get up early to prepare everything and make sure that her mother has all she needs.  She then goes off to work in the mornings, as she devotes every afternoon to looking after her mother.

She very much needs this loan to buy birds, concentrate, manure and fertiliser for her crops. She will then be able to sell healthier and bigger chickens and have a better harvest.

Her ambitions for the future are to have a bigger farm, have repairs done on her home and, with the income she earns from her work and efforts, she intends to cover all her mother's and her own needs.

loans.use: to buy birds, concentrate, manure and fertiliser for her crops.

loans.name: Ximena Paola

texts.es:
Ximena nació el 4 de abril, es la primera hija mujer de Jorge Armando y María del Carmen, Ximena significa “alegre e independiente” en hebreo, el segundo nombre Paola significa “fuerte personalidad, sociable".

Ximena comenzó en la banda marcial del colegio Almirante Padilla cuando solo tenia 8 años de edad, en la infancia quedo fascinada al ver a al padre tocar la guitarra y pidió una como regalo de navidad, a los 11 años se le cumplió el deseo y desde  allí siguió tocando instrumentos para llegar a concursos profesionales, a los 4 años , uno de los hermanos se fue a prestar servicio militar, a los 15 años gano la primera medalla, gracias al esfuerzo, cumplimiento y desempeño en la banda marcial Almirante Padilla.

A la edad de los 18 años se graduó de bachiller técnico, con honores, teniendo la ilusión, de ser auxiliar  de enfermería, después de realizar varios estudios, dentro de ellos (primeros auxilios, camillero).
Al ver la destreza en este campo , tomo la decisión de ingresar al INSTITUTO CAMPO ALTO , allí comenzó a realizar los estudios como auxiliar de enfermería desde el año 2013.

Los gastos para esta carrera son un poco costosos, por eso ella solicita el convenio de kiva, ya que con el valor de la cuota tan elevado y con el subsidio que le brindan los gastos pueden reducirse un poco.
texts.en:
Ximena was born on April 4 and is the first daughter of Jorge Armando and María del Carmen.  Ximena means “happy and independent” in Hebrew.  Her middle name is Paola, which means “strong social personality.”

Ximena started with the Almirante Padilla marching band when she was 8 years old.  As a child she was fascinated with playing the guitar and asked for one as a Christmas gift.  At age 11 she got her wish and since then has been playing instruments.  She began competing in professional contests within four years.  One of her brothers went into the service and she won her first medal thanks to her efforts in the marching band. 

At age 18 she earned a bachelor’s degree with honors, and decided to become a nurse’s aide after completing some courses, including first aid and stretcher bearer.  She decided to enroll at the higher education institution and began studying to become a nurse’s aide in 2013.

The cost of her education is a bit high and she is asking for a Kiva loan to help with the cost a bit.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and balanced poultry feed.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en: Lolito owns a farm and operates a copra (coconut meat) business in his village. Aside from his harvest from his own farm, he also buys coconut from others to make copra to sell. He earns good income and was able to buy a motorcycle from his profit. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer to improve his coconut farm.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve his coconut farm

loans.name: Ujamaa I Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chizigire, femme entrepreneur est présidente du groupe de credit Ujamaa I. Mariée à  un commerçant, à l’âge à de 50 ans ; elle est mère de 8 enfants  tous scolarisés. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 15 paires des chaussures d’occasion. Son rêve est d’agrandir son entreprise.Au final, elle remercie Hekima  de soutenir les femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en: This client, Chizigire, is a woman entrepreneur and the president of the loan group Ujamaa I. Married to a merchant, she is 50 years old and a mother of eight children, all provided with schooling. She is requesting this loan to purchase 15 pairs of used shoes. Her dream is to expand her enterprise. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 15 pairs of used shoes

loans.name: Merideth

texts.en:
Merideth is 38 years old and married with three children.

Merideth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Merideth has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from food vending.

Merideth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Nelia

texts.en:
Ma. Nelia is 44 years old, married and has 10 children, four still in school.

Ma. Nelia is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Nelia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Nelia has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Nelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. Salvacion is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices.

Salvacion has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca vive en casa propia en la ciudad de La Paz, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, y ella trabaja como profesora de primaria en dos colegios, con esta actividad ella se mantiene y cubre todas sus necesidades.

El credito que solicita es para refaccionar el techo de su vivienda ya que por epoca de lluvia se esta cayendo, lo cual puede ser peligroso para cualquiera persona que viva en el lugar. 
 
El sueño de Blanca es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in her own home in the city of La Paz. Her children are grown. Blanca works at two schools, teaching at the elementary level. Her occupation is the only means of supporting herself and providing for all of her necessities.

The loan she is requesting will be used to repair the roof of her house. Since the rainy season is approaching, it can become dangerous for any person living in that place.

Blanca dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Terisita

texts.en:
Terisita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Terisita has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Terisita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 31 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, bread, noodles, eggs, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Alma has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending and buying and selling livestock.

Alma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, bread, noodles, eggs, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Teko Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Teko Poty está en el 2do ciclo  del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La mayoría de las integrantes realizan actividades productivas y las que no, tienen proyecto de emprender una actividad para poder así ir aumentando sus ingresos. 
Una de las integrantes la Sra.
