Karina es Comerciante, es decir se dedica a la venta de ropas, tiene una clientela ya formada , y el préstamo lo pide para la compra de mas prendas de vestir de temporada para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Según esta primera encuesta se encuentra fuera de la línea de la pobreza, pero de igual manera ella invierte el préstamo en su actividad ya que esto le ayuda a ir aumentando sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Teko Poty” is in its second loan cycle with the Women Entrepreneurs Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another move forward. Most of the women engage in productive business activities. The remaining women have proposed to start a business so that they can increase their incomes.

One of the members is Sra. Karina, who is a merchant. She says that she sells clothes and has an established clientele. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more seasonal clothing so that she can increase her operating capital. According to the first poverty survey that she took, the results indicated that she was above the poverty line. By investing the loan in her business, Karina will be able to generate more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has been raising pigs for years. He earns well from this and has successfully repaid his previous loan used for his swine fattening business. His wife is still vending food and snacks to make money for the family, too. The couple aims to give their children a better education. 

Aside from these activities, Emmanuel is engaged in providing transportation in their village. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new tires to replace the old used ones. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Silda

texts.en:
Silda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Silda has been in this business for six years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 49 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Marites has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, chocolate drink, milk, juice, coffee, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc. 

Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now.

Estrella requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 53 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for three years and earns additional income by buying and selling charcoal.

Teodora is borrowing 8000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Francesca

texts.en:
Francesca is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years.

Francesca requested a loan from NWTF for 8,500 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. In the future, Francesca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nansalmaa, 48 years old, lives with her husband in an old cement house on a small plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling underwear and lingerie at Mongolia's biggest outdoor market for more than 20 years. 

The house Nansalmaa and her husband live in has deteriorated over the years so she is requesting a loan of 8,300,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, shingles, fiberglass, planks, bricks and cement for house renovation. Nansalmaa is reaching her fifties, and she doesn't want to live in an uncomfortable and cold place. This loan is very important to her as old people are more vulnerable to the cold.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell cellphone accessories business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000  through NWTF to buy additional items like cellphone cases, cellphones, cellphone accessories, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like cellphone cases, cellphones, and other cellphone accessories, etc. to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional feed.

Teresita has been pig-fattening for five years now and she has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Ella  es Katherine nació el 23 de octubre, tiene 19 años de edad, termino el bachillerato en el 2013, estudio peluquería, es una persona responsable, sociable, tolerante, correcta, quiere estudiar para conseguir las metas y en progreso como mujer ser muy buena profesionalmente y poderse satisfacer con lo que hace, el plan de acción a seguir podría ser que se encuentra en continuar la carrera de belleza y empezar la de cosmetología y estética integral  pues eso va en una  de las metas y sobre todo tiene que ver con lo que le gusta y con la personalidad.
Actualmente trabaja  en un salón de belleza de los padres, realizando blower y  auxiliar  en peluquería, ella no vive con los padres pero el núcleo familiar se conforma con la mama lucero, ella ha sido la persona que más la ha apoyado en las decisiones, Wilson es el padre, por el cual ella siente un buen ejemplo los hermanos Sandra, leidy, Ricardo y diego  han sido la compañía en el trascurso de la vida, la prima y amiga paula Andrea es la fiel confidente, ella tiene un bebe de 10 meses y es el causante de la felicidad. 
En lo familiar ella quisiera ayudar a los padres y hermanos económicamente,  Terminar la carrera de cosmetología y estética integral, en unos años estudiar admiración de empresas, tener una casa un carro, tener  una peluquería y spa de alta calidad y con excelente servicio de atención al cliente  de forma profesional, ética y exclusiva, con un buen servicio sin incumplir las normas de bioseguridad y  tener la infraestructura adecuada. 
Destaca además la importancia de generar empleo y dar a otros la oportunidad  de aplicar los conocimientos formando un excelente equipo de trabajo, desea también mostrar la diferencia, brindando un excelente servicio de alta cálida y profesionalismo en el área de atención al cliente. 
Eligió  la carrera cosmetología y estética integral porque es una opción muy satisfactoria y lucrativa, quiere estudiar para enriquecer los conocimientos, para superarse cada día. Los aspectos que tuvo en cuenta al escoger la carrera fue tener una proyección a nivel personal a nivel laboral y de vida.  Las razones que la motivaron a escoger la carrera  es que es una plataforma de ingreso al mercado laboral colombiano. 
Ella  necesita el convenio porque no tiene los recursos suficientes para pagar la mensualidad completa, ya que tiene un bebe de 10 meses el cual tiene que alimentar y velar por el bienestar, ella no tiene suficiente dinero para que le cuiden al bebe, ya que en el trabajo no gana más de un mínimo por ese motivo quiere que campo alto y el convenio kiva le puedan brindar el apoyo con el subsidio ofrecido por que en realidad ella si quiere estudiar cosmetología y estética integral y lleva esperando 3 años para esta oportunidad ella les  agradecería de corazón el apoyo.
texts.en:
Katherine is 19 years old and was born on October 23. She finished High School in 2013. She is studying hairdressing. She is a responsible, sociable, tolerant, polite, and wants to study to achieve her goals and progress as a woman. She wants to be a successful professional and be satisfied with what she is doing. Her action plan is to continue studying her beauty course and start the Cosmetology and Aesthetics course. That is one of her goals that has to do with what she likes and her personality.

She works in her parent's hairdressing shop helping with haircut and drying. She doesn't live with her parents but the family is formed around her mother. She is the person who has supported her in her decisions. Wilson is her father who she sees as a good role model and her siblings Sandra, Leidy and Ricardo have been her company through life. Her cousin and friend Paula Andrea is her loyal confidant. She has a 10 month old baby who is the source of great happiness. 

In daily life she wants to help her parents and siblings economically. When she completes her course in Cosmetology and Aesthetics, she'd like to study Administration. She'd like to own a house, a car, have a high quality Hair salon and Spa with excellent service and professional attention to the clients, ethical and exclusive without overlooking health norms and having adequate infrastructure.

She emphasizes the importance of generating employment and having the opportunity to apply her acquired knowledge to build an excellent work team desiring to show the difference, offering an excellent high quality service and professionalism in dealing with her clients. She choose the  Cosmetology and Aesthetics course as it is a lucrative and satisfying option. She wants to study to increase her knowledge, to get better each day. The factors she had in mind in choosing this work is to have a personal, work and life project. The reasons to choose it is to have an entryway to the workforce in Colombia.
 
She needs the loan as she doesn't have enough resources to pay the complete tuition as she has a 10 month old baby to feed to feed and care for it's well-being. She only gets a minimum salary from her work. She she wants the support from the agreement between Campo Alto and Kiva so she can study Cosmetology and Aesthetics. She has been waiting 3 years for this opportunity. She thanks you from the heart for this support.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Brigith

texts.es:
Brigith vive en anticretico con su esposo y su hijo en la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica a la venta de Cds los cuales los adquiere en desaguadero y los comercializa en el Guanay con ayuda de su esposo.

El credito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y establecer un negocio para su esposo relacionado cn la misma actividad ya que le esta yendo muy bien.
 
El sueño deBrigith  es poder comprar en un futuro con los ahorros de su anticretico su casita y darle estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Brigith lives in a rental property with her husband and child in the city of La Paz. She sells CDs that she acquires in Desaguadero. Her products are sold in Guanay with the help of her husband.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital and establish a business for her husband in the same line of work. She is doing very well.

Brigith dreams of buying a house in the future with the money she will get back from her rental contract. This will provide stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy CDs for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun, a mother of three children, is 44 years old and a resident from Kampong Cham province. To struggle for a living, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland and cassava on a three hectare area. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. 

This is the first loan for Lun with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a KHR 2,000,000 loan in order to buy a buffalo to plow her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo to plow her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Enrique Antony

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se encuentra ubicada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, su población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados desde hace tres años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, Enrique brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi desde hace 03 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio.
texts.en:
Enrique is 25.  He lives with his wife and kids in the Zaña district, a community located near the Jequetepeque river valley, which has allowed it to develop by means of agriculture; the population also works in commerce and raises livestock.  This area is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque region in the northern coastal area of Peru.  

Enrique has been selling prepared food for three years with the help of his wife.  He has also provided a public transportation service in his own motorcycle taxi for three years.  Enrique has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy parts for his vehicle so he can continue to offer this service.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson operates his motorcycle transport within his village. He is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy gasoline, wheels, and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Having patience and determination, he believes that he will be able to achieve his goal to improve his poor living status in order to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels, and spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase corn and charcoal

loans.name: Idamae

texts.en:
Idamae is 44 years old. married, and has three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years. She earns additional income from renting computer games.

Idamae is requesting a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí tiene 20 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad hospitalaria que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores cuyes, patos y gallinas, su negocio se encentra ubicada en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevo soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecer a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Noemí is twenty years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotún, a welcoming community that works farming, trading, and raising livestock. It is located two hours from Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

She works buying and selling small animals like Guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens. Her business is located on the upper level of her residence. She is requesting a loan for 500 nuevos soles in order to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals so that she can sell them for a better price.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Kaliyman

texts.ru: Калийман 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Калийман - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Калийман занимается животноводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Калийман, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 нетель, 1  теленок, 1 лошадь, 3 кобылы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калийман обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку кобыл для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Калийман планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Kaliyman is 51, married, and has 4 children. She has a high school education and earns her family's main income through animal husbandry, which she began 21 years ago with a 15,000 som (KGS) purchase of livestock. Thanks to her hard work, Kaliyman now has three dairy cows, a heifer, a calf, a horse and three mares. She earns 15,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, Kaliyman applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum and Partners to purchase mares for breeding. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and save enough money to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy mares

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita, a 47-year-old mother of five, helps her husband operate their own farm to earn a living. 

For many years of growing and harvesting bananas and other crops, the couple has been able to provide for their family.  She has had to be determined in her work to set aside adequate allowance for those children of hers who are students. 

In order to enhance her farm, she requests a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their career, and she would like to ensure better income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ujamaa Ii Group

texts.fr: La cliente Basedeke  est membre de la banque villageoise Ujamaa II. A 53 ans, elle mariée à un homme sans emploie et ensemble ils ont 10 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Avec ce  nouveau crédit, elle va acheter 5 casiers de boissons sucrés. Ainsi, elle souhaite  construire une maison pour ses enfants et remercie Hekima de faciliter la scolarité de ces derniers.
texts.en: This client, Basedeke, is a member of the 'banc villageois' named Ujamaa II. She is 53 years old and married to an unemployed man. Together they have ten children, who all go to school. With this new loan, Basedeke is going to purchase 5 cases of soft drinks. She would thus would like to build a house for her children. And she thanks Hekima for facilitating her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase 5 cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbayar, who is 33 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an assistant worker at a building company since 2011. His wife is a cook and works at a cafeteria. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and so less pollutants are released into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Marcelino tiene 59 años de edad es Transportista, su esposa es la señora Luisa de 32 años es preventista, el matrimonio tiene tres hijos  varones, por quienes esta pareja se esfuerzan por sacarlos adelante y luchar por buen futuro para ellos.
Se inició en el rubro hace más de 6  años, tenía un tractor y con la venta compro un camión y hace más de 4 años también sale a vender carbón empaquetado, su esposa  es preventista y empaquetadora de carbón. Es un matrimonio muy trabajador y luchador.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón, para poder seguir con el negocio que tiene y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelino is 59 years old and works in the transportation sector. His wife of 32 years, Sra. Luisa, is a wholesale vendor. The couple has three sons, so they have strived to move forward and provide a good future for them.

Marcelino has worked in transportation for more than six years. He owned a tractor, but then he bought a truck more than four years ago. Marcelino also sells packaged charcoal. His wife is a wholesaler and is also responsible for packaging the charcoal. They are a hardworking and determined couple.

Marcelino is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of charcoal so that he can continue this business and keep supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Denis Rodolfo

texts.es: Don Denis es originario del municipio de Condega, casado. Es de oficio obrero. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su cocina. Solicita el crédito para mejorar las condiciones de la red sanitaria de su hogar. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. Su plan futuro es cancelar el crédito y seguir mejorando las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
Don Denis is originally from the town of Condega. He is married and works as a laborer. His next goal is to improve the infrastructure of his kitchen.

Denis is requesting a loan so that he can improve the condition of the sewage and drainage system in his home. He expects the loan to be a great help so that his household living conditions can improve. His plan for the future is to repay this loan and continue making improvements to his house.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to the sewage and drainage system in his home.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar tiene 64 años de edad, es un hombre casado, lastimosamente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ningún grado en la escuela, pues la situación económica era muy difícil en aquellos tiempos, él tiene cinco hijos con su  esposa, 4 están acompañados y solo su última hija vive con ellos, trabaja en la agricultura, su esposa teje petates y la hija que vive con ellos es costurera.

Desde muy pequeño, Apolinar se ha dedicado a ala siembre de maíz y frijoles, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a sus padres, pues toda la vida se dedicaron a esta actividad y también es lo más común en la zona donde él vive. 
Él camina hora y media para llegar al lugar de trabajo, su rutina diaria es de 6:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

Apolinar necesita terminar la casa que tiene en construcción, es por ello que solicita este crédito, pues comprará materiales como; bloque, hierro, madera y pagará mano de obra, él confía en que le ajustará el dinero , pero si no es así, hará lo posible de terminar por sus propios medios.

Él sueña con mejorar su casa y que le dure muchos años más, y espera dejarla de herencia a su última hija para que pueda convivir con su propia familia.
texts.en:
Apolinar is 64 years old and married. Unfortunately he was not able to study at school as it was very difficult to pay for when he was a child. Apolinar has five children with his wife - four are married while the youngest daughter still lives at home. Apolinar works in farming while his wife makes grass mats. Their daughter who still lives at home is a seamstress.

Apolinar has made a living growing corn and beans since he was very young. He learned this trade from his parents, who did the same work. It is the most common job in the area where Apolinar lives.

Apolinar walks for an hour and a half in order to get to work. He works from 6am until 4pm.

Apolinar needs to finish building his house and so is applying for a loan in order to buy bricks, iron and wood, and to pay labourers. He is confident that this loan will be granted but, if not, he will do everything he can to finish the house on his own.

Apolinar dreams of improving his house and of it lasting for many years to come. He hopes to leave the house to his youngest daughter so that she can live with her own family there too.

loans.use: to buy bricks, iron and wood, and to pay labourers, to build a home.

loans.name: Erlindo

texts.en:
Erlindo, a father of three, operates a service-based business providing transportation to the local community. It is the main source of income for his family. His wife has started a buy-and-sell business to help him earning money. From his income, he was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

He used his previous loan for buying tires. Recently, he took a new loan to renew licenses and buy some motor accessories. Erlindo hopes to improve his service in order to generate more income from the business.

loans.use: to renew licenses and buy some motor accessories

loans.name: Elmer Mauricio

texts.es:
Elmer es un joven de 25 años de edad, solamente logró estudiar hasta noveno grado, ya que su mamá se esforzó por darle el estudio hasta donde ella pudo, su padre los abandonó cuando estaba pequeño y desde entonces, su madre luchó por sacarlo adelante. Él vive con su mamá y su esposa, tiene una hija de 1 año de edad. 

Con el transcurso del tiempo, Elmer aprendió el oficio de enderezado y pintura de carros, esto fue por iniciativa propia, ahora trabaja en un taller en una ciudad, su esposa trabaja vendiendo en una comercial en el mercado de la zona y su madre vende verduras.


Elmer no posee un negocio propio, trabaja para otra persona y tiene 3 años de estar trabajando en el taller de enderezado; actividad que aprendió desde hace 8 años, debe recorrer una distancia de 2 kilómetros de lunes a sábado, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 AM a 5:00 PM. 

Él solicita este crédito para invertir en materiales para mejorar el techo de su casa, ya que no está en buenas condiciones y puede ser peligroso, además desea comprar un ropero y una cama.

Él sueña con tener una casa mejor, también que su pequeña hija tenga una buena educación, ya que él no tuvo esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
Elmer is 25 years old and only managed to finish up to ninth grade at school. His mother worked hard to give him as much of an education as possible. His father left the family when he was very young and, since then, Elmer's mother has fought to help him to prosper. Elmer lives with his mother and his wife. He has a one-year-old daughter.

Over time Elmer has learned to fix and paint cars through his own initiative. He has a job at a workshop in the city. Elmer's wife works at a stall in the local market, while his mother sells vegetables.

Elmer does not have his own business but has been working for three years at the workshop. He learned this trade eight years ago. Elmer must travel two kilometres to arrive at work. He works Monday to Saturday, from 7am until 5pm.

Elmer is applying for this loan in order to buy materials to improve the roof on his house. It is not in good condition and may be dangerous. Elmer also wants to buy a closet and bad. 

Elmer dreams of having a better house. He also wants to give his daughter a good education as he did not this opportunity himself.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the roof on his house.

loans.name: Usikilivu B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Shalwewabo est une brave commerçante depuis 15 ans et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Usikilivu B», âgée de 34 ans, célibataire et mère de 1 enfant qui est encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse souliers plastiques et sociétaire d’un magasin dans le centre commercial de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 3000 paires de souliers plastiques. Elle démarra son activité par de fonds reçu de son petit ami. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, vêtir et nourrir son enfant. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir choisie sa cible, en soutenant les hommes et femmes entrepreneurs, tout en accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant la période de précarité.
texts.en:
This client, Shalwewabo, has been a good and honest merchant for fifteen years and is a member of the business group "Usikilivu B". She is 34 years old, unmarried, and a mother of one child, who is still very young. Shalwewabo is a vendor of plastic footwear and an associate in a store in the town's commercial center. 

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She is going to purchase 3,000 pairs of plastic footwear. She started off her business with funds from her friend. For the future, she would like to purchase a parcel of land and build on it and to provide food and clothing for her child. 

She thanks Hekima for having chosen her goal by supporting men and women entrepreneurs while granting them loans without the need for collateral, especially during this precarious time.

loans.use: to purchase 3,000 pairs of plastic footwear

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, a married woman who has operated a fish-vending business in the Philippines for five years now, works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Tessie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Francisco Adrian

texts.es:
Francisco Adrian tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad con cultivos de arroz, algodón, maíz su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de soldadura, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, ha solicita préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para mejoramiento de infraestructura de taller, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, cuenta con clientela considerable lo que le permitirá hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco Adrian is 36 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, a community where rice, cotton, and corn are grown. The people here work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located within the Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, on Peru’s northern coast. 

He provides welding services; he has his own tools, and more than five years’ experience in this business. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in order to improve the infrastructure of his shop. This investment will help him to keep his tools and equipment in better condition. He has a lot of customers, which will allow him to grow his business

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of his shop.

loans.name: Diolmer

texts.es:
Diolmer tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, desde hace 10 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevo soles para comprar calaminas para arreglar el techo de su vivienda y una segunda parte para la compra de animales menores y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Diolmer is 26.  He lives with his wife in the district of Buenos Aires, a community whose population works in agriculture and commerce as well as raising livestock.  This community is located in Morropon Province, part of the Piura region in the northern coastal area of Peru.  Diolmer has been raising and selling cattle for 10 years, with the help of his wife.  He has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy corrugated sheet metal to repair the roof of his house, and secondly to buy small farm animals so he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets to fix the roof of his house and to buy small farm animals

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se encuentra cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero desde hace 07 años, comercializando la leche mediante quesos y leche fresca en su domicilio, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una mototaxi que le permitirá traer la leche de su terreno que está alejado de su domicilio y también podrá ofrecer servicio de transporte publico.
texts.en:
Miguel is 43 years old and lives with his wife and children in the District of Zaña. This community is located near the valley of the Jequetepeque River. This location promotes the development of agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry. The community is situated in Ferreñafe Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Miguel has been raising dairy cows for seven years. He sells the fresh milk from his home and also uses it to make cheeses. His wife helps with the work. Miguel is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN in order to buy a motorcycle taxi. He will use the vehicle to transport milk from the pasture, which is a long distance away from his house. Miguel will also use the motorcycle taxi to provide public transportation services.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Rugwasanye Group

texts.fr: Madame Cikuru, présidente dans le groupe de credit Rugwasanye est mère de 10 enfants scolarisés.  Agée de  40 ans, elle est mariée à un homme d’affaire. Commerçante depuis 2003 au marché  central, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter  20 casiers de boissons sucrés, 2 sacs de riz et 2 sacs de sucre. Elle souhaite réhabilité sa maison et agrandir son entreprise. Ainsi, elle bénie Hekima et le remercie.
texts.en: Ms. Cikuru, the president of the loan Rugwasanye, is a mother of ten children, who are in school. She is 40 years old and married to a businessman. A merchant at the central market since 2003, she is requesting this new loan to purchase 20 cases of soft drinks, 2 sacks of rice, and 2 sacks of sugar. She would like to renovate her house and expand her enterprise. So she gives her blessings and thanks to Hekima.

loans.use: to purchase 20 cases of soft drinks, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta vive en anticretico con su madre y su hija en la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa de la zona sur, por las tardes con ayuda de su hija se dedica a la elaboracion de cotillones para fiestas infantiles.

El credito que solicita es para compra de material (cartón, papel, cartulina) en grandes cantidades ya que recientemente le llegaron varios pedidos y no quiere perder clientes.
 
El sueño de Modesta es poder tener una tienda de cotillones, donde tenga los productos listos para venderse.
texts.en:
Modesta lives in a rental property in the city of La Paz with her mother and daughter. She is works as a domestic employee at a home in the southern part of town. In the afternoons, her daughter helps her with making favors for children’s parties.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials (cardboard, paper, and cardstock) in large quantities. Modesta recently received several orders, so she doesn’t want to lose any customers. She dreams of having a shop where she can offer party favors that are already made to sell.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of materials for making party favors.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional goods to sell through her general store business, like soft drinks, creamer, shampoo, canned goods, bread, eggs, and noodles.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell, like soft drinks, creamer, shampoo, canned goods, bread, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Junelie

texts.en:
Junelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from buying and selling clothes. 

Junelie is requesting a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more items such as nail polish, nail cutter, nipper, etc. for her manicure/pedicure service business. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items such as nail polish, nail cutter, nipper, etc.

loans.name: Guineales 1 Group

texts.es:
Manuela (primera de derecha a izquierda en la  fotografía) es una señorita de 29 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a su familia en Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, lo cual lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive; esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo desde muchos años atrás. Esta labor le genera a ella los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento familiar. Ella comenta que le gusta esta actividad porque es honesta y la ayuda a sentirse útil a su comunidad. Realiza esta labor desde niña junto a sus padres desde hace más de 20 años.
Ella decidió organizar un grupo con el objetivo de ayudarse mutuamente con su compañeras y asi mejorar sus niveles de vida. Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos (fertilizante y pago de mano de obra) para mantenimiento de las  plantaciones de banano.
Manuela sueña con incrementar la extensión de sus plantaciones de banano y asi incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuela (the first young lady from the right in the picture) is 29 years old and single. She lives with her family in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Sololá.

She works growing and selling bananas in the community where she lives. She learned this business from her parents, who had been doing it for many years. This work generates the income she needs to support herself. She says she likes her work because it is honest and helps her feel useful to the community. She has been doing this ever since she was a child alongside her parents, for over twenty years.

She decided to organize a group in order to improve her and her fellow members' quality of life and help each other. She will use this loan to buy supplies like fertilizer and pay for maintenance labor for her banana plantations.

Manuela's dream is to extend the amount of land she uses to plant bananas so that her income increases and she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Doña Blanca es comerciante de ropa y calzado y su esposo maestro de obra, ambos luchan para sacar a delante a sus hijos, dos jóvenes de 18 y 22 años estudiantes universitarios, doña Blanca está intentando aumentar las ventas invirtiéndole un poco mas de productos a su negocio, por esto requiere de este primer crédito que está solicitando para comprar variedades de zapatos de damas y caballeros, pantalones camisas y ropa interior.
texts.en: Blanca sells clothing and shoes and her husband is a master builder. They both fight to improve things for their children, two young university students aged 18 and 22. Blanca is trying to increase her sales by investing a little more in products for her business. This is why she needs this loan, the first she is requesting, to buy a variety of ladies' and men's shoes, pants, shirts, and undergarments.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ladies' and men's shoes, pants, shirts, and undergarments

loans.name: María

texts.es: La señora María tiene 54 años de edad, su esposo le abandonó desde hace 4 años a ella y a sus  3 hijos, por este motivo María tiene que realizar todo tipo de trabajo que este a su alcance para sacar adelante a su familia, el crédito lo utilizará para la compra de balanceado para alimentar a sus chanchos, los fines de semana se dedica a vender frutas en la plaza de la ciudad, y los otros días de la se va a trabajar al jornal o también ayudándole a una señora a atender en un restaurante. Ella es una señora muy activa y su mayor aspiración es trabajar para darles la alimentación y educación a sus hijos de los cuales su hija de 13 y su hijo de 18 años se encuentran asistiendo al colegio.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old. Her husband abandoned her and her three children four years ago, so she decided to look for any kind of job that could help her to get ahead with her family.

María will use the loan to buy balanced feed for her pigs. During the weekends, she sells fruits at the city’s square and on weekdays she works as a day laborer or as a waiter at a restaurant.

María is an energetic person. Her main aspiration is to work and be able to provide for her kids and pay for their education. Her 13-year-old daughter and her 18-year-old son go to school.

loans.use: to buy a pig and balanced feed.

loans.name: Geoconda

texts.es: Geocnda es una chica emprendedora, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres y con un hermano, ella es socia de su mamá ya que trabajan juntamente en una tercena donde ofrecen carne de res y de chahcho: comenta que tiene buena clientela ya que les da buen producto y buen servicio. Geoconda sueña con estudiar cosmetologia y estetica corporal, para esto esta reuniendo dinero con el que pueda pagar sus estudios debido a que sus padres no tienen los ingresos suficientes para pagar estudiar la carrera que ella aspira estudiar.
texts.en: Geoconda is a young woman full of enterprising spirit. She is 18, single, and lives with her parents and her brother. She and her mum are business partners and own a butcher shop where they sell beef and pork. She says that they have lots of customers because both the products and the service are good. Geoconda dreams of studying cosmetology and becoming a beautician, which is why she is saving money to pay for her studies, since her parents do not earn enough to do so.

loans.use: to buy pork and beef for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Con 46 años de edad Alicia es madre soltera tiene 7 hijos, pero vive con uno de ellos y con un nieto de 4 años que se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela.   Ella es una mujer muy responsable que aunque no tenga el apoyo del padre se sus hijos, ella pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos y también a su nieto. Alicia se dedica a vender comida en un cuarto y en la vereda, por el cual paga un arriendo. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollo, papas, un chancho para ofrecerlo en su tercena que funciona en el mismo local donde vende lo café, almuerzos,  fritada y comidas rápidas. Ella es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora que aspira que aumenten los ingresos de su negocio para pagar los estudios de su hijo y su nieto.
texts.en:
46-year-old Alicia is a single mother of seven children. One of them and a 4-year-old grandson live with her. Her grandson goes to school. She is a responsible woman, who despite of not having her husband’s support was able to get ahead with her children and grandson.

Alicia sells food; she rents a place in the neighborhood. She sells coffee, lunches, fried food and fast food. She will use the loan to buy chicken, potatoes and a pig to sell, since she also runs a butcher’s store. She is a cheerful and hardworking woman who aspires to increase her income to be able to pay for her son’s and grandson’s studies.

loans.use: to buy chicken, potatoes and a pig.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient and reliable and convenient energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG),

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela has been helping her husband operating their own farm to earn their living. She earns well from this and successfully repaid her previous loans used for improving her farm. She was determined to have more harvest to save a portion of the earnings for the education of her child. In their village farming is the main source of income.  

Currently, Stela took out a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Edgar Joel

texts.es:
Edgar Joel tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad tranquila que su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de ganado caprino, desde hace un año, cuenta con clientela considerable, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edgar Joel is 28 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the district of La Matanza, a tranquil community, where the people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located within the Morropón Province, which belongs to the region of Piura, on Peru’s northern coast.

He has been selling goats for a year, and he has a lot of customers. His wife helps him with his work. He has requested a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles for the purchase of balanced feed in order to fatten his animals, and in this way, generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for fattening animals.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia de 36 años de edad, estudio  hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera, ella madruga a trabajar en una finca y cuando regresa no descansa pues prepara ventas de golosinas (turrones, tamales, pupusas etc) todo esto lo vende en su comunidad,  sus dos hijos van a la escuela y solo ellos dependen de ella.  Anteriormente, cuando estaba soltera no trabajaba pero ya con sus hijos tiene que trabajar para darles lo mejor en vestuario y alimentación así como también lo más importante que es la salud y la educación,  puesto que el padre de sus hijos solo le ayuda con cuarenta dólares al mes y esto no le ajusta para cubrir los gastos de su pequeña familia.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar una deuda que adquirió en otra institución para iniciar el negocio, pero no se puso a pensar que no iba a poder pagar dos cuotas,  cree que con este crédito  le ayudara pues pagara los demás créditos y solamente cancelara una cuota y será mucho menos de lo que actualmente paga. 

Celia piensa en poner un negocio fijo donde le den buen ingreso y asi ya no ir a la finca a trabajar, ella quiere que sus hijos no dejen de estudiar para que puedan vivir diferente, sus ganancias del negocio las invierte en alimentación de ella y sus hijos y estudio de los mismos, piensa que una vez cancele este crédito hará otro mas para seguir con el negocio y aumentarlo.
texts.en:
Celia is 36 years old and has a sixth grade education.  She is a single mother and gets up at dawn to work on a farm and she doesn’t rest when she returns, instead she prepares to sell snacks (nougat candy, tamales, pupusas, etc.) in her neighborhood.  Her children attend school and are dependent on her.

When she was single she didn’t work, but now that she has children she has to work to provide them with food and clothing, as well as an education and health, since their father only provides $40 per month and this is not enough to cover the cost of her small family.

She will use the money from this loan to repay a loan she got from another institution to start the business, but she didn’t stop to think that she would not be able to pay on two loans, but believes that this loan will help her pay the rest of the debts and she will only have one payment to make, which is lower than those she is currently paying on.

Celia wants to set up a fixed business where she will have a good income and not have to go work on the farm.  She wants her children to continue school so that they can live differently.  She spends her business earnings on food for herself and her children and for their education.  She believes that she will ask for another loan once this one is paid off so she can continue growing her business.

loans.use: to pay another loan.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and single.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Judith has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, coffee, milk, shampoo, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Judith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie is from Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is 39 years old and single. Nelie is engaged in a "Suman" making activity, Suman is a kind of food snack that is made of rice and other ingredients. She sells it and accepts orders too. Suman is one of the best delicacies in the province. She has been in the business for 10 years and it's doing well.

In 2010, Nelie applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Nelie asked for financial assistance of PHP 14,900 to buy additional raw ingredients for "Suman" making and to buy materials and equipment used for cooking. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients and equipment for cooking

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is single with two children. Teresita is 59 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Teresita sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase 10 sacks of rice to sell.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Teresita hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie has been selling grilled foods in the market in town to earn a living. She has done this with her husband for more than nine years and she earns well from this. She also successfully repaid her previous loans used for the business. From her profit, Margie was able to buy some appliances for their home improvement. 

Recently, she took out a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional raw  ingredients to prepare grilled food to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw  ingredients to prepare grilled food to sell

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, 40, is a villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four kids, two of whom are in school. For the sake of her family, growing rice and her occupation as a factory worker and her paid working job are the main sources of her family’s income. This is the business that she has had for more than 10 years. 

Including this loan, Sothea is a fifth time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Her past loan, with a successful repayment, has enabled her to cover her living expenses on time. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. 

Additionally, she will put aside some portion of her loan in order to buy wooden boards for her house renovation. She hopes that she can earn enough with her business to amend her home conditions in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 53 years old and has seven children. Lolita is married and has one child who is still in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been in pig fattening for six years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Norma

texts.en:
Ma. Norma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more raw materials for her rope-making business.

Ma. Norma has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ma. Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Yut's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Yut is 44 years old and blessed with six children, one of whom is in school. To deal with the financial burden in her household, she grows rice and has a scarf-weaving business. It is the business that she has had for ages. 

Yut is a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a big group consisting of five borrowers, applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy cotton thread and to pay labor fees. She hopes that she will improve her lifestyle so that it is better than before, so that she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy cotton thread and to pay labor fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Melonie

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Melonie works hard to support her family.

She has a abacca-weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Melonie is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her abacca-weaving business.

Melonie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her abacca (plant fiber) weaving business

loans.name: Senghuo

texts.en:
Senghuo is 31 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family (her mother, husband and three children) in Kanhchriech district, Prey Veng province. She earns a living by farming rice on a few plots of her own land and has been farming rice for more than 10 years. Farming is the sole source of her income.

Senghuo is borrowing USD 2,500 through Hattha Kaksekar Limited to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for her household. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by HKL, Senghuo is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for her household.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en:
Hernan has been providing transportation services in his community for more than six years. He earns well from this aside from farming, the main source of income. His children are successful in their careers and he had to sustain his living. Hernan successfully repaid his previous loan, used for the motorcycle  repair, out from his income. 

Recently, Hernan took a new loan to buy new tires, to replace the old used tires. 

In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business and he wants to save his profit to use when he gets old.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and married with five children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like snack foods, biscuits, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 39 years and earns additional income from farming bananas.

Lolita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods like snack foods, biscuits, eggs, noodles,  and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Pearlita

texts.en:
Pearlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Pearlita has been in this business for 3 years. Pearlita earns more income from pig fattening.

Pearlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Жумагуль 59 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитала 4 детей. У Жумагуль - среднее образование, по характеру Жумагуль очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Жумагуль занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумагуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 19 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумагуль обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Жумагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на расширение сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en: Jumagul is 59, widowed, and raised four children alone after her husband's death. She has a high school education and is very responsible, sociable and cheerful. She earns money through farming and animal husbandry, which she started 29 years ago when she purchased livestock for 10,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Jumagul currently has one dairy cow and 19 sheep. She earns 8,000 som per month from milk and crop sales. She has a 2.0 hectare plot of land where she mainly grows beans, which she sells wholesale. In order to expand her farm, Jumagul applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy cows for breeding. The cows will stay on their own farmstead, supervised by a herdsman in the summer. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save money to expand her barn.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Midokpo Group

texts.fr: MIDOKPO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe nommée Florence celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 51 ans a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. C’est la deuxième fois que Florence sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé. Florence est mariée à un certain Rigobert. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Florence vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour ce faire, Florence vend de façon ambulante du maïs, du pain, du charbon de bois et de l’akassa (pâte à base de maïs fermenté) depuis vingt ans. Florence s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Florence ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIDOKPO sollicite pour la deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MIDOKPO is a group composed of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group called Florence, the lady who has her hand raised in the photo, is 51 years old and attended only up to primary school level. It's the second time that Florence is requesting financial support from  ALIDé. 

Florence is married to Rigobert. The couple have two children, both enrolled in school and living under their roof. Florence lives together with her husband and her children. The couple share in being responsible for the various household expenses. In order to do that, Florence has been selling, door to door,  maize, bread, charcoal and maize porridge (akassa, a dish made of fermented maize) for twenty years. She buys her supplies in a market in Benin. Wishing to grow her business and satisfy the demand of her clientele, Florence, together with the other members of the group called  MIDOKPO is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The prior loan was correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy maize, bread, charcoal, and akassa (maize porridge)

loans.name: Seab's Group

texts.en: Seab is 47 years old and a mother of three kids. She is a resident from Kampong Cham province where cassava is the most popular business in the area among her neighbors including her. Besides cassava, she also grows rice on one hectare of land. This is the business in which she has been involved for more than 10 years and it has returned her about 31,000 KHR per day. This new loan is the third loan for Seab with VisionFund (Kiva field partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely and it has helped her to uplift her lifestyle to being better than it was before. For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer as well as to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she will earn more than before so as she can expand her cassava farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer as well as to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sareoun's Group

texts.en: Sareoun is 60 years old. She is a married mother of four kids. For her income, she relies on her rice-farming business and her spare-time job as a paid-worker. She has been involved in her current business for a long time and it returns an average income of 24,000 KHR per day. This is an original loan for the Sareoun Group which consists of three female borrowers who are requesting of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Sareoun will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop. She hopes that she can increase her income and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash-crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang is 36 years old and a mother blessed with three kids who remain in school. To deal with the basic needs in her household, she does rice cropping and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This business has returned her about 27,000 KHR per day.  

Including this loan, Heang is in her second loan cycle, and her joint borrower is in her first cycle. The past loan, which she has repaid back with success, has enabled her to support her business as well. 

For this cycle, she is the representative of her group. She will spend her entire loan portion to renovate her house. She hopes that this financial aid will help her to fix her house on time, so she can own a proper shelter for her kids.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a reliable and convenient energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas in order to focus on borrowers business.

loans.name: José Efraín

texts.es:
José tiene 51 años de edad, vive en un cantón y está acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo hace de casa en casa en las comunidades, tienen cuatro hijos que ya son mayores de edad cada uno con sus respectivas familias aunque 2 de ellos viven con él  pero cada quien cubre sus gastos.

José se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda la vida, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre. 
Él cultiva aproximadamente una hectárea de maíz, además tiene un carro con el cual realiza viajes a donde se lo soliciten, y se siente satisfecho porque ya tiene muchos clientes quienes contratan sus servicios de transporte

Este crédito le ayudará a José para emprender su propio negocio en la venta de frutas y verduras con su esposa, ellos ven una gran oportunidad de crearse otra fuente más de ingresos, esta actividad la realizarán en su vehículo, él es muy conocido en la zona al igual que su esposa por la actividad que realiza de venta de ropa, y eso mismo le ha permitido conocer muchas personas.

José tiene muchos planes a futuro, entre ellos está hacer crecer este nuevo negocio y posicionarse en el mercado, y con las ganancias ir invirtiendo cada día un poco más para mejorar la vivienda en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
José, age 51, lives in a rural area.  He is in a relationship, and his life partner sells clothes.  She does this by going from house to house in the communities.  They have four children.  The children are now grown, and each one has their own family, even though two of them live with him.  However, each one covers their expenses.

José has worked in agriculture his whole life.  He learned this work from his father.  He cultivates approximately one hectare of corn.  He also has a car with which he makes trips to where he is asked to go.  He is pleased because he has a lot of customers who hire him for his transportation services.

This loan will help José to undertake his own business of selling fruits and vegetables with his wife.  They see a great opportunity to create another source of income.  They will conduct this business activity in his vehicle.  He is very well-known in the area, and his wife is also well-known for her business activity of selling clothes.  This has allowed him to know a lot of people.

José has a lot of plans for the future.  One of these plans is making this new business grow and to position himself in the market.  He will be investing the profits each day a little more in order to improve the house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Proserpina

texts.en:
Proserpina is a 54-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Proserpina has an abaca (fiber from abaca palm leaves) weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

In the future, Proserpina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Hailen Gineth

texts.es:
Este es el proyecto de vida de una joven llamada Hailen Y en el afán de superarse y proyectarse hacia el  futuro, decidió trabajar arduamente de para tener la oportunidad de estudiar la carrera con la que sueña llegar hacer una gran farmacéutica y decidió escoger la entidad CAMPO ALTO para hacer los estudios de servicios farmacéuticos. 
Ella reside bastante lejos del  trabajo y se ve obligada a madrugar desde las 4:00 am para llegar a tiempo al sitio de trabajo, Además de que colabora en la casa sosteniendo a la mama, solicita a la entidad KIVA del 15% en el valor de cada semestre para seguir cumpliendo con todas las obligaciones ya adquiridas.
texts.en: This is Hailen's life plan.  She is a young woman eager to get ahead in life and develop her skills for the future.  She decided to work very hard to have the opportunity to go to school in the field of her dreams and become a great pharmacist.  Hailen chose to go to Campo Alto to study pharmaceutical services.  She lives quite far from where she works and has to get up at 4:00 a.m. to get to work on time.  She also contributes to her household income, supporting her mother.  Hailen requests 15% of the cost of each semester from Kiva so she can continue fulfilling all the obligations she already has.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es:
Manuela (primera de derecha a izquierda en la  fotografía) es una señora de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos; vive junto a su familia en Nahualá, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, lo cual lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive; esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo desde muchos años atrás. Esta labor le genera a ella los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento familiar. Ella comenta que le gusta esta actividad porque es honesta y la ayuda a sentirse útil a su comunidad. Tiene más de 25 años de realizar esta labor.
Ella decidió organizar un grupo con el objetivo de ayudarse mutuamente con su compañeras y asi mejorar sus niveles de vida. Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos (fertilizante y pago de mano de obra) para mantenimiento de las  plantaciones de banano.
Manuela sueña con incrementar la extensión de sus plantaciones de banano y asi incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y proporcionarles terrenos a sus hijos como medio de producción.
texts.en:
Manuela (first one on the right in the photograph) is 35 years old.  She is married and has five children.  She lives with her family in Nahualá, Sololá.  She devotes herself to the production and sale of bananas.  She does this in the community where she lives.  She learned this business activity from her parents, who been engaged in the same business activity for many years.  This work generates the income needed for her to support her family.  

She says that she likes this business activity because it is honest, and it helps her to feel useful in her community.  She has been doing this work for over 25 years.

She decided to organize a group with the objective of having her colleagues mutually help each other.  This way they will improve their standard of living.  

She will use the loan to buy supplies (fertilizer and to pay for labor) for maintenance of the banana crops.

Manuela dreams of expanding her banana crops.  This way she would increase her income in order to improve her quality of life and to give land to her children as a means of production.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilizer and to pay for labor)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (cookies, candy, soap, canned food).

loans.name: Rosas Y Un Clavel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS Y SU CLAVEL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, artículos varios, venta de ropa, venta de material escolar, venta de celulares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana y que ella al contar con un pequeño capital decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo que realizan en su grupo que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Rosas y Su Clavel” [Roses and their Carnation] Communal Bank will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional office.  The group is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors with Marcela as president.  The members of the communal bank are engaged in varied businesses including selling woven blankets, sundries, clothing, school supplies, and cell phones.  

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small micro-businesses where Marcela is a member.  She says that she is new to Pro Mujer, and joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently, she has a weaving business and sells clothing.  She says that she learned this business form her sister and since she had a little capital, she decided to establish her independent business.

She is taking out the current loan to increase working capital (purchase wholesale wool) that she will acquire at the city markets in El Alto, and later she will develop her sales space and market her products.  She lives in a common-law relationship and has two children, and this type of work allows her to generate income to support her family.  When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the work that they do in their group and what the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale wool.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.

Rebecca requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is 58 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Silvestra has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 6,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

Silvestra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell for her firewood vending business.

Taciana has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from food vending.

Taciana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Thouk's Group

texts.en:
Thouk, whose residential area is in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, is one breadwinner in the family, consisting of three kids. To earn a living, she grows tobacco as the primary source of income and catches fish for resale. This business generates about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Thouk has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and her co-borrower in a group of two are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for the plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Antonia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from vegetable vending.  Antonia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her business.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 49 years old and single.

Antonieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items for her general store.

Antonieta has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Antonieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Don Pablo, tiene 52 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 6 hijos, reside en Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.
